description:
An overdue upgrade to Belltower for consistency and being a true neighborhood spot.  

Early misgivings with tough and overcooked ribs are quickly forgiven. The go-to for me here are the pulled pork nachos.In fact, anything pulled pork here is pretty legit. But that plate of nachos is pilled high with lots of cheesy, meaty, spicy goodness. Tender flavorful pork, cheddar cheese, and fresh pico de gallo over crisp chips. So yummy and large enough to share for two. Otherwise go for a classic and dependable burger washed down with some grapefruit IPA. 

The servers are great and Bell Tower has kept their prices steady and fair through the years. It's low key and relaxed. The same few seats outside are prime spots on warm sunny days and with good reason.
author: Jon L.

description:
Cute restaurant that makes you feel like you're on holiday. I love the decorations and the open dining area. It was spacious and didn't make you feel like you're in someone else's space like many tiny SF restaurants. The food comes in large quantities and is pretty tasty. The waitresses that come to our table were so friendly and made us feel comfortable. I would say the food didn't blow my socks off, but it was still pretty tasty. 

Ambiance: 5/5
Food: 3.5/5
Service: 5/5
Overall Experience: 4/5
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
Few good things about Bell Tower. 

They likely don't clean the grill / skillet because you can taste a little bit of everyone else's food when you take a bite out of yours. 
So, that's a bonus. 

The furniture is odd, and the layout is awkward.

It doesn't taste very good, and even though because of this you won't finish your meal, you won't be hungry afterwards. I think this is your body trying to prevent you from continuing to eat food that is served past the date it should be thrown out. 

It thinks: "Wait...something is off here. I'll only turn on the appetite after I know that I'm far away from where ever I'm eating this." 

This is savvy though because it's like you ate but you didn't so good for diets too.
author: Jackson S.

description: Service was good, the potato skin was very good. Would not recommend the crab cake or the spring roles!
author: Ahmadreza M.

description: The portions are huge here! Not sure why it took me 5 years to come to this neighborhood spot. Liked the service. The food is solid... the baked pasta was delicious and the burger patty is about an inch thick. Expect leftovers for a second meal. Good service, no crazy waits. Will be back soon!
author: Young Y.

description:
This place has a pretty relaxed atmosphere, friendly service, and good food.  I ordered the mac n' cheese.  Greatly enjoyed it.  Was surprised that it was actually a little bit spicy.  (This was a nice surprise.) It came with greens on the side, which were nice and refreshing.  I do not think there is much to add, it wasn't too special, but was pretty good.  I would definitely come back here to chill sometime. 
Side note: for me it was a little expensive, but I think the prices are standard for the area.
author: Liz Z.

description: I don't often eat here, but whenever I do, I am never disappointed. The pulled pork sandwich is very good, the fish and chips are fried deliciousness, and the nachos are likely very tasty. The service is solid, and very prompt. No complaints here!
author: Kenny S.

description:
We hopped over to Bell Tower since Nick's Crispy Tacos was overflowing, and we should've just come here first! A wonderful selection on the menu, setting, service, price and food make this a great spot on the corner to snag some great grub on Polk.

The space is cozy, but they have a full bar and maybe one of the smallest kitchens for a full-service restaurant I've ever seen. I was actually a little skeptical how the food would turn out when we walked in, but don't judge books by their size....or something.

I am normally averse to restaurant specials, but the pork loin stuffed with chorizo, peppers, and mushrooms with onion gravy, mashed potatoes and steamed veggies sounded too good for this Iowa-grown boy to pass up, and I was blown away. A great special, all for only $20. My wife got the salmon special and loved it. Dessert was good, too. 

At one point while we were waiting for our food, we kept long-necking dishes being brought to other tables- they all looked and smelled so good! The menu appeared to have a little something for everyone too. Check this place out, you might be surprised.
author: Shane K.

description:
Initially I would have probably given them closer to 3 stars but I add an extra one because I keep coming back and that's no accident. I love the menu here- almost everything on it is something I would order and they always have interesting daily specials. Service can be hit or miss but is usually really friendly and good. They also have the Dogfish 90 minute IPA on draft and it's only $7 for a pint which is a great deal. 

Food wise, things could generally be seasoned better and I wish their dishes had a better sense of balance. I have mostly ordered the rib eye with creamed spinach and fries and it's a very generous serving of steak. The fries generally don't have much salt and the spinach is often under-seasoned also.  That being said, it's a satisfying dinner and I always have leftovers to take home. The pork chop is pretty good too and they have a pretty delicious French onion soup. Most of their dishes come with interesting sides and they also have a full bar and solid wine and beer list. 

Definitely more interesting menu options than your standard neighborhood bar. I wish the flavors in the food were a bit more consistent but overall a solid spot and I'm sure I'll continue coming back. Probably closer to 3.5 stars but I'll round up.
author: Seema U.

description:
This place markets itself in the weirdest way and is honestly so confusing - it is the weirdest fusion of traditional American bar food, Mexican food, and Italian food. My friend brought us here to have "Mexican food" and there were maybe 2 dishes on the menu that seemed remotely "Mexican", one being nachos. However, it seemed like there were a generous amount of pasta dishes on the menu, one being the special for the night. 

Came with a group of 4 and two of us ordered the "special" - beef stroganoff for $18. Now to say I love pasta is an understatement - I literally could eat any type of pasta/noodles and would think its amazing, probably because i'm such a carbaholic, but really it's hard to screw up pasta for me. And I could totally be wrong since i'm not a beef stroganoff expert, but since when does it come with tomato sauce?? The beef was also ridiculously dry and tough and i ended up leaving most of it on the plate. The pasta itself was fine but i was just so turned off by the whole meal and the place so it really wasn't a saving grace for me.

Overall, expensive food, failed attempt at fusion (if that's what they were trying to do), ok service, and average size portions. To make matters worse, the tables were being cleaned with really strong bleach and the stench stayed with us the entire meal. At least I know the tables were clean though? Will not be back.
author: Sam L.

description:
This bar and grill is a nice hidden gem in SF. Found it by referral and glad we went. Took my bf here for his birthday and tried the shrimp cakes and cowboy rolls for the appetizers. 
Shrimp cakes were amazing, full of flavor and lay on top of a bed of salad with tasty dressing.
Cowboy rolls were good too and a bit traditional like a rolled up quesadilla deep fried.
I ordered the surf n turf special. The beef cut was awesome, tender and dressed with a sauce. Dish was paired with butterflied shrimp which was fresh and cooked perfectly.
Overall the dinner was fabulous, service was attentive and atmosphere was romantic for a bar. Little loud and the virgin margarita wasn't great, tasted like lime water which is the 4 stars. I would surely recommend as the food is great!
author: Lacey A.

description:
I'm basing this review on the fact that I would never again consider "dining" here again:

The bad:
1)  The noisiest place I have eaten since I was a kid at summer camp.

The acoustics are horrible and people's voices are incredibly amplified - the woman's laugh at the next table was almost punishing and I could clearly hear the voice of someone on the other side of the restaurant.  When I thought it could not get any worse, they turned on "music" and the resultant cacophony was less than pleasant.  My dinner mate and I continually asked one another to repeat what they just had said.  

2) The service was terrible.  There were two waitresses total to cover both the inside and outside tables.  The result was incredibly slow service and not only slow, but bad.  For example, I finished my beer half way through my meal and was not only not asked if I wanted a second one, but never saw one of the two waitresses pass close enough to even flag her down.

3) I had a hamburger.  Now it is pretty difficult to screw up a hamburger, but it was the oddest tasting, worst hamburger I have ever consumed. To clarify, I did not consume the whole hamburger and I was hungry!  I don't believe there was any sauce, etc., on the burger, it just tasted bad.  As I type this, I still have an after taste from my encounter with that alleged hamburger.  If you want a hamburger, go to a fast food restaurant, save lots of bucks, and get one that tastes like a hamburger should.

I'm not sure if you can award a restaurant zero stars, but I have not tried that tack because my dinner mate tells me that her salmon was excellent, however, I am writing this revenue based on my own personal experience - not someone else's. However, based on her review, I gave the place a whole star. 

As I stated at the beginning of this review, I will not be back - there are too many excellent choices in the area.
author: Sandy S.

description:
I have been here a few times over the years and the food is always good.  I am partial to the Beer Batter Snapper.  The people are always nice and the service is first rate.

Always a good place to hangout at.
author: Eric O.

description: Been here 12 years still my neighborhood favorite! Food, Staff, Atmosphere..awesome place to come day or night.
author: Trina T.

description: The pistachio crusted warm Brie salad was spectacular here! My girlfriend and I came down on a Saturday night around 8:45 and were able to have a seat right away and served promptly. We started by sharing this salad and it was great! The portion was very big and I could have very well had it as an entree. My friend had the cobb salad and she was very happy with it. I had the sirloin steak and it was seasoned well. I am pregnant and had to order the steak well done and it was still pretty tender. Stiff drink my friend had and I'd say that overall it was pretty damn yummy. Portion sizes were huge and the service was great. I'd definitely come back again.
author: Ness V.

description:
super excellent great late food.

I just had thanksgiving dinner here.

Great service, cheap prices for quality food
author: Adam G.

description: Great spot for comfort food. Ordered the french onion soup, ahi tuna tacos, and chicken Caesar salad. All were delicious but the ahi tacos were the highlight.
author: Lauren H.

description: Three and a half stars are about right. I gave four stars because the French onion soup and spinach salad were superb. I might have given five stars but the service attention is sub par. Nice and polite, just not enough attention! Otherwise a great location to have a casual lunch, coffee, or drink. Great sitting outside tables, all tall tables with comfortable chairs and stools. I'll be back to try other menu items.
author: Fredric R.

description: This is one of my most favorite places in SF - great staff, great prices, delectable comfort food and I just love love love it!
author: Lisa E.

description: The bell tower is a great place for lunch and dinner best onion soup in town great sandwiches from the atmosphere nice pricing everything about it is terrific and that's all I got to say
author: Tom F.

description: Favorite neighborhood spot. Consistently good, always! Breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Love this place!
author: Amanda G.

description:
Polk Street is scattered with delightful, adventurous, trendy, and sincerely quality restaurants.  Because of this, I hold a high standard for any restaurant in this locale.  Bell Tower is certainly non excluded from this.

We popped in for an early supper after a day spent watching Sunday football. We sat down immediately and our server addressed us promptly.  I ordered the house red wine and my table ordered a few beers.  Our drinks came very quickly.  We ordered nachos, sandwiches, and a cobb salad.  Again, our order came quickly.

The house red wine tasted like...well, a house red.  It was fine for such a cheap price.  The nachos were served up in a very generous portion and were quite satisfying.  Ditto for the cobb salad.  Nothing we ate was awful, it just wasn't special or anything worth returning for.  

Overall the food is decent.  The vibe was a little flat, perhaps due to the time of week we visited. With so much competition, literally footsteps away, I'm curious about how Bell Tower has continued to stay open.  I mean, they have a PRIME location.
author: Andrea H.

description: I love Bell Tower - I've only ever been for brunch and breakfast, but everything I've had has been so tasty and so filling.  I found out about Bell Tower from a coworker of mine who is from Minnesota, whose friends, also from MN, apparently own or run the place.  I brought my boyfriend here (also from Minnesota), for a Viking game, and the place was packed with such great energy.  I've tried just about everything on the brunch menu and everything has been good.  They are especially friendly and depending on when you get there, have space for "larger" groups as well.  Such a good go to to watch the game and enjoy some good breakfast for quality prices.
author: Maggie A.

description: Megan is the only reason I am not giving this place a one star, I would give this place zero stars for everything else if I could. My girlfriend and I have been eyeing this place for a while and we finally decided to try it today. We sat outside and were welcomed by a very rude hostess. My girlfriend had her açaí bowl from our walk prior and was finishing up eating when the hostess made a very passive aggressive comment on how they "usually don't allow outside food but she guesses it's okay." Besides our non-welcoming service, the table/chairs were really dirty, food was mediocre, Bloody Marys are meh... it's just not what you expect. It's charming on the outside but get ready to be disappointed.
author: Tyler M.

description: I feel this is more of a brunch place that you would come here more for the drinks. The food was good. I can around lunch time since it's so close to my job. It took a while to get my food but had a nice spot to relax outside. I would return with some friends for some drinks if we were in the area.
author: A C.

description:
Great customer service so smiley fast and careful 
I'm so happy with my visit here food was great I had the grilled chicken sandwich 
The servers keep coming by and asking if you need any help 
There customer service both me if I could give this guys 6 stars I would
author: Aviad B.

description: Sweet little bar cafe in Nob Hill. We ordered a Cobb Salad w/o corn and dressing on the side, the salmon special and the quesadillas. The Cobb salad was an ok size and nothing special about it. The chicken seemed to have a pesto marinade on it. The quesadillas were huge and tasty. The salmon was good but done a bit more than I like. The service was very customer focused. I'd go back.
author: Terese C.

description: Considering the location, and the size of the portions, and he environment, Bell Tower has to be one of the better deals in terms of sit down restaurants on Polk. With that being said, the food isn't going to blow your socks off, but it is a solid choice if you are in the neighborhood. I have eaten here a few times, and ordered everything from the eggs plate for breakfast, to the nachos. The portions every time were pretty sizable, and with a beer, my total was never over 20 bucks.
author: Ross S.

description: Super great food drinks and staff. Down home friendly vibe. Want to sing the theme song to Cheers.
author: Julie C.

description: Love this place. French onion soup, pistachio crusted brie, and nachos are always fantastic. Every bartender is personable and fun. Excellent brunch as well
author: Scott L.

description: Went there yesterday for a quick drink.  There was some jerk at the bar who was talking so loudly and cussing freely for apparently no reason.  Had to leave.  Horrible experience.  I got the feeling he is a regular....
author: Karen R.

description: Was looking up a place for a midnight snack. Great burger and we liked how they are open late
author: Sophia H.

description:
I come year after year after the Dreamforce conference. I was amazed that Barbie recognized me tonight, considering I come in 1 night a year. Great atmosphere and the clientele is friendly and welcoming. 

All the food I've had is great (mushroom ravioli, nachos and quesadilla). Good beer selection. Heavy wine pour as well! Thank you to Barbie and the whole team at Bell Tower! I plan on coming back every time I visit this great city!
author: Valerie N.

description: Slow service. Mediocre food. Apathetic staff.  There's really no much more to say. This place seemed decent from the outside, but 15 minutes after we'd been seated with no menus, we started to get antsy.  We should've left but right as we were about to the waitress came over.  The staff was very unapologetic while we nagged several times for everything from water to more napkins to the bill. As for the food, we got a breakfast burrito to split. The plate was decent but nothing special and as I looked around at the food near me, this seemed to be a persisting theme with all of the food being served.  Don't waste your time here!
author: Quinn Li O.

description:
Food was good, service was ok, other patrons were awful.

I wish I could say more than this, but man, the other patrons at our nearest were just terrible human beings. From the conversations, to the attitudes, to the way they treated the waitstaff... it just totally overshadowed everything else. I'd be game to try the place again when I'm back in town, because at this point I don't know if I can fault the establishment for the people who choose to go there.

The reality of the situation is that it's been eight or nine months since I was there, and the most prevalent thing about the experience that I remember is the table next to us (closely followed by my incredibly hungover friend).
author: David K.

description:
The Bell Tower is a bar slash pub on Polk St - I came here for the brunch on a game day (49'ers were on!). We found the only table that was left inside (outside were a bunch of tables, too), surrounded by big plasma screens and enthusiastic football fans. Not the usual crowd to have brunch with but whateva.

Food came quickly - we had the Blue's Omelette (stuffed with bacon and blue cheese, with potatoes and muffin on the side, $11) and Mexican Scrambled (with jalapeno and tortilla on the side, $12). Decent portion size, I didn't even finish mine as the omelette was really big. 

Service was casual and fast. Definitely go here if you like a pub/sports bar atmosphere, and if you're looking for a good brunch alternative around Polk St.
author: Sebastian F.

description: Best chicken quesadilla I've ever had. Fries were also delicious. Fun atmosphere. Good bar food, but I didn't like the house white.
author: Casey S.

description:
FOOD
Fish and veggies
Chicken quesadilla 

All the food I've gotten at bell tower has been good 


SERVICE 
Waitress and bartenders have all been so chill and nice. Attentive too. Love that it serves full menu food, drinks, opens all day and late night, and there's random free wifi floating around 


ATMOSPHERE
it's casual pub like I like three tall high seat tables outside and I like the corner spot with big windows has a nice open feel. Right on polk so in the middle of lots of other things to walk to. 


5 stars Bc I've gone here so many times and it's become a reliable and versatile go-to spot for exactly what I need/want/usually looking for
author: Angela L.

description: Have walked by this place many times and finally made it in the other night with a friend for a late dinner. We shared the potato skins and the pistachio-encrusted brie, and each had a glass of wine. Potato skins were hearty and traditional -  included cheddar cheese, bacon, chives and sour cream. The brie was delicious! We didn't realize it would come with a full plate of salad, toasted bread and plenty of green apple slices, which really made the dish. Could have gone for a larger slice of brie to even out the flavor ratios since we had a lot of salad and apple slices leftover. The bread was also a little hard to bite because it was really tough and chewy, but overall a filling and tasty dish. All glasses of wine only cost $8, which is a great price for the area, but you could tell they weren't super high quality. Service was excellent and the vibe in there was cosy. Really appreciated that they were one of the only real restaurants nearby that stayed open late. Will be going back!
author: Roxie B.

description:
I love this spot! I can officially review this place with confidence as I have experienced this place sober and tipsy. I LOVE the service, the outside tables, the location, and the ample amounts of drinks available. I also love the TVs for watching sporting events (or pretending to watch sporting events so that you have a reason to partake in said ample amounts of drinks...)

I think it's definitely swanky because of the location; however, there is a bit of an edge to it as well. I think I even came here for food! That may have been during the tipsy time...I'm excited to come back!
author: Leena B.

description: First visit.  The Wasabi Crusted Salmon was off-the-charts!  Good atmosphere!  Awesome dining experience to compliment a night out at a lecture.
author: Kerry C.

description: This place was such a pleasant surprise. We tried the mussels, the pork chop, the meat loaf, and the ahi tacos. All were absolutely delicious. The pork chop was one of the best I've ever had, so juicy and flavorful! And the creamed spinach.. oh man it was amazing. And it's open decently late and isn't overcrowded. Definitely recommend.
author: Matthew D.

description:
Best service ever!

The staff was incredibly nice - we were discussing Thanksgiving dinner and she went out of her way to grab us a few cooking utensils to make the ultimate feast. There's a reason this place has been around so long - give it a try.
author: Jason M.

description:
Met a friend here for lunch
of gossip to catch up on,
there was a bunch!

The tacos I ate were tuna
if it weren't so loud,
I'd go back sooner!

Ugh.  I think I should keep my day job.
author: Chloe M.

description: Just had the New York steak lunch special with Demi glaze and vegetables. Very well prepared and portioned with plenty of food on the plate, especially for SF. Service was slightly sleepy considering it's a weekday lunch, I am not having cocktails and I'm giving subtle signals I'm ready to bounce. Price wasn't bad at $19.46 or $22.50 with tip.
author: Danny O.

description:
This is a great neighborhood spot.  The food is delicious in generous portions, the service is good.  I've been coming here for years, and I've  never been disappointed with what I order.  From their BBQ ribs (when they have them) to chicken and Brie sandwich.  

The TV is usually on if you want to eat at the bar, and watch sports.

And, it's reasonably priced.
author: Lois L.

description: Nice brunch corner spot on Polk street that serves the regular brunch fair like eggs Benedict and egg scrambles. I actually opted for a light and crunchy Caesar salad and notice a few folks around me ordering the same. The space is artsy and lots of locals with their dogs come by. It's a great people watching spot. Best part are the reasonable prices for food and drinks.
author: Linda L.

description: Takes a long time for food to come out and receive a check during the lunch hour. Food is inconsistent in quality.
author: katherine r.

description: Not only does this place have amazing food, wait staff, and ambiance, it has a full bar. My friend and I have been going here for years after catching SF shows and staying over for Sunday or Saturday brunch in the city. This place is awesome. Blues omelet. Yes. Pulled pork nachos. Yes. Mexican Scramble. Yes. Bloody Mary(s) yes. I love this place!
author: Jenn M.

description:
3.5 stars

Excellent service with good brunch options! 

I had the french toast with bananas but was surprised when this came with green apple slices. 

* uh, what?! * 

Did the chef just threw in apples on my plate? haha. The play on sweet and tart is cute, but I'd rather just have the classic bananas on French toast. The bf enjoyed the eggs Benedict.

The mimosa is a generous serving poured in a wine glass, but watch out, there's a lot of bubbly in there!
author: Janice C.

description: I love this place! The service is always really good no matter how busy they are! The food is actually really good too. I didn't expect much because it's a bar and didn't have great reviews but I have had some really good meals here. The nachos are to die for! The pasta, ribs, chicken sandwich, Cole slaw, pulled pork are some of the things I've had and I've been pleasantly surprised by everything. Keep it up bell tower!
author: Jazlyn H.

description: Great place for Happy Hour! We had potato skins with sour cream and bacon and they were delicious: YUM YUM! The wine of the house is not bad as well and also the service is great, just perfect spot!
author: Irina P.

description:
Bell Tower appears to be a corner bar - a neighborhood bar where people meet to have their favorite beverage, study their phones, watch sports on TV or talk.  I don't like bars, I don't like crowds of people but I had to burn 30 minutes and my heart pined for a double IPA.  I walk in and there is only one empty stool at the bar.  "God!", I thought, "I have to sit next to someone I don't know, and what if they start talking to me?" - but I walked in and sat down as if that's what everyone does.  "God!", I thought, "Now I got to get the bar keeps attention and she's so busy!  What if she doesn't notice me?"

"What will it be?", she said with a warm smile that was welcoming.  "God!", I thought, "She noticed me!!!" and said, "Double IPA".  She never heard of "double IPA".  She looked at the customers for help.  I thought, "God!  You call this a bar?"  One of the customers said, "Get him a Union Jack."  He looked at me helpfully and said, "You will enjoy the Union Jack."  His cutie girlfriend added helpfully, "It's from Paso Robles."  I looked at her appreciatively and said, "Pasa Robles" annoyed that she said the name as I was unaccustomed to hearing.  "Paso Robles", she said.

The barkeep brought me two samples of different beers.  One awful sweet beer and the Union Jack which was quite good.  "I'll have this one", I said holding up the beer she placed at my left.  She smiled and said, "Which one is that?"  "The one you put to my left."  I was curious to see if she could remember.  She didn't, so I was forced to say, "Union Jack".  "This is America!", I thought, "Why are people in Pasa Robles giving beer British names?"  She brought me a nice pint and placed it on a Lagunitas coaster.  I looked over and saw 'A Little Sumpin' Extra" at the pump and wondered why she didn't give me that one.  "There's a proper name for a beer.", I thought.

A group of men finished their drinks and left.  The barkeep gave them a shout, "Hey!  Thanks!  See you guys later; but don't tell my husband!"  They laughed and I thought, "So she's got a husband?"  Then I thought, "Oh, it's a joke, but maybe she has a husband anyway."

After checking in with Yelp, verifying I have no new emails in the last 4 minutes, I started to watch this college football game and enjoy my beer.  My face was glued to the screen until the bar keep goes up and says, "Anyone watching this?  I'm gonna change it if nobody is watching it...".  I smiled as she broke my total absorption in the game and said, "Not me!"  

When my 30 minutes were up I posted a twenty and waited for change - but needed call attention to my need to leave.  Then a strange thing happened.  She said, "I'm sorry to see you leave!  I wish you would stay longer." - in such a way that I felt so cared for!  I told her I was going to go eat dinner.  She asked where and I said, "The steak house."  She then named off half a dozen and said, "Which one?"  "Harris", I said - and she said, "You won't be disappointed."  Because she was so nice, I told her how much I enjoyed the beer and watching her and her niece (she explained earlier they were related) work.  The bar was full of people and she was the only one taking care of the customers but she gave me her full attention to listen to what I had to say and take the time to appreciate my patronage.  At last, she said, "My name is Debra, what's yours?"  "Steve" I said.
"Steve, I'm glad you came in, and I hope you come back."   Up until then, it was just a bar, but it was in that 30 seconds of attention that was so profound.   "God!  This is the best bar in the whole wide world!", I thought.
author: Steve S.

description:
Enjoyed a fantastically sunny brunch at one of the outdoor tables here on Sunday. 

The egg sandwich was messy, but yummy and my friend's burger looked delicious. The waitress was quick, efficient and friendly - and the bartender was great, too.
author: Kim C.

description: It's very unfortunate that I am having to give this place such a bad review. The first time I came here, I had a great time. Unfortunately the second time around I had an extremely negative experience. I ordered a fruit bowl from the acai place next door but my boyfriend wanted to stop in for some nachos. When we spoke to the hostess/waitress I specifically asked if it was ok to bring in outside food before we even were seated, and she said yes no problem! So my boyfriend placed his order and then I ordered a cup of coffee just to be extra considerate for them allowing me to bring in my bowl. A few sips into my coffee the waitress came back and said she was misinformed and that I could not have outside food. I felt I  was being shamed even though I asked prior to even sitting. So we had to request the food to go and leave. It was a poor experience and I will not be returning unfortunately.
author: Elise M.

description: Bell Tower is a neighborhood haunt with comfort food, friendly service, and a warm atmosphere.  It can take awhile to get served but I think they tend to be understaffed at times.  We find ourselves there at least once a week.
author: A. B.

description:
Live around the block!
The fish taco and the nachos are the best dishes from their menu. 
Service is a bit slow!
author: Oscar C.

description: Love this place . Been coming for years . Best veggie burger I've ever had . Also had the Mac and cheese with jalapeños today . This place never disappoints . Great food and service .
author: Valerie P.

description: Good service.  Great food.  Not too expensive.  I would definitely come back.  Thanks for a great Sunday brunch Bell Tower!
author: M J.

description: Nothing good in here, except a beer.  Calamari disgusting. Service is fair, but sometimes terrible depending on the night.
author: J I.

description: I wish I could give 3.5 instead of just 3 stars. Anyways, the food was mediocre but the service was phenomenal! I forgot our server's name but he was awesome and took care of our table. I came here for brunch, unfortunately they don't offer bottomless mimosas but you can order bottles of champagne and they'll give you a side of OJ. The food isn't the best but it's not horrible. But I would recommend the eggs Benedict.
author: Jenn L.

description:
Seriously freaking awesome! I've been coming here for years and I must say this place has never let me down. 
The food is fantastic! I'm always happy with everything I've ever ordered from here. From the eggs during brunch to the dinner specials to the bar menu sandwiches, the food is always awesome. 
So I brought over the toughest critics I know (mom and grandmom) and even they loved it. 
My new personal favorite is the shrimp cakes. The dressing on those greens is amazing. 
Over all after years of coming here this place has seriously become my go to spot with out a doubt.
author: Cescilia A.

description: Have returned to this restaurant after a break and I found the place was back on track. French onion soup on a rainy day hit the spot and service was friendly and efficient. I definitely will be back.
author: Googie G.

description: Came here on Friday for a date night - first time here. Great service and liked the ambiance. BEST pork chop and my husband was super jealous. (He had the wasabi salmon and it was just ok). I will come back again for sure.
author: stephany m.

description:
Possibly around every corner in San Francisco, there will be a brunch spot. And it's likely to be a hot spot on the weekends and sometimes has a line that goes right around the corner or the pricing is super steep (and yet we foodies still go eat there)...

But at the Bell Tower isn't really any of this. The restaurant is small, but cozy...it also doesn't have some insane line and features very reasonable prices. There is a giant 60″ television in the back too, so my family and I were able to watch the Mavs get destroyed by the Spurs (game 7) over brunch.

But back to the food.

The following dishes were had: Eggs Benedict, Pulled Pork Sandwich, and Pistachio Baked Brie Salad. The eggs benedict were just alright - very standard, not much flair. I couldn't put my finger on it, but it was just missing something. The pulled pork sandwich was excellent though, nice flavor and very hearty on the meat. The shoestring fries were good too...not too oily but perfectly crisp. The runaway winner though was the pistachio baked brie salad. The brie was a very hearty wedge that was rolled in crushed pistachios, deep fried, then drizzled with truffle honey served with toasted baguettes and a light spring mix. The brie was to die for. So good

Looks like I'll have to be back - everyone talks about the ahi tuna tacos!
author: Elaine Y.

description: Cutest little mission looking restaurant. Came for a quick bite, had the bacon pork chop and side of mashed potatoes, absolutely satisfying! My friend had the ravioli, and my sister had the salmon. Everything cooked to perfection, and wait staff are super accommodating!
author: Heather W.

description: Walked in for brunch from the street. Staff are genuine and welcoming. Coffee is strong and flavorful. Ordered basic scrambled eggs and English muffin. Satisfied hunger but didn't deliver on presentation or flavor. It's basic but works.
author: Richard G.

description:
We ran across this place while walking to a theatre and we had some time to kill and were in search of a Bloody Mary. (A hard thing to find in the city before 11:00am) My husband and I sat at the bar and ordered a Bloody Mary and took a gander at the menu. The drinks were very good and spicy (which we both like)... Erik was our bartender and he was very friendly and offered great service. We ordered the Atlas omelette and the fried egg sandwich. Both were DELICIOUS! The omelette came with a side of potatoes, probably the best I've ever had. The side of bacon we ordered was equally good and cooked to perfection. 
Vey happy to stumble across this establishment and we will certainly return. Good food, good drinks, and good service. What more can you ask for?
author: Rachel H.

description: My friend and I each ordered a breakfast burrito. The cook forgot to put egg in both of the burritos. I told the server what happened and he told me that there was egg in the burrito. When he realized he was Incorrect, he offered to take both of our coffees off of the bill. We got the bill and he had only taken 1 coffee off of the bill. I am severely disappointed by the quality of food and service that I received at this restaurant.  I really hope that the owner of this restaurant makes changes to ensure that this does not happen to other customers.
author: Alexander S.

description:
Great place. Good draft selection and the cheese steak spring rolls were just THE. BEST. SPRINGROLLS. EVER.

Order them and a few beers, and be happy.

Oh and the bartender is really friendly.

Oh, and also the free wifi is super fast!!! Like awesomely fast. Like fastest I have ever seen in a cafe/bar/eatery. So you can Snapchat and sext away while you stuff your pie-hole with SPRINGROLLS. Bliss.
author: A D.

description: Dinner out with the besties and couldn't decide where to go. Got lucky and found this place at the corner. Full bar scene with tables for set down dinner as well. Got seated in the back where it was a lot quieter and we can actually hear our conversation. The bar scene looks fun too but it wasn't that kind of a night yet. Especially on a Wednesday night. Lol Looked at the menu posted outside and was set on what we were going to order until we sat down and looked at the menu some more... Decision decisions ... It was super hard to decide after reading the whole menu. So many things that we want to try. Food was really tasty. Well seasoned and big portions. Staff was super friendly and have knowledge of their menu.
author: Fanny C.

description:
Wound up at the bell tower when we needed a late dinner around 10:30pm on a Saturday, and the other options nearby were limited. We started with the chicken wings, which were random low quality frozen chicken parts tossed in okay buffalo sauce. Don't recommend them. Then my friends both had the pulled pork sandwich (based on good yelp reviews) - looked like microwaved pork on a Wunder bun, served with cheap fries. Also do not recommend. I had the quesadilla which was served with chipotle aioli on top. Who does that? Also wouldn't recommend it. Generally cheap ingredients put together for a low quality dish. 

Only got the 2nd star for the fairly extensive beer menu.
author: Christina G.

description:
I am definitely a fan of The Bell Tower! Favorite things - bloody Marys!! Outdoor seating. Brunch. The fact that it is right across the street from Lombardi Sports (so I can go right after Sunday rooftop yoga at 11am). 

I've only been for brunch (3-4x), but I'll keep going back!
author: MaryKate M.

description: Came here on thanksgiving! Excellent service and great food. Nice local atmosphere!! Got a three course meal for $30!!!!
author: james g.

description: Best neighborhood bar/restaurant! Great bartenders. Great food.  This has become my living room and I couldn't be happier!!!
author: Dave B.

description: I had breakfast here and it was a cool spot.  I sat outside and enjoyed a beautiful SF morning.  The food was good and the service was good.  I will be back :)
author: Jennifer M.

description: Good enough food, but haven't had great experience with the service. I live close to the restaurant so would love for it to be a regular spot, but each time I have gone, the service is barely up to par. One time it took almost 30 minutes for us to get our check after clearing our plates and asking for the check. Other times it takes 20 minutes to even have someone come over after we have sat down. It is never that busy, so definitely not an excuse. Rarely are we asked if the meal is to our liking once received as well. Again, decent food, but below par service.
author: Kate M.

description: I was really happy with the breakfast menu. In a world of a thousand brunch spots, the Bell Tower has a solid menu with a ton of options and it's priced well. Great staff and rarely a wait. The breakfast quesadilla is bomb and the bacon and potatoes are delish!
author: Katie S.

description:
I literally can not say enough good things about Bell Tower.

We recently ate there on a Saturday with night with a party of 25 a few days before our wedding in the city. There are no words to describe the quality of service that we received from Bell Tower. Our server Megan was out of this world. We saw her not only managing our table but other tables down below in the restaurant. She was so personable and so attentive to us at every point in the night. I can't thank her enough for how well she treated us and our families. It was easily the best service we received the entire time we were in San Francisco. 

The food was also amazing. Between our party size we probably ordered one of everything on the menu (and several of the appetizers) and no one had anything bad to say. We had a vegetarian, pescatarian and a gluten intolerant person in our party, and they all found plenty of selection. They also had a great wine menu! 

I would highly recommend Bell Tower to anyone visiting San Francisco! Make sure you ask for Megan, you won't be sorry!
author: Teri D.

description: I love this place. The dishes are really good and big! The staff is so nice! I would probably it once more before my vacations here in san francisco finish.
author: Julia C.

description: Got seated really fast. Their menu is simple and has a variety  of food which I love. The food and drinks were great along with the service. Coming back for sure!
author: Bryan B.

description: Food was good. Pizza was hot & cheesy. Perfect crust. Bad service though. Slow & we didn't get our second drink until we were about to leave.
author: Erika G.

description: Hands down the best service and staff in the city. The energy in this place is always amazing. The staff is warm and friendly and the daily specials are yummy. I've been here a few times now and it just keeps getting better and better.
author: Danni P.

description:
We showed up here after we 1. Didn't realize the House of Prime Rib was open and 2. The bar we were trying to go to said it was open on Yelp but when we got there they changed their mind to 5:30 

Service was slow, had to go ask for menu's but once the drinks came with were good but messy , would have been nice to have a napkin since it was spilling everywhere when it arrived. 

We didn't try any food so can't comment on that, don't know if I'd return...
author: Alecia S.

description: Came here on a Monday night for dinner. My husband had the spaghetti and said it was very good. My dinner was totally satisfying! A thick cut pork chop, tender and well cooked, accompanied by a cheddar jalapeño bread pudding, crispy on the outside, tender inside. With it was a sautéed collard green, bacon dish that was the perfect compliment to the meat and pudding. Probably should have saved half...but ate every delicious bite! And the price was very very reasonable!
author: Brenda Z.

description: I eat here six times a week. Love the food. Love the location. Love the staff. Love the patrons.
author: Joe F.

description:
The French onion soup was outstanding. My wife had the brie/apple salad and she proclaimed it the best thing she had eaten on our two week trip so far. I also had the pulled pork sandwich and it was very good.

If I lived in the hood this would be my watering hole. The bartenders and servers were fantastic. Seems like it gets very busy (for a reason) so pick your times. Also one of the cooks had an awesome photo bomb when we asked the server to snap a shot of us being as it was our last night in SF. Nice job dude! Showed him the pic and he laughed.

Overall a great place that was recommended by a friend who used to live in the area otherwise I never would have found it. Check it out!
author: Yelpers Are The Worst P.

description:
Unattentive hostess saw us waiting outside for 25min. We made eye contact 3-4 times but she ran past us, we figured she was just busy. Then she tells us she is going to seat the two parties that were just arriving because they grabbed her arm first. Tried to explain but she was not having it.

Come on guys, we all have busy days but when you know something went wrong, try to fix it. No one will complain about that.

Five stars because food is usually great but felt the need to give some honest feedback.
author: Johan H.

description:
I come to this place once a week for a beer and lunch since I work up the street. It used to be lacking but the guys that took it over have done a fantastic job on customer service, hiring great staff, and just generally turning the place around. I'm loving the lunch specials and the talents of the new chef. He makes amazing meals that complement the decor and atmosphere wonderfully. The day and nighttime bartenders are engaging and fun. They pour yummy concoctions that keep the vibe rolling. I mean how many places have a corner view of Polk, floor to ceiling windows, outside dining, well made cocktails, nice people, and good food? NONE folks... Except Bell Tower. 
The only thing I would recommend for the owners here is to expand the interior design. You guys have great 1930's Art-Deco pieces in the place. But the salmon paint and some of the dated features need updating. Think Metal laminate, refresh paint, and maybe something to tie it in with the gorgeous wood that makes up the bar. Let's lighten it up and make it sleek... Watch movies like "sky captain and world of tomorrow". And check out pages like this for inspiration. 

https://m.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.495453087155979.115952.478795175488437&type=3
author: Mark B.

description: Love love this place! It's been here for years, for good reason.  Place is chill and relaxed, with solid food & drink options.  Super great place.
author: Kim W.

description:
1- bartenders are rude
2- cocktails are weak and over priced
3- crowd is homophobic (obviously they forgot they were  in san francisco!) and pretentious 

really do i need say more? pass it by, there are so many more bars why bother with this crap!

**i recommend**: mcteagues, robber barron, shanghai kellys, original joes' in north beach
author: Risque B.

description: Very friendly staff. The buck stops there, unfortunately. We waited half an hour for our mussel appetizer, which was pretty sub par. The place seems to be a bit confused S to what it is. Nothing memorable. Can't see returning.
author: Emily H.

description: Loved the food!   Tries the pulled pork quesidilla and it was awesome.   Pork cooked just right.  Will definitely be coming here again.
author: Aman H.

description:
Good casual brunch/dinner spot. The outdoor seating is nice for sunny days. I've been here quite a few times and love the Brie crusted with pistachio and honey, Chicken Sandwich w/ spinach, Mac & Cheese and shrimp cakes. There have been a few specials that were good too.

I wish they allowed for substitutions as I don't like the fries....

Also, they beer list is pretty weak as I feel they need more IPAs and wheat beers...just my opinion
author: Leah B.

description: Great prices. Really great service - our server and hostess were very friendly. The pulled pork nachos were right on the money.
author: Madie H.

description: Went here with friends while i was in town. The food was fantastic. I ordered the mac and cheese with broccoli, they ordered the nachos, mussels and half pound burger. Everyone loved their food and the mac and cheese was so creamy and delicious. Great compliment with a small green salad. I would come here again in a heartbeat.
author: Chris B.

description:
Fun neighborhood place to grab a drink or a light meal. Subtly divey feel between the cheesy artwork and the greasy spoon food?

Try the pulled-pork nachos, or just drink ;)

Outdoor seating score: 5
Cute high top tables outside of its not breezy, plus I've seen a french bulldog meet-up happen at their outdoor area a few times. Double cute.
author: E F.

description: Really well-priced and tasty late dinner spot on Polk. Bar and restaurant are barely, but well separated... Strong drinks with good beers on tap
author: Kerry G.

description: I love this place I have been eating here for over since I was 7 I'm 25 now. I also worked across a street from them for 8 years and spent many lunches and dinner there. The bartender are great really can pour a got drink and keep you entertained.
author: Michael D.

description:
Came in on Saturday to watch the Giants game/ drink a beer/ eat some food.

long story short, ended up getting accidentally charged 700 dollars for a 70 dollar check. I was told that the charge wouldn't go through, but it is Tuesday now, and I still don't have the money back in my account and I'm completely broke because of it. 

two stars because the fries were good; also there was a dog outside and he seemed pretty chill.
author: Jason P.

description: Good food. Open late! Was searching for anywhere to eat at 1130pm on polk. Some friendly bartenders from Cabin a block down told us to try this spot. We were not disappointed and will definitely come back. Thanks Bell Tower for being an oasis of late night grub.
author: Shannon D.

description:
Great diver bar with food. Had brunch with some friends the other day and left very full and a little buzzed.
The bartend knows how to fill up a gin and tonic!!
author: Jay S.

description:
Meh. This place is nice for drinks, but not so great for food. We started here for drinks and the afternoon bartender was awesome. She was funny and provided great service. We came back for dinner expecting the same service, but the night staff was much less friendly. The waitress even mocked the style of beer that I ordered to another guest before bringing it to our table. Then, I ordered a salad and an entree and the salad came out WITH THE MEAL. I hate that! Who in this world ever wants a salad WITH their meal? ...so I can sit here and munch on a salad while the rest of my food sits there in front of me getting cold... No thank you. When I finally got around to my pulled pork sandwich, it was just not good. Cold BBQ on a 10 cent hamburger bun. My partner ordered the veggie pizza. That was actually pretty good. Nothing to rave about, but good, nonetheless.

I'd still come back for drinks in the afternoon to see the early shift bartender, but I wouldn't come back for dinner.
author: Joseph K.

description: Been here more than a couple times for dinner. My boyfriend and I enjoy this place especially for their ribs. So good. We've been trying other things too. Had the Mac and cheese with chorizo and broccoli the other day and it was so good! :) it always looks busy for brunch, but perhaps we will try it out sometime.
author: Yer L.

description: Had dinner tonight while the food was excellent , the service was quite slow and the noise level above that at which a normal conversation could endure. If you looking for a sports type bar with above average food check it out.
author: Mark G.

description:
Been here at night and for brunch. For brunch, it's perfect for when you:

A) are looking for a place without a wait because you didn't make a reservation anywhere else
B) need comfort food, no pretentiousness
C) don't really mind (flat) IPAs on draft, or if you're easy with an alternative beer
D) are with your significant other and can't decide on Italian/American/Asian food
E) want fast attentive service
F) need a full kitchen open late

Then you're golden. Loved my experience here.

With that said, Bell Tower is MUCH better for brunch or watching a game. Their bloody marys are on fleek.
author: Casey L.

description:
Stayed in the neighborhood during my last visit to SF and the guy at the front desk recommended this place. We decided to give it a try on our first night out and boy it was delicious! We ordered the baked pasta from their entree menu and it was enough for the two of us! We went there again last night and it was game night so a bit crowded but waitress did everything yo accommodate us. Hubby got the carnivori pizza and I got the goat cheese and spinach  puree stuffed chicken and both were awesome and plenty! (We had to order boxes for the left overs). They have free wifi too which was a plus for us! 
Worth the visit!
author: Maridalia G.

description: This place is our local place - we have never EVER had a bad meal and we've been coming here on a regular basis since we moved to SF, almost 3 years ago. They recognize us (we live around the corner) and they know what drinks to serve us as soon as we sit down. It's just a combination of good American food with a few Italian dishes, a few Mexican, and some good bar food. Great place to watch a game at their bar, too; good vibes although if you're eating there when a game is going on, it can be a little loud but that is certainly not their fault. Their 3 cheese pasta is delish, the ribs are awesome, the chicken sandwich is great, the portions are large (I always have enough to take home for lunch). The servers are always friendly, they're always smiling - you see the same faces so you know they must like their work because they have really low turnover. They always come by to see if everything is alright and if there are any issues they have always dealt with them quickly and painlessly. Very good value for your money. It's just a great place. Recommend it -- and we have brought many visiting friends here.
author: Robin L.

description: Food is good but if you are very hungry this is not the place for you, their service is kind of slow so you have to wait to be attended by one of their few servers but they are nice so you really can't complain. :)
author: Emily Ann F.

description:
personable wait staff
great atmosphere
good brunch, good dinner
author: Matt M.

description: Hardly a friendlier, more consistent, fun neighborhood bar to go.  The food they crank out of the small kitchen is amazing!
author: Blynn B.

description: Great neighborhood bar!  What to do when you want to watch a football game that's on at 10am?  Too early for the typical bar food/game snacks for me.  Luckily here you can watch football AND have brunch. Today's special was a Chicken & Andouille Sausage Hash, which was pretty darn good! Also, nice selection of beer, both the usual domestics and craft, whichever mood you're in.
author: Riz W.

description:
Great spot for Brunch or lunch. Always check their specials !!!
Great place for watching sports. Just a fun, casual environment. And the staff is really friendly.

I usually get their Mexican Scramble  for Brunch which is similar to a Huevos Rancheros. Mimosas are great too. Bloody Mary comes without celery, olives or any garnish, but you can request Olives, limes, lemons etc.... they dont have celery =(

This place is a fun neighborhood spot.
author: Sepi N.

description:
I had dinner and drinks here on Saturday night with some friends. The waitstaff was great and the food was tasty. I was recommending this place to some friends until last night... Three of us who ate there were up all night with horrible food poisoning!!! The only time we had all been together and eaten the same thing was dinner at the Bell Tower! 

I have bever gotten food poisoning before. And I have never been so sick in my life! Shame because I liked the food and had a great time, but after this, I can definitely say that I will not be coming back!
author: Christina P.

description:
Had to grab dinner late, so we had limited options, but this place didn't disappoint. Usually anything with less than a 4-star rating gets overlooked these days, but I feel like people forget about the satisfaction that inexpensive, simple food can bring. 

I got the French Onion soup; broth was a little thin but as a whole it hit the spot. The waiter even offered me bread and butter! Boyfriend got the Carnivore pizza, and despite its bad reviews, he enjoyed every last bit of it. 

Service was low key but lovely; our waiter checked on us without being pushy or rushing us. It probably helped that it was 10:30pm and the place was nearly empty. 

All-in-all, no complaints here! Our bill was under $20 - can't beat that.
author: Amy J.

description:
Dined here only once because it was across from Lombardi Sports where they hold rooftop yoga every Sunday. 

I had one of the specials which was the pulled-pork eggs Benedict of which I uploaded a photo.  Tasty. The sauce was light and perhaps watered down, which I preferred because it meant it had less calories for me.  I don't like too much cream and butter in my breakfast/brunch.
author: Christine V.

description: Great, friendly neighborhood eatery with a friendly staff. Good place to chill on Polk street
author: Ess C.

description:
I have dined at Bell Tower many times, as my bestie lives right up the street. The best part about this restaurant is the outdoor seating. If you are lucky enough to arrive there and there's an outdoor seating, TAKE IT! The people watching on the corner of Polk street is the best. You will see good looking people, you will see cute dogs and you will see some freaks... If you're lucky!

The food is pretty good here. I've had their Caesar and their nachos (make sure to ask for jalapeños). The service is pretty good, as well. The only reason I'm taking a star off is because their Ketel martini is extremely small. Don't order it unless you aren't trying to get tipsy! 

All in all, cute spot and great beers!
author: Anastasia N.

description:
Bell Tower is a fun place with great food, reasonable prices, and a friendly staff.

It's hard to get good, fresh soup in this area, but I can count on Bell Tower to have at least two options. The menu is varied, with brunch (Sat-Sun), lunch, bar, and dinner menus, and they serve food both early and late. Their fries are ridiculous, and the spinach salad rocks.

The staff is super friendly, and when I needed to accommodate large party on short notice, they made it work (lucky me!).
author: K K.

description: Good drinks and great prices, interesting crowd, the food looks amazing, nbut we didnt try it.
author: David C.

description: Love the Bell Tower.  Seriously great bar food.  The prices to me are excellent for the city and for what you get.  I find myself wanting to go here when I don't want to cook because it's friendly and good and a great value.  Kick back with a glass of wine and a pizza or have a beer and the fish and chips.  I've probably eaten 2/3 of the items on the menu and haven't disliked anything I've had so far.
author: Greta R.

description: Sunday Football, crowded bar, decent beer, and loaded pulled pork cheesy nacho piles. Service was slow and didn't seem super organized, but nothing to be upset about. Low key spot.
author: Zara S.

description: LOVE love love Bell Tower!!! The food and drinks are consistently amazing and their staff is so sweet.
author: Margot G.

description: I've always enjoyed lunch/brunch here, but was shocked at how good dinner was. My girlfriend and I sat at the bar where we were well taken care of by the bartender (owner Barbie Tice, she's the best). I had the grilled pork chop with savory cheddar cheese & jalapeno bread pudding & sautéed southern greens with bacon. It was amazing. One of the best tasting meals that I've had in SF. I will definitely be coming back for dinner.
author: Da Wei S.

description: Great neighborhood place to grab drinks and hang out outside on a nice day.  I haven't been here to eat yet, but the food looks pretty good!  They have TVs and always have a decent crowd if you don't want to brave the rowdier Polk St bars.
author: Raina D.

description:
I'm perplexed with the reviews for the Bell Tower.  Since when have Yelpers become so generous?  I think the location is cool and it is a nice option for sitting outdoors when its sunny (that one week in September), but nothing, and I mean nothing on the menu has made me stop and say "Hmmm, that was a pretty damn good (insert foodstuff here)".  My general rule of thumb is if I can make it better myself, well then I do...of course not if its an especially lazy Sunday, then I don't.

Living two blocks away has afforded me the chance to stop in a number of times.  Plus they have that magic thing called beer which has bewitched me!  I've had the tuna tacos, the pulled pork sandwich, the special chicken sandwich, (which was so bland and bad, my roommate and I proclaimed it the worst use of the word "special" we've ever encountered on Polk Street and if you know Polk Street, there is a good bit of "Special" going on here).  

Today, was the final straw.  I've vowed to not go back for food again.  Ordered the fish and chips and it was bland.  Surprise!  Not really.  I saw that twist coming before the butler ever made that suspicious phone call at the end of Act One.  But honestly, I had to over salt everything.  The fish batter tasted exactly like the fries, or was it the other way around?  Change your frying oil, get it.    

I see lots of folks raving about the mac and cheese...maybe if I am feeling extremely forgiving or its part of my AA program (making peace with the past and shit...never mind), I might, just might give this place one more shot...maybe.  This place has let me down more than Dexter AND my whiskey dick, combined.

It's not bad, its just not good.
author: Mark C.

description:
Stopped by for a late lunch. Luckily it wasn't super busy, and we were able to grab one of the tables outside. Definitely an awesome spot to sit and enjoy the beautiful weather.

This place is definitely more of a sports bar than an actual restaurant, but the food was good for the price. The downside was that there was no cocktail menu (I like trying out unique cocktails designed by the restaurant), but if you know what you like, they have a full bar that will accommodate all your drink requests.

Unfortunately, service was very spotty the day that we were here. There were two waitresses and it was clear they weren't communicating with each other - for example, one waitress told us she'd bring small plates for us to share, and the other came back and told us that she wasn't going to bring us small plates. I was also overcharged on my credit card (wrong amount charged when we split the bill), and while they did revise my credit card receipt at the time, I kept an eye on my credit card and I was never refunded for the overage, so I had to call again to get it amended.
author: Emily Z.

description: We come here from time to time to either get a drink at the bar or grab a quick and casual bite to eat. The last time we were here, we enjoyed the burger and the spaghetti. The spaghetti was a little overwhelming with the amount of garlic in it. Other than that, just a simple home cooked meal.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: Not bad, nice environment in that they had huge clean windows you could see the outside world from, so that was very pleasant.  Looked like some of the pane windows would slide open in warmer weather as well.  Ordered the seared tuna which I normally assume to have a rare center which this didn't, so a bit disappointed in that regard but the flavor was great with pineapple, soy and some heat.  had Kim Crawford Sau Blanc by the glass which I'm a fan of for reasonable price too... house wine was even more reasonably priced
author: Jeff H.

description:
Anytime I walk by while shopping on Polk Street, I always noticed this place was always consistently busy, so before catching a theatre show, I suggested trying dinner here.  

We got there early on a Friday evening, and luckily got a table right away right in front of the big screen TV during the 7th game of the World Series - cool!  My friend and I aren't huge baseball friends, buy hey that's all right.  And it was cool because, later, we saw a stream of Critical Mass bike riders go by (some in Halloween costumes) - so cool!  :)  It's a very comfortable feeling place in a great location.  Great place for us to catch up, and the food was yum!!  

We both started with a glass of Malbec - mmm, nice way to start the weekend...awww...  :)  The menu looked yummy with lots of good ol' American food, but we were both sold on the baked salmon special with saffron tomato sauce, gnocchi and vegetables.  I try to eat fish at least a couple times a week, so this was perfect!  

I loved the salmon, and they put a thick tomato sauce that you could add to the main sauce as you liked, and it was very flavorful.  The salmon was cooked to perfection, and the rest was light and healthy.  Mmmm!  It almost tasted like good homecooking - loved that!  

Yummy, good ol' solid American food with super friendly service and we left in plenty of time for us to catch our show.  I will be back!!
author: Maile N.

description: Amazing food, fantastic service, great prices, definitely worth a trip!  Locals love this location for a reason, it's not a tourist trap, it's a place you want to frequent every week.
author: Brandice A.

description: We live in the neighborhood and it is always our go to place. We love the menu and the staff is always outstanding! Our family always requests to eat there when in town. Best brunch in the neighborhood.. BEST BLOODY MARY in town... And the best French onion soup I have ever had.  We love the entire menu and always the best specials. We even have reservations there on Thanksgiving.. And couldn't be more excited.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
This place has kind of a limited menu but all of the food we've tried has been really good. 

I recommend the Caesar salad with Salmon. Sunday brunch menu also looks amazing and they have a nice outdoor seating area. 

Great place for watching sports. Just a fun, casual environment. And the staff is really friendly.
author: Rebecca G.

description:
Love, love the vibe here! You're greeted the moment you walk in and thanked as you walk out! The entire staff treats you like family, such a great atmosphere. 

My 'musts' are the tuna tacos, stuffed chicken dinner, & the turkey dinner but you won't go wrong with whatever you decide!
author: Hamburger Yelper O.

description:
Barb is the best east of... Wait west of MissISYeppie.

Only gripe - BAN the eCigs from being smoked inside the Resturant.
author: Madhusudhan R.

description: Best late night food and bar scene. I eat here 3 nights a week and it never fails to please. Everyone who works here is a star. This place is what Cheers in Boston aspires to be. Neighborhood bar personified
author: paulina k.

description:
We ordered one omelet and received another.  Since the wrong omelet had no meat in it, I told the waitress that I was fine keeping what she delivered but was requesting a side of sausage to make it right - she was fine with that.  However even though I ate as slowly as I possibly could, the sausage came when I only 2 bites of my meal left. And rather than links or patties as I thought I would have gotten, I was delivered crumbled sausage - which I though was strange.

I guess this place is ok - I would give it another chance.
author: Amy W.

description: The bell tower is a great neighborhood bar.  The food is really really good, the regulars are really nice and fun, the bartenders are fantastic.  It's an overall good time!  Definitely one of my favorite places on polk st.
author: Allison R.

description: Great brunch spot.  Always able to get a table or drink and wait a few minutes for the good food.
author: Chris H.

description:
We used to come here all the time.  It was the perfect place to bring a big group or even picky eaters because they had so many different things on their menu. 
Then after their renovations were completed we excitedly went back, but found that we'll probably never end up going back.
Went there for lunch on a Sunday around 1:45pm and was told to look at the brunch menu by my rude, red-haired waitress when I asked if I could see the lunch menu.  
Lunch conservatively kicks off at noon, and by nearly 2pm it is time to get the stale, disgusting eggs out of here and stick to what they're good at. 
Not only that, I wouldn't be asking for a lunch menu, if I had seen anything that was not drenched in egg on the brunch menu.  Leaving me with three options of egg, nachos, or a side salad at 2pm on a Sunday during football season has resulted in our group of friends swearing off this place for good. 
It used to be that you could walk into this place for lunch or dinner and they would have a little bit of everything and great specials like jambalaya.  They had these fantastic fish tacos and a pistachio crusted brie salad that were phenomenal but alas, these days you better be hunting for some benedict if you go to this place. 
I wanna put this in all caps so that people on Yelp might be able to understand this easier: 
BELLTOWER IS A BREAKFAST JOINT BEFORE THE HOURS 3:00 PM DAILY. IF YOU DONT WANT EGGS, THEN DONT GO TO THIS PLACE. 
So say it's a Sunday and you wanna meet up with friends and drink some beer and eat some wings and watch the football games .... Bell Tower is no longer the place to do this.
author: Alex A.

description: Great service. Food came out fast and was piping hot, which is always a plus! I got the farfelle pasta and it was so good! Probably enough to share with two more people, or at least one! The garlic bread was very good as well as the side salad it came with. Great fresh lettuce tossed in a light dressing, probably balsamic. We got the steak spring rolls as an appetizer and those were great. They came with a cheese sauce and a bbq Sauce. My sister was eating the cheese sauce plain! Ha! Will be back next time I am in the area
author: Alex E.

description:
I have been coming to The Bell Tower for a few months now and I am impressed with the brunch and dinner service. I mostly come for brunch on weekends and have been impressed with the omelettes and benedicts at a reasonable price point of $9 to $10 as they are generous portions and cooked perfectly. 

This is a great neighborhood spot that has great bar type food at a very reasonable prices for the neighborhood. I'd recommend this place to anyone. 

My only complaint would be I ordered a Bloody Mary last weekend, Sunday April 13th, 2014 and it came without celery, olives or any garnish whatsoever and makes me hesitate to order another one again.
author: Brian D.

description:
After entering "California st" instead of "Carolina st" into the gps on our way to another brunch, my friend and I decided to bail on crossing the city and settled on this place. Somehow,as if the gods of brunch were looking out for us, we managed to walk in and snag a table for two right away. 

The interior here is right up my ally. It is fairly small with maybe 12 tables, and feels like an italian cafe, with warm colors, lots of big windows and nice streetside seating. I also enjoyed that while somehow being packed enough for some great people watching, it was still quiet enough to not have to shout over the table.

We ordered and were quickly brought two rounds of mimosas and some breakfast, which honestly wasnt really worth mentioning. Just eggs and some other stuff mixed together, not remarkable. But to answer the important question - would I come back here? Yes.

Come for the food, stay for everything else.
author: Courtney L.

description:
I think the Bell Tower is a great spot for bites and for a little drinkey drink. I'd be sure to see Blake the bartender if you get a moment. She is on it! Don't worry if it's busy, the service is still excellent.

They have a good mix of sports fans and dinner-goers, and a small amount of outdoor seating. I find the menu to offer a nice variety, and all of the prices are fair. Great happy hour spot!

Finally, I want to recommend them for groups! They have a nice ambiance, and a nice layout although they aren't a giant space for groups.

Try the cowboy spring rolls, and the rum cocktails :)
author: Kelly B.

description: I love the bell tower. The staff here is beyond friendly and always makes sure you are taken of. They treat you like you are family. The menu isn't massive but has enough options to keep everyone happy. I like there wine and beer selection. The specials are always on point and what I order. I've never had a bad dish here. The hard part is finding a seat at the bar it's always packed with locals and regulars. I love small outdoor seating they have. It's a great spot to share a bottle of wine with girls and have a snack. I tend to come here on my lunch break to enjoy the local company. They are really a hidden gem of poll street.
author: Erica T.

description:
Nice place for lunch/brunch 
fish and chips are not like it was two years ago...  mussels were fresh and good
author: Astha S.

description:
I have walked by this place a million times and never stopped for dinner or breakfast. For the area - it's actually pretty cheap breakfast. I got a breakfast burrito, guac, sour cream and homefries etc for about $9. It was a fairly large plate of food which is exactly what I needed.

I've also had their burgers and they are decent. Best part about this place is the outdoor seating on nice days and their very friendly staff. Also conveniently located on Polk in the center of the action.
author: Carlos A.

description: Generous portions, comfort food to the max (the mac & cheese w/broccoli). Recommend!
author: Mel G.

description:
My girlfriend and I popped into this place to get some brunch at one of the tables outside (one of those rare SF sunny, warm days).  A guy and his friend sitting next to us recommended the Eggs Benedict with Pulled Pork, and it was one of the best damned breakfasts I've had in a while.  

The server was awesome and attentive and I couldn't help but recommend the pulled pork to the guests taking our table after we left.
author: Ted T.

description:
I've been here a few times now.  I'd say it is a last resort kind of place.  The food is ok but nothing noteworthy.  They are trying to go beyond the ordinary bar grub, to their credit.  But the ingredients just don't add up to a memorable dining experience.  Plus, the service is marginal at best.  

Case in point...today I had lunch there with a colleague.  The server was apparently in a rush....but I looked around and saw several open tables.  When she came to take our order her tone was short and abrupt.  Wow. Ok.  It's Friday, I'll let it slide.  Then she asks if we want refills on our beverages....totally different drinks....we say yes and she returns just a couple minutes later and gives me the other guys drink.  If this place is hopping busy, I would totally understand.  But it's half empty and she can't remember who had which drink?  Oh my.
author: Kurt L.

description: I've been to Bell Tower several times. The service usually starts strong and then tapers off throughout the meal. On multiple occasions, the person serving me was switched mid meal. I don't usually find that to be a problem, but it seems to be a systemic issue. Staff seem to struggle with dealing with the mealtime rush. Each time I've been there, there is some level of confusion about what the food or drink order was, etc., as a result of the disorganized service. The food is ok, but I would hesitate to recommend the restaurant.
author: Kate T.

description: Omg the nachos are amazing!!!! Very generous portion and they did not skimp on the toppings. Perfect chip to topping ratio!
author: Kristin D.

description:
So sad with our last experience at Bell Tower! We have been drinking there awhile, since we moved to the neighborhood, and thought we should try brunch. It was hands-down the worst dining experience ever.

Chicken tamale "special" -- cold and filled with bones. DISGUSTING. It was sent back and when it came back out, it had been dumped onto a separate (ice cold) plate and nuked. We couldn't believe it. Not only did the cooks think this was appropriate, but the server had no qualms about placing this mashed up bone food back in front of us that looked like something you would never in a million years serve your dog. Ever. 

Horrible service, we were treated as if we were being difficult, and we will never eat there again. Go to Bell Tower to drink ONLY.
author: Laura W.

description:
My Favorite Neighborhood Spot!

Mostly locals looking to grab some rays outside on a sunny day or catch the end of a game. I go here all the time and love it. I don't know why it doesn't have better reviews! What do people expect? It's a bar with good bar food--- not a place to get a 4 course meal! Still it's family friendly and the service is good.


Ahi-tuna tacos are the best!
Pork Nachos yum!
Chicken sandwich with Brie amaze!
Bloody Mary's are stiff:)

What could you want more from a neighborhood spot?
author: Casey S.

description:
A friend and I were going to meet at Nick's Crispy Tacos for dinner one day. When we showed up and saw the lined out the door and starting down the street we rethought our choice and ended up at The Bell Tower.

While this spot is classified as a restaurant I would say it is more bar that serves food and less restaurant that has a bar. For starters the menu is fairly limited. Besides that, it is way loud in there, making conversations more like shouting matches and less like intimate affairs.

The food I ordered was quite tasty though. I chose a spinach salad with salmon, balsamic onions, goat cheese, and walnuts. While it was basic, it was big and it was good so I would order it again. However, I hear the real highlight on the menu is the burger so I could always be swayed to try that next time around.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Thank you Bell Tower for being the best neighborhood spot in Nob/Russian Hill :) It's approachable for all and just a friendly place to spend an hour or many hours. The service always comes with a sincere and heart-warming smile, is efficient, smart and just works. It all stems from the top so thank you Barbi! The food is inexpensive and delicious - hello caesar salad delish! and the burger, nachos, ahi tuna tacos, ribs, wings and rib eye can't be beat. The daily specials are quite yummy as well and keep the menu options fresh.

The Bell is just the perfect spot to stop into for an entire afternoon and/or evening and also is great for a pre-event drink or night cap. It is also open every day of the year until 2am hello consistency and caring about being part of its patrons hearts and lives. Thank you really for being so fab :)
author: Leah B.

description:
What do How I Met Your Mother, Friends, Cheers, and It's Always Sunny in Philly have in common: they all make you lust for a neighborhood bar that is scarily close to your apartment.

Well... the Bell Tower is my MacLaren's Pub. I live about 40 seconds away and I couldn't be luckier.

Pros:
1) Beer selection is decent. They carry a good pilsener that never ceases to please me.
2) Food is way better than your average bar. I'd choose this place over many restaurants in the area. Go for the tacos and burgers. 
3) Servers are always friendly and eager to chat. Good looking too.

Cons:
1) No one jumps and screams my name every time I enter the bar. I guess TV doesn't portray the real thing after all.
author: Nick A.

description:
We found this place on Yelp when searching for brunch, but it should instead be classified as 'a sports bar that happens to also serve brunch'.

No egg whites allowed. This always confuses me at brunch places. Why not just charge extra for egg whites?

French toast was so-so: nothing special, but not bad either.
