Eggs Benedict was really bad. The ingredients were cold and old. The sauce was terrible. The potatoes were undercooked.

Will not return.
author: Captain B.

description: This is my first Yelp review (or any social media review for that matter) but this place was so good I felt I had to share. Stumbled across this place over the Labor Day weekend. Great setting with outdoor seating and huge windows that make the indoors feel like they are outside. I ordered the pork chop and was blown away. This was the biggest, juiciest chop I have ever eaten. I'm not sure what cut this was exactly but it was bone-in and the meat was thick enough to resemble a roast. Grilled to perfection medium rare. The jalapeno cheese bread pudding was a unique and tasty savory side as were the greens. My wife ordered the salmon and was every bit as impressed as I was.  We will be back.
author: Frank E.

description: Not terrible, but nothing special at all. There are far more interesting options in the area. It does have some outdoor seating, which attracts dog owners, and is nice on a good day.
author: Kira G.

description:
Alright, I would have given the food 3 stars, but the service of our waitress dropped it down to 1 star. 

First off, when we walked in to see if they had a table for two, we saw that there were lots of empty tables inside.  The waitress asked us how many we would be, we said two, she waived her hands and the empty tables and said "sit anywhere".

Now, there was only one two-top, and the rest were four-tops.  I walked over to the four-top next to the window as it was a nice day and the tables outside were all taken.  The waitress comes over right away and I ask if it is ok if we sit there.  SHE THEN ROLLS HER EYES AND SAYS, "COME ON GUYS, FOR TWO?"  What the hell is that?  We both put ourselves through school working in the restaurant industry. In no circumstances would I have EVER said something that snide to a customer. 

We move upstairs to a two top, the BUSSER comes by and takes our drink and food order before she even comes by to check on us again. He was great by the way. Before anything comes out, I see a table opening up outside. My wife asks the waitress if we can move out there, she says there is a list.  No problem, except for that she takes the time to come by again a few minutes later to tell us "If you wanted to sit outside, you should have told me."  Again, don't lecture the customer, that's crap.  Also, it wasn't an issue of outside being another server's section.  She was the only one working.  

Food was, meh.  Burger was ok, Polker's down the street is better and cheaper. My pulled pork sandwich tasted fresh out of a bag from Trader Joe's or something.  Not very good, not awful.  

Server ignored us for the rest of our stay other than these interactions listed here.  The Busser was great, he came by loads of time while we witnessed our waitress standing at the bar chatting with the bartender.  

Overall, I'm not coming back.  Lived in the neighborhood for a while now, and there are lots of other great spots.  Not worth it living in a city with such great places close by to have a ok meal and horrible service.  If the owner reads this, whoever was your waitress on 08/26/2012 around 2:30-3:00 needs an attitude check.  She is costing you business.
author: Max G.

description:
I'm reviewing based on two experiences. 

Experience #1 - Ordered the porter and they were out, disappointing, but not the end of the world. I was recommend a dark ale and it was all sorted out. For food I ordered the pulled pork quesadilla. Really tasty, the pork was cooked perfectly. Very delicious and massive portion. Money well spent. 

Experience #2 - Was about five days after experience #1. For drinks, my friend wanted to try the house red, and was trying to ask where the wine came from. Our server was clearly not educated in wine whatsoever, the table had to explain to her that wine will be labeled regionally if it is from Spain. We were treated like idiots because it was the "cheap wine". Tsk tsk. If you can't sell a house wine, you're not going to sell the expensive wines, dear. 

My friend ordered the pork nachos. These were like experience #1 and really tasty when I tried them.

 It was Fat Tuesday so they were doing a New Orleans themed menu.. (I'd like to interject here and say that I lived in the south and spent much time in Louisiana. I know my Cajun/Creole well. ) I ordered the gumbo. The scents were on point. The flavor? Well, I couldn't taste the flavor because the salt was so heavy. When I asked to have my food replaced the pretty little blonde server tried to explain (but really just) lecture about what food is seasoned and what food isn't. She kept freaking out over anything with salt, told me that the pork chops are smoked and that adds a natural saltiness. At that point I was so annoyed (and hangry because I was the only person at my table without food) by the girl speaking to me like I don't understand seasoning, that I ordered the burger. Which came to me totally underseasoned..really? Sigh, I'm not hypersensitive to salt people. The gumbo was just overseasoned. Geez.

 I will say, Mr Man Bun server was very helpful, understood when I switched my food, was super friendly, educated in the menu and its ingredients, and really was the only reason I didn't flip out on Blondie. I don't have a bad temper, but I do when an uneducated server is trying to tell me that smoking food adds salt. (Again, LOLz... girl please) 



So many LOL'z. So many. Please, please train your staff and don't run out of my favorite (and, apparently everyone else's) drinks. I will add more stars.



 Two stars for experience #1 the pork quesadilla/nachos **

 One star for experience #2 with man bun saving the day. Thank you sir. Keep rocking the bun. *
author: Katherine H.

description:
Stuffed chicken breast, Mushroom Ravioli, House special Salmon, all delicious!! 
The goat cheese inside of the chicken had such a good unique tasty flavor! Nothing was left behind on our plates.
author: Yvette U.

description: Went here recently, it was good but not great. I split w/ my brother, between the fried egg sandwich and the veggie burger. Both were reasonable dishes, but nothing special. My meat-eating friends seemed to like it, however, so maybe next time I'll try the breakfast burrito without the chorizo. This was actually one of the less pricey brunch places though, and it wasn't too crowded when we got in (10:30 on Saturday, right when they opened) so if you're looking for a place to go it might be worth a shot.
author: Amaresh S.

description: We were looking for decent food but didn't find it here. The bar appeared to be the reason for this establishment, heck, even the cook in the back was drinking alcohol. As soon as we noticed that, we figured the food wouldn't be a highlight, and we were right. The only reason it got 3 stars and not 2 or 1 was because of our waitress who did a good job tending to us. I visit restaurants mainly for the food and as such I wouldn't return.
author: Arturo T.

description: Have ate here a few times, and have yet to have a bad meal. Service has always been great. The noise level with all the hard surfaces can be frustrating though.
author: Michelle K.

description: Cozy atmosphere - excellent draft beer - ok for kids - Brie with pistachios delicious - hot wings were legit made in the kitchen. Nachos were so good ! Enough for 2.
author: Tanya J.

description: Had a salad and soda for lunch. Price was good, staff was polite, food was good. This place is easy to over look but I had a very pleasant time here.
author: James M.

description: There's a reason Barbi has been voted one of the nicest bar owners in SF. Barbi and her staff are some of the coolest people in my neighborhood, making it way too easy to spend inordinate amounts of time at the Bell. The vibe at Bell Tower is so rare these days and Nob Gulchers are lucky to have this charming gem on the corner.
author: erika h.

description: Im neither here nor there on this place. Brunch is fun but the foods not killer. On a beautiful day they open the large windows so it feels like your sitting outside, they also have outdoor seating which is rare in SF. I would rather be day drinking here.
author: Kristan B.

description:
I'm traveling on my own in San Fran and wanted a friendly, relaxed place to watch the Giants game with a cold beer... The Bell Tower was just right!

I sat at the bar, got served straight away by the friendly staff and within ten minutes, had made friends with some chatty locals. It was the perfect way to enjoy the game/a drink in a social environment in a totally non-threatening environment. As a solo gullible-looking female traveler, it can sometimes be a bit intimidating being approached in a bar (even when people are completely well-intended). The Bell Tower patrons were so friendly and helpful, I felt like I was home... 

I didnt eat but the food i saw/smelled seemed yum. there was a good selection of drinks... Free wifi (why do so few SF venues have this?) and lime in the corona (why is this so rare in SF?) were the icing on the cake!

It's not a great bar if you're expecting/wanting a typical bar experience (aside from anything, a good chunk of the place is restaurant) but its a nice place for a few quiet drinks, some friendly chit-chat and a decent view of the game.
author: Guida B.

description:
I come to Bell Tower often.  This place always delivers a positive experience.  There are not many places that have a neighborhood hangout vibe and still nail the food. 

For dinner i like to order the mac n cheese, add jalapeños and broccoli, and ask that they cook it well done.  

The mussels and chorizo are always on point.  

For brunch you cannot go wrong with the burrito with fresh salsa or huevos rancheros (when its on the menu). 

Barbie is the owner/sometimes bartender and when shes working, go chat her up.  She has been open for 20 some years and thats not an accident.
author: Jesse R.

description:
I was very pleasantly surprised with the Bell Tower. I walked by this place so many times on Polk, but decided to give it a go one sunny day.

They have some of the best nachos I've had in the city. I shared a plate with my girlfriend and barely had room for dinner. Appetizer? Or mountain of wonderful on a plate right out of the oven.... Regardless, I could make a meal out of just the nachos.

First time I went there I tried the Bell Burger. It's a pretty standard burger, but quite the bang for your buck. I couldn't move for 20 minutes. Pair that with a margarita and you'll be in a belly-love-coma for the rest of the afternoon/evening (fantastic margaritas, by the way).

Lastly, the fish and chips weren't anything to write home about. A bit too soggy and somewhat disappointing. But I love this place too much to give it anything below five stars.

Be sure to catch brunch here, too! Hell of nom noms.
author: Tyler H.

description: I'm giving them a 5 star review. This place exceeded my expectations exponentially, the staff had wonderful energy, and the food was pretty damn good. My wife and I walked in around 9pm on a Saturday looking for a low key drink and dinner. My wife is rather picky and tends to look at menus like suggestions. They created a wonderful vegetable plate and a meatball appetizer for us that wasn't on the menu. We would come back. Bonus = it wasn't overpriced.
author: Gil S.

description: Both times I been here was for brunch.  I had the lox eggs benediton and the borrito.  Both times the food was great. Great and inexpensive.....my favorite thing about this place.
author: Julie M.

description:
I come to the Bell Tower all the time, the atmosphere is fun and friendly, the food is great and the staff is awesome (especially Barbi!) not to mention how impressive it is that they do everything from such a tiny kitchen 

Recommendations: Tuna Tacos, Nachos, mac and cheese 

This is definitely my favorite neighborhood spot, if you're not a regular here you are missing out!
author: Blake P.

description: Friendly staff and great food that came out quickly. They also serve food late and it's very affordable! Try the Mac & cheese it comes with a really good side salad
author: Caitlyn S.

description: Great food, great service, love the location and decor.  Full bar and serve brunch with outside seating without being "divey" on Polk street.
author: Michael H.

description:
Late night eats in Russian Hill. This is all I should really have to say.

The waitress was also hospitable and inviting and the setting is sort-of romantic if that's what you're looking for.

Oh, and they have a pistachio brie that is the best damn thing ever.
author: Marvin P.

description:
Perfectly F%&*$ng Excellent.
I realize that I am rating a neighborhood place, and being it that, they have knocked out of the park.  

Neighborhood quality:
Food you ask?  Awesome. Burger: great.  Pasta: even better.
Staff and service: Hands down great.  

Great location, and great place.
author: Dr I.

description:
one word: awful

We stopped by around 11:30am for a quick bite.  A few empty tables, not a busy time, yet the service was very slow?!?  We asked for coffee with Bailey's and they brought us COLD coffee with Kahlua, and he had the nerve to tell me, "it's the same thing, do you want it or not?"  I didn't make a big deal about.  We ordered, then watched as other tables, who came in after us, get their food!?!  Are you kidding me?  When we finally got our food, you guessed it, it was cold!

If you want a $31.00 cold egg breakfast, with cold coffee, then this is your place... 
pathetic, noisy, dogs, sticky tables, chipped paint on the walls, 
this place is a joke.
author: C J.

description:
The Bell Tower is close to my apartment, so I've been a couple of times, and it's been pretty decent each time (except for the time I sat outside... service was incredibly slow and it seems as though the servers just forgot there were outside tables). 

Aside from poor service when sitting outside, the Bell Tower has been good. They have good drinks (the bar tender is always very nice!) and the food is good, though the menu is pretty standard (nachos, wings, pizza, calamari, burger). It's a solid bet for a drink and bar food, but it's nothing special. Not terrible, not fantastic. Perfectly acceptable if you can't find anything else nearby!
author: Kate B.

description: This was a good place to stop and have a drink in the middle of the afternoon. We went back later for dinner and found it to be disappointing: slow service, the cheese and mac was overcooked and flavorless, the mushroom ravioli was nothing but mushrooms - again, no variation in the seasoning -, the shrimp cakes, too, lacked flavor. On top of this, they have an acoustic problem; it was so loud we and our dining companions could barely hear each other.
author: Jack And Barbra D.

description: Awesome bar... Like Top Gun Awesome.  The patrons all know the lyrics to whichever Journey song is on, and the drinks are stiffer than grandpa on Viagra.
author: Brendan W.

description: I'm all about the Bell tower..... I can't get enough of the rib eye with the cream of spinach on the side.  I had the scallop special today with a cream sauce and it was delicious.  I just love coming here before going out on Fridays and Saturdays but I love seeing Barbie here during the week.
author: Haley G.

description:
The boyfriend and I came here with a friend on Sunday to thank him for bringing my car back. Apparently Jaime got a little too "poppin' bottles" the night before and couldn't drive home. But dammit, those Dos Equius were good.

When he and I split the Breakfast Quesadilla, we both immediately regretted our decision. This is NOT a plate to split, people! This is a plate to enjoy to yourself. We ordered a side of bacon and when I finished my meal, I didn't even eat the bacon until there was nothing left to savor. 

Also, there was a Bull Mastiff PUPPY there. GOOD LORD. If you ever want to see me hyperventilate, take me here. The puppy, the food and the atmosphere is certainly enough to cause you to pass out from happiness.
author: Jaime L.

description: Came here while visiting friends in town, we'd been searching for a bunch restaurant on a Sunday without an extremely long wait. We happened upon The Bell Tower accidentally and we were very happy! The staff was very friendly, the food was delicious, and it was reasonably priced! Definitely enjoyed my visit here.
author: Cherie E.

description:
I'm not sure why this doesn't have overall great stars but I definitely think it should. 

Literally everything I've had here is great including food and drinks. The Mac and Cheese is AMAZING, calamari = perfect, pizza = creative and delicious, etc. Also they make a pretty delicious mohito. The boyfriend and I ALWAYS bring people here because its down the street AND its super delicious. It's a little pricey for my taste for dinner, but the lunch menu is pretty reasonable. All of it is really worth it. 

The service isn't amazing, but it's pretty good. And the ambiance is also pretty chill. Definitely try the mac and cheese. :) (Obviously only if you're not vegan of course.)
author: Catherine C.

description:
I live a block away and they serve food till midnight so I came because it was convenient.  I came again, over and over, because it feels so great.  The servers are so nice they must be on something.  But when they bring me pulled pork nachos, ribs, tuna tacos, pulled pork sandos, pork chops, salmon salad or wings (and beer) I get almost happier than they are!  And it's like family in there.  One time I witnessed the entire staff take a shot with a guy (at 1pm) to make him feel better.  He had driven down from Santa Rosa to have lunch and cheer up after his dog passed away.

The food is awesome.  The whole bar smells of nutmeg and cinnamon infused honey.  The only thing this place doesn't have going for it is that everyone can see you inside ... and they get jealous.  The chicken wings are some of the best I've ever had.  The veggie burger ... why would you order the veggie burger when the Tuna taco should be on a Food Network show and the mac and cheese is, well, awesome mac and cheese!!!???  Insider tip: they'll make it chorizo mac and cheese, or buffalo mac and cheese, or pulled pork mac and cheese if you ask.  I heard they have store bought dressings and sauces (like Tapatio?) as well as pre-made items you can choose from, if you don't like their home made from scratch every day daily specials.  There's a real love for family, food, and booze-in this restaurant.  I think the staff stets the tone here because the crowd that comes in is so nice.  It's like a deuchbag free zone where I have no problem plopping down at the bar by myself for supper and mixing it up with the people sitting beside me.
 
To summarize accurately: AWESOME PEOPLE, AWESOME FOOD, AWESOME SERVICE.
author: Luke W.

description: This Little gem is one to remember! From the quirky decor to the amazing seasonal specials at a decent price you will not be disappointed , this place instantly makes you feel like family.
author: Brandy R.

description:
It's artificial.

Good thing: www.youtube.com/watch?v=TT9j1CZmc0A

Delicious thing: Grilled chicken sandwich with balsamic onions and spinach. Extra buck for fruit on the side instead of fries. Loved it.

Breezy thing: Grab a seat by the open window on a warm but not too warm day. Best of both worlds.

Bad thing: Server cost them a star. Inquiring how we are doing when you are already walking away made the whole affair feel artificial. Felt scripted and almost a burden.

Food is authentic. Service could use more authenticity.
author: Jason B.

description: Barbie is the greatest bartender ever!!! The food here is awesome, but the personal touch that barbie brings to the place can't be matched! Definitely stop in if you're in the area!
author: Brandon G.

description:
Great service.  Everyone is super nice and depending on how many other people are watching TV they'll put whatever sports game you want to watch on the big screen.

Good food!  Yummy mac n cheese, potato skins, buffalo wings, salads... whatever, it's all good.  Nothing life changing, but it is what it is and I have nothing to complain about.

Also, there are a few outdoor seating tables.  Perfect for warm days!
author: Jessica F.

description: I work in the area and always find my self here. Food is always delicious and the cocktails never disappoint. Love this place.
author: Erik W.

description: Never mind the classic food combos as well as the contemporary fare offered at this icon of Polk Street, let's not discuss the fantastic people and chefs that seem to be in house at all times, instead let's heap praise on the new pillowy cushions on the bar stools! Yay! Perfect for those Friday lunches that turn into afternoon snacks, and then dinner all because of the "terrible" time you're having!
author: Gregory F.

description:
I was surprised by the quality of the food here. We waited way too long to get food after going to the Wine Bar and all the kitchens were closing on Polk St. The super friendly bartender at Street pointed us to the Bell Tower (she was so helpful and nice, mental note to come back and thank her for the recommendation). 

My date and I both ordered the mac and cheese and it's warm gooey goodness was delicious. One of my favorite mac and cheese dishes in the city. The waitress was sweet and put up with our drunken fascination with the over-sized purple chair in the dining room. At this point I had already had two glasses of wine, so I did not try their drinks but my date ordered a margarita that seemed tasty.
author: Dani D.

description:
If you are looking for a late night dining option on Polk Street, this is a pretty decent option.  I had the Mussels with Chorizo there twice and it was very tasty.  

The service was super friendly on top.  Will go back for sure.
author: Manuela P.

description:
It's about 10:30pm and my friend and I decide we want a meal. Look up some Yelp reviews, and decide to check out a place, but when we there there, (Street), said the kitchen was closed and sent us 3 blocks up to the Bell Tower. We ordered 2 drinks, Calamari, and split the mushroom pizza. 

The mushroom pizza was GREAT, the calamari was pretty okay, and the drinks were the same. If I lived in this area, I could see coming here for a late night drink/meal, but I don't know if I'd go out of my way to come here during regular hours. 

Overall, a pretty solid place, but it would be my late night choice.
author: Sumina B.

description: My family's favorite neighborhood restaurant! The staff is excellent as well as the food. We love coming here! The Hoisin bbq ribs are my favorite. The brunch menu is stellar! Love you, Bell Tower!
author: Juliet W.

description: Average fare, and average service in this area of San Francisco.  It's good for breakfast or lunch, but plan to take some time...it's a cute setting, can be quiet, food quality was real good, just slow to arrive.
author: R J.

description:
I have lived nearby for years and never made it here - now I am so glad I never did!!  

Wow - talk about HORRIBLE.  The staff is completely incompetent, and it takes forever to get anything from them.  The food is not horrible (and cheap - so if that's all you are looking for it's ok).  But the waitresses were rude, clumsy, and could not even take a basic order for 2 people.

The wine was spit-it-out-now-it's-so-horrible, yet cost $7 for a tiny glass.

And somehow the crowd was full of interesting types I've never seen in the neighborhood - at least that part was entertaining, if a bit disconcerting.
author: Stacey R.

description:
We stopped in here because we were quite hungry and it was the closest spot. Needless to say that for a randomly chosen restaurant, it was a pretty tasty selection.

My BF had the special which included wasabi mashed potatoes, pork tenderloin with  topped with a mango salsa, and grilled vegetables. He enjoyed the meal but felt the wasabi mashed potatoes was a bit over the top (an awful lot of wasabi which for him was odd since he is used to eating wasabi). I tried a bit of the mashed potatoes and thought it was a unique blend.

My meal was the mushroom ravioli which was delicious. Now admittedly, it was a heavy entree which is not normal for me but given how hungry I was, it was a perfect fit. The mushroom gravy was delicious and quite cheesy which complemented the ravioli rather nicely.

Prior to our entrees we had the salt and pepper calamari with the chili dipping sauce which was fantastic. It was a perfect blend and the calamari (being deep fried) didn't feel too heavy or too breaded.
author: Shauna S.

description:
Absolutely did not expect how great the food is and have been in the neighborhood my entire life.

Super service with a great bar with TV's throughout.

Will be back again.
author: Randall F.

description:
Surf and Turf Special! Steak and Shrimp with Mashed Potatoes. Wonderful! Melt in your mouth steak and perfectly seasoned shrimp. The BEST DISH!

Very charming interior. Full bar. Big Screen TV. Clean . Service was excellent.
author: Charlene K.

description:
Was in SF for Labor Day weekend, and so many restaurants were closed. My friends and I were lucky enough to stumble upon The Bell Tower, and had a great experience!

5 out of 6 people at our table decided to order the Stuffed Chicken Breast! Upon looking at the menu, it is definitely the standout, so I can understand the appeal. And it was, indeed, quite an array of awesome ingredients combined magnificently on one plate. 

As a lover of pork (and bread pudding), I diverged and took the path less taken.. deciding to go with the Grilled Pork Chop with cheddar jalapeño bread pudding(!) and corn with bacon. SOOOO AMAZING! My boyfriend tried mine, and agreed that my dish was better. Grilled to perfection, the outside was nice with a slight crisp, while the inside, juicy and tender. The cheddar jalapeno bread pudding was a unique and delicious accompaniment.  I thoroughly enjoyed this dish and recommend it to anyone coming here!

The restaurant itself has a chill, but classic vibe. The service was great, and the waitresses made great recommendations as to wine pairings for our meals. Overall, I really enjoyed my time here and would love to come back again someday.
author: Kristina R.

description: I come here for the laid back atmosphere, the tuna tacos and the ribs - so so good. Salmon salad is also another delicious and healthy option. Outdoor seating is great for people watching on Polk, and they keep the drinks flowing. Service can be a little slow when they are busy, but they are always friendly. More of a local crowd and throw back to how sf used to be.
author: Emily S.

description:
Just to premise, I've only had one dish here, but it's the dish I keep coming back for.

YOU MUST TRY THE CHORIZO MAC N' CHEESE! It's an absolute must. It comes in it's own dish that came out of the broiler with a crust of breadcrumbs and cheese. The chorizo is excellently spiced, has tons of flavor, without adding heat. There's no ring of oil either, like some other places I've gone.

To top it all off, they have outdoor seating! (If you're lucky to get a table). The drinks are reasonably priced, and and the staff is very friendly.
author: Anne-Marie H.

description:
Omg even better the second time, really? 

We came for brunch this time and ordered the Pulled Pork Nachos, two Bloody Marys and a Magners, and the Pistachio Crusted Brie salad. Holy god this was all super amazing. I thought it was a little strange that they didn't put any garnish in our drinks, but I asked her for some celery and she happily brought us some! She was also super nice and helpful so that always awesome too. Seriously though, Pulled Pork Nachos? Yes please! Oh super bonus perk was their outdoor seating on that sunny morning. Lovely!
author: Sonya D.

description: Gotta give them 5 stars for being one of rare places in the area where you can enjoy your beer outside in the sun. Only a few tables available though...
author: Una S.

description: I always see this place and it has been on my brunch list to try for awhile since it always seems to be so crowded. I came here with two friends last weekend. The food was great and the prices were very moderate! I would definitely come back here as it is in a prime location on Polk. On a sunny day, it's nice to sit outside. The staff was very nice, but they were pretty slow. They didn't come by that often and it took us awhile to get the check. Other than that, it's a good atmosphere and tasty menu!
author: Megan F.

description: Cassidilla is the reason I'm leaving review for this place. It's a very good casadila they got there. Mabe the cooks are all guatemalans maybe not but the way they cook that casadila should be  Illegal cause it's just so addictive. .this is really some  good sht
author: Try E.

description:
My roommate and I stumbled upon Bell Tower when we first moved to San Francisco and it has been one of our go-to restaurants ever since. 

Their fish and chips and ahi tuna tacos are to die for.
author: Meagan R.

description:
My dad and I came here when he was visiting and had the best experience.  It was pouring pouring pouring and we were looking for a place that had TVs to watch the NCAA tournament as well as food for lunch... it was a surprisingly difficult thing to find!  We stumbled upon the Bell Tower and enjoyed our experience so much, we came back later for dinner!

We sat in the upper area right in front of a huge TV.  Dad got to enjoy the game and we both enjoyed the food and service.  The servers were incredibly attentive, constantly checking on us, making sure our food was ok, refilling our drinks, etc.  We shared the pulled pork nachos, which were delicious, and the chicken and brie sandwich.  I didn't love the chicken sandwich, I thought it was pretty bland, but the nachos were great.  The pulled pork gave them really nice flavor and they were super cheesy.

After going to see a movie, we tried to think of a place for dinner where we could finish up watching the games, and after our earlier experience we headed straight back to the Bell Tower.  Again, impeccable service.  Constant refills, friendly conversation, etc.  I can't speak highly enough of the people working there.  We had the cowboy spring rolls and the fried calamari (we were still full from lunch!) and both were good.  The calamari came with a really nice thai sauce on the side, which we could have used more of, and the spring rolls were crunchy and delicious.

Overall, I'm a huge fan of the Bell Tower and will definitely be back!
author: Samantha B.

description:
Ugh. Every once in awhile a place comes along where you no matter how nice the waitress is, you can't get over how bad the food is.

French onion soup was top with some kinda cheddar. Salty and inappropriate cheese, enough said. Pork pulled sandwich was covered in the sugary-est BBQ sauce I've ever experienced. I really wish they'd left the coldslaw off the sandwich, as it got warm and gross. Waaayyyy too many fries were served, with not even a pickle or extra coldslaw on the side. My date's burger wasn't anything special and they forgot to bring him his side of blue cheese he'd requested twice.

My Myer's rum and coke was super heavy, but there seemed to be a chlorinated edge to the coke/water mix from the bar. 

Nothing spectacular, and I can pour my own heavy drink at home with ambiance for less money.
author: Alita M.

description:
When I first came to the neighborhood I just went in here for some wings and a drink. Their service was prompt and the waiters and waitresses are very nice! The wings are good, and I like their bloody mary mix, I don't like many bloody mixes in SF yet, so this and the Rogue are one of my favorite bloody marys. 
I've also been here for brunch and had the baked brie salad, which was wonderful! The baked brie was perfect and the salad was great with it! It was just the right amount of food so I wasn't stuffed! 
The atmosphere is nice, and everyone always seems so happy here! It's a nice location and you can shop a little afterwards!
author: Katrina M.

description:
Came here on a Thursday night and it was great.

You have to get the cowboy egg rolls!  they are very unique and tasty.

I had the french onion soup and it was good.

The service was great.  I enjoyed the decor and the overall vibe of the restaurant was intimate yet roomy so I recommend for a fun night out with friends.
author: Carrie H.

description:
Amazing service from an unexpected bar. 

The bartender and server were great! They guided us drunken fools through the menu, kindly steering us away from items she DID NOT recommend. We settled on the Mexican style steamed mussels and the potatoes skins. The mussels were amazing, the skins, not so much. They had a pretty decent selection of beers and, according to my date, a really great cosmo. 

I liked the really laid back jazzy ambiance. I'll definitely frequent this bar/restaurant again. Great place for a date!
author: Jon R.

description: Not a bad place to grab dinner or a drink. I like it more than a lot of other places on that area of Polk St. Their french onion soup is awesome. There's a southwestern Cobb salad that's pretty good. The quesadilla is decent. The menu changes but some staples are always on it. There's a couple tables on the sidewalk too, which is great for nice days.
author: Larisa J.

description: Amazing place to snag a bite to eat outside. Bloody Mary's are pretty killer as well!
author: Shawn O.

description:
The Bell Tower is a great spot to hit up on Polk with your dogs! My friend and I headed to the Bell Tower with 3 dogs and snagged an outdoor table. Our waitress and the customers seemed to truly love Ruggles, Nemo, and Kali.

We ate light and I enjoyed the "wedgie" salad with beets. I'm not a huge fan of blue cheese so asked for rice wine vinaigrette on the side instead and it was phenomenal dressing! Anessa enjoyed the french onion soup. The price was right and I was more than happy to treat Anessa for lunch for hanging out with Ruggles all morning!
author: Meghan P.

description: Love the Bell Tower.  Great neighborhood spot for pub food and great brunch.  Awesome staff - many have been there for lots of years.  I recommend the potato skins, burger, pulled pork sandwich, grilled chicken sandwich, pizza, spaghetti and my favorite is the stuffed chicken.  And the brunch is stellar!
author: Matt W.

description: i like the place, very accommodating with order errors.Walking distance from home (great walk by the way). low key vybe in the evening. i shall return
author: Ulysses D.

description:
ME LIKEY THE BELL TOWER...

So I came here today for a couple of cocktails with a friend and what a perfect day to come to this place.  Outside seating with a bloody mary basking in the sun and watching the hot guys walking in and out of Lombardi Sports, couldn't ask for more (LOL).

Recommendations:  French onion soup, pulled pork sandwich and the Mexican mussels.... OR Bask in the sun for a few cocktails with a friend on a sunny Friday afternoon, you'll be glad you did.
author: Edrian D.

description: Six of us (including a 70 year old man - we're not a bunch of teen hooligans!) wanted to stand outside since it was a freakishly warm SF night. They wouldn't serve us. Not the server's fault. Definitely the manager's call. Next. If I'm shelling out my hard earned $$ I'll sit where I want to sit.
author: Stacie M.

description:
Really wish you could give half stars on here! Bell Tower is a 3.5 for sure. 

A couple Sundays ago the weather was fantastic and our little group of 5 wanted to sit out side and enjoy some beers. Of course we first headed to one of the most obvious choices and quickly decided that we didn't want to wait 1- 1 1/2 hours for a place to chill. Where to go.... Yelp says Bell Tower has outdoor seating so lets check it out!

Wow were we in luck. 5 minutes after arriving a table outside opened up. It was a bit of a squeeze but we managed to sit 5 at one of the little tables (there is only 3 or 4 tables outside). 
Our waiter was definitely friendly but a little aloof (occasionally returning to clarify beer and food orders). Oh yeah, so after having a beer or two we couldn't resist munching from their menu. We basically ordered everything since it all sounded great. It was all pretty good. I'd say we stayed for several hours until the sun had been down past the nearest tall building for a while.
Our bill was reasonable, the beer was a good price, the food was good, lots of goods. Nothing bad nothing amazing. 

I'd go back if I was in that area and wanted something easy and didn't have any guests to impress.
author: Tuesday C.

description: Yum yum yum, the fish tacos rock and this place has great staff and service. When in town I make it a point to go!!!
author: Richard H.

description: Visited for brunch with my cousin. There was a little bit of a wait, but that is always a good sign for a restaurant. The food was delicious and the staff was very friendly.
author: Justin M.

description: Everytime I go here, I'm always like "Why don't i come here more often?". I kinda know why. Because I'm a stickler. About everything. And I sometimes forgot just how good a place can be.  My most recent excursion was out for a morning walk which turned into an impromptu birthday brunch for a lady friend of mine. She loved her entree, and the service was great.... Well Played, Bell Tower.
author: Kevin G.

description:
We showed up on a Friday night, not super crowded not empty.  The hostess was quite nice and we had a beer at the bar before we got our table.  The bartender and the other patrons were also super nice, making room for us to order our beers.  The food itself was pretty good, too.  Not haute cuisine, but better than I expected.  Everyone working was very friendly and the service was good.  Probably not the fastest, but the politeness/friendliness made up for that.

I'm sick of restaurants in SF with snippy people working there who treat you like you're an imposition by eating there (Zazie's).  So, this was a GREAT change of pace.
author: Lauren C.

description: Went there for dinner on Saturday.  The Stuffed Chicken Breast was great and they let us choose which vegetables we wanted.  The staff was great as well.  I'll definitely be going back.
author: Nate B.

description:
I met a friend here recently for dinner, per his suggestion. We were able to get a table pretty quickly, which surprised me considering how small the place is. 

It seems like an ok place, but it didn't really knock my socks off. I ordered a burger, which may have been my first mistake, but then again who knows. I did appreciate the massive amounts of pickles included in my burger, but it was slimy and the bread was really soggy. The burger was also a little too red for my taste.

I would like to come back and try their brunch menu, as I hear they actually have a pretty good brunch.
author: Diana R.

description:
I've been here a few times, each were just so-so experiences. I'm talking about the food only. Service was good each time. The staff seems really 
sweet, helpful, and generally happy.

One of the first times I came here I ordered calamari with my date as an appetizer. It was so chewy we couldn't eat it. It's easily the worst calamari I've ever had. It could have been just a bad night, but because of that one experience, I can't order it here again.

I ordered one of their pizzas (I believe it was a pesto pizza) that came out dripping with grease. It was so soggy with grease, but I was starving so I had to eat. Boy was that a bad idea... my stomach hurt the rest of the night.

I decided to give this place another try recently with a friend of mine. We ordered 3 glasses of wine between the 2 of us, he ordered the salmon (~$17), I ordered the cobb salad ($15.50), and we ordered the escargot as an appetizer ($7). The bill came out to be 77 bucks, how? I have no idea. I didn't really look it over, but my friend and I split the bill. I had a salad and a glass of wine and 3 pieces of escargot and paid almost 50 bucks including tip. That's extremely ridiculous considering the quality of food that night was just okay. It's a freaking salad, why is it almost $16? I can get a cobb salad down the street for half that price.

Needless to say, I probably won't be back to this place as each experience I've had with the quality of food has been less than average. And for the price I'm paying, I'd rather take my business elsewhere.

+1 star for the nice staff, and +1 more star for the delicious escargot... that, atleast, was delicious... although the garlic bread it came with was stale. :-/
author: Ashley D.

description:
Great prices, wonderful and friendly service, indoor and outdoor seating, three tv's to watch sports and 'all right' food.  I have been to the Bell Tower several times and keep going back, but I wouldn't recommend it to any foodie friends.  Good pub food - I do love their french onion soup and the pizza is pretty good too.  

The have a bar area has a couple tv's and an area in the back with a big screen - The Bell is good place to be able to enjoy a game without dealing with overwhelming crowds.  They also have a few tables outside in the sunshine and always have a waterbowl outside the front door for pets.
author: Janelle C.

description:
Decent beer selection and an interesting menu.  For breakfast, a lot of staples on there, but with some nice additions like jalapeno cakes with eggs, pulled pork and hollandaise.  Dinners are good too, and the calamari was cooked correctly when I was there last, which was nice.

One thing to note: They have a 2-card maximum no matter how many people are in your party.  Table of 8?  Two cards.  It wouldn't be as bad if the waiter didn't keep coming by to point out the ATM in the corner.  When you are THAT obvious it becomes clear that the 2-card rule is there to drive ATM fees.  

So visit the Bell Tower, but if you are with a group, bring cash.
author: Robert F.

description:
Honestly. Where in SF do you find $5 cocktails (jack and coke's) and $4 beers? I even had a chicken caesar since I'd missed dinner, and for $10 I got a damned good salad, covered in freshly grilled chicken and parmesan. 

There's no need to even say anything else. Cheap, delicious, and comfortable. Sold!
author: Aaron F.

description:
I've always taken The Bell Tower for granted.  It's got a wide-ranging menu of reasonably priced items, but there's nothing about the place that has ever really grabbed my attention.  Still, it's crowded and popular, so others seem to be having a great time.  

Having decided it was time for another visit to see if my apathy was still justified, I went back and tried the crispy fried green bean appetizer, the tuna taco appetizer, and a basic burger with fries.  All of it was good, with the tuna taco making a particularly strong showing.  The service was nice (and apologetic, once the waitress finally showed).  We sat outside, which ordinarily would be nice, but the chairs were a bit uncomfortable and there were a lot of strange sideshows that didn't much add to the experience.

Long story short, the Bell Tower deserves more of my attention than I've been giving it.  The food is solid and reasonably priced, and the service was good.
author: Laurence W.

description: Stumbled into this place by chance and had a great experience. Our waitress was super attentive and nice! Great drink menu and good wine selection. The shrimp cakes were  delicious and the calamari was the best I've had!
author: Jennifer S.

description: Food was mediocre; decor is decent; service was awful.  Our waitress was downright rude: 2 of us walk in to a nearly empty bar and there's no waitress in sight so we sit down at a small table.    When she comes by and all we order is a couple of beers, she had the gall to mention that tables are only for customers ordering food.  I said thanks, we'll keep that in mind for next time, but she insists we move to the bar.   There was only one other occupied table at the time, so it's not like she needed the table.  Service continued to be condescending the rest of the night.  I regret not complaining to the manager at the time. I live nearby but won't be back.
author: James B.

description:
We went in here awhile ago ~I'm a new Yelper, but I will never forget the absolutely HORRIBLE ATTITUDE/EXPERIENCE from the waitress~ All due respect to the owner who was shocked and appalled when I called her and reported this waitress's ABUSE~ ~ The waitress is short (in mind and body), and has brown hair and glasses, beware if shes there she is sooo unprofessional~ I went in on a Sunday with a friend, having never ever been, we were looking forward to the great things we'd heard~ Well we were denied service because one of her friends was there (which we weren't aware of ) but this friend of hers I happen to have a restraining order against and she yelled at US to leave ~ We were like two steps in the door and BAM! Then upon our leaving she had the guys table I have the RO against (still do today) stand up and cheer as we left! We were like OMG !!?
 Shes a big bully and used the restaurant as her front for bullying us ~
The owner was very helpful props to her ~
Shame on you waitress for harassing innocent customers.
author: Allison K.

description:
Nick honey, I know you picked this place out but the reason I'm giving it  a two is simple:

1.The server took over 10 minutes to greet our table. Just a greet now.

2.The food was awful. A cobb salad that should have been called "iceberg lettuce drenched in ranch dressing" was not appetizing at all and made my stomach hurt later anyhow-sorry I didn't tell you.

3. It took way too long to get a refill. If you're understaffed on a busy Friday  night-HIRE SOMEONE.

4. Ambiance kind of blew. There are too many tables, not enough room, and it's torn between being a nice restaurant and a sports bar it seems. No thanks.
author: Jessica K.

description: I'm hoping this is a better bar than restaurant because the menu was overall uninspiring.  I always walked past here Sunday afternoons and the food looked so good, so maybe it's just a better brunch destination than dinner.  The food wasn't terrible, it just wasn't that good.
author: Kristina I.

description: Great place to go for drinks on Polk Street on a nice day. Seating outside and decent drink selection. Food isn't bad, but average bar food. Love that the windows slide open so if the outdoor seating is taken, you still can enjoy the great weather from inside!
author: Kimberly S.

description: Love this neighborhood bar, don't want to tip off everyone else, but have to share. Great food, drinks and staff, have never had a bad meal. Don't come here if you're a marina fan, only good people allowed
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
I've only been once and just for drinks.  I've always been curious about the place and have walked by many times...  It's convenient enough and close enough for me to try again.

It isn't too crowded, and the atmosphere seems really relaxed.  The drinks are pretty reasonably priced, though the service isn't particularly attentive.
author: Wendy L.

description: The Bell Tower is excellent for a quick casual bite and drink.  Food is great, beer selection is solid.  Highlight for me are the Nachos; they are a must have, some of the best nachos I've had.  Service is a little spotty but fine, I think 4 or 5 different servers helped us out during our 45 minute meal but since it's very casual it was fine.  Definitely recommend.
author: Brooks R.

description: Average food, poor service. Went to Bell Tower for brunch and while it was edible, there was nothing special about it. Omelette was flavorless. Vegetables didn't seem fresh. Waitress was horrendous-- slow and didn't appear to notice any time we needed anything. Won't go back.
author: Geoff R.

description: The Bell Tower is my neighborhood bar. I don't come here often but at least twice or three times a month. So you can say I'm somewhat a regular, but not enough for the wait staff to know who I am. The reason to why I'm writing this, it's cause no matter what time of day I come here, service is always attentive and friendly. Now for bar food it has some amazing choices. From a taco tuna which is loaded with goods on top and a good slice of tuna, to French onion soup, chicken quesadilla with really tasty pico de gallo. Brunch has some good choices on the weekend too. Check it out. You'll love it. It's never too crowded to not be able to get a seat but always has a crowd to not feel alone.
author: Isaac B.

description:
Dined here on a Saturday afternoon.  I shared with some pizza with friends.  I enjoyed the pizza, but didn't think it was spectacular.  

I'm a bit wishy-washy.  There was nothing really wrong with this place; I just wouldn't go out of my way to return.
author: Julia R.

description:
We stumbled upon this place, which is very close to the Book Go Round.  The decor is good, but it was stuffy upon arrival.  They needed to turn on the fans.  We ordered two sandwiches to go.  As we waited, we walked around the restaurant - beautiful tapestry on the indoor benches and the pastries look delicious.  If you go outside, there is a very nice patio area with a fountain and arbors over select tables.  There was a room called The Banquet Room that was full of about 20 women.  That was nice, and made me think that this was a charming area to hold a luncheon meeting.  

The reason I gave this place only 3 stars was that when we got home they had gotten the sandwiches all wrong.  My husband had asked for one thing - no sauce, and it was fulll of sauce.  We had waited a long time for it, so did not feel like going back.  

Secondly, my son also did not like his sandwich.  The baguette was different, and not in a good way.  The bacon was done well, but having the bread be bad kind of ruined it.  

We have only been here once, and were given 3 madeline cookies to try upon leaving.  We will be back, but this time we were disappointed mostly in the sandwich quality.  Maybe they are much better at the breakfast items.  We will try this restaurant another time.
author: Susan F.

description:
A W E S O M E 

In the event a question ever arises, it is smart at times to head directly to the source.  Or the owner, in this case.

For Superbowl, due to unexpected reasons and forces of nature not withstanding, "W" and I found ourselves peering in at the Bell Tower on Polk.  Not only did it look half full with denizens cheering on their respective teams, it also had sunlight streaming in on the bar stools and counter.  Not to mention the dog cushion out front (that was the clincher ;)

The interior is inviting and warm, probably due to the large expanse of windows in this place.  Wood floors, a long bar counter, and two panel tvs flanking the corners of the ceiling.  The only problem, was that the sun was reflecting on screens and there was no decent seating along the counter.  In addition to the dining floor area there was a raised area to the back, which floored a massive 73-inch flat panel.  And the game was about to start.

Leave it to "W" to go forth and see if we were able to join the "private party" (waitress had told us beforehand) and the one and only man he had inquired with turned out to be the owner, who was most gracious in letting us sit up there.

We ordered the Salt and Pepper Fried Calamari with sweet tamarind dipping sauce and the Quesadilla appetizer.  Menu was pretty expansive for a bar menu, including thick hamburgers and salads for women watching their waistline (apparently I was not, since I ordered the quesadilla).  In addition to what was on tap, they had my fave pear cider!  Calamari was good, tender pieces of calamari breaded in a crunchy shell.  I think we preferred the traditional tartar/cocktail sauce so had to request that.  The quesadilla was so-so, but still thick with melted cheeses (I've been spoiled by quesadillas in the Mission)

Service was quick and courteous and being part of the owner's private party (in addition to the resident Bull Mastiff) was a great way to spend Superbowl Sunday.  I'll be back to support a local establishment that is so inviting to locals :)
author: Miika M.

description: Bell Tower's a fun, casual spot in Nob Hill. I came here for breakfast and had a good experience. I had the salmon benedict and it was a solid dish. I've had better and I've had worse but the prices are so reasonable here that overall I was pretty satisfied. The server was kind and attentive, and the restaurant itself had a casual vibe to it. Overall, a good time. Enjoy!
author: Ken C.

description: This was our first visit, We received a warm welcome, and a mimanal wait. Every seat whether inside or outside was a good table. The waiters and hostess was friendly and knowledgeable of the menu and specials. Will we go again? You betcha :).
author: Stella B.

description:
This place gets 4 stars for its service! Food was not bad either. My fiance and I went here for brunch. Our server Matt was extremely alert and super fast in fulfilling out demands. He wore a big smile on his face and answered every question/demand with a "Sure". 
I ordered the Veggie burger and my fiance got the Chicken sandwich, both were good. We also go a bottle of champagne. Overall good experience!

I'd rather be in a place with bad food than bad service. We got better service here than the previous night at upscale "Frascati" restaurant where we ran up a $100+ check!
author: Mandy K.

description: Great place for dinner. Food was delicious, plates were a good size, prices were affordable, and the place had a great vibe! Only issue was the parking...
author: Johana M.

description: this is a good local neighborhood spot to crawl around on the floor like a rat looking for your credit card
author: Nick P.

description:
this place is TERRIBLE. our brunch started off on a positive note since we arrived at prime brunch hour on a sunday and were seated immediately. things started to go downhill when our server failed to come by our table for about 20 minutes. when she finally got our drink order, it took another 30 to get our water and bloody mary's. 

she had to come back and ask what we ordered for breakfast, twice..and then ended up bringing my friend the wrong order. my omelette was bland and cold and the potatoes were under-cooked and flavorless.

SKIP IT.
author: Jae C.

description:
This place is comforting and very easy going.  Casual setting, dogs outside, some interesting food and great bar food. Outdoor seating as well.  Plus they make espresso martinis and sell clase de azul for $10 now that is a rare find.  
Food served until 12 or 1.  It has been a while for me staying out that late.  
This place is just easy and approachable.
author: D B.

description: Only stopped for a drink, but the service was friendly and a breath of fresh air! Convenient location and outdoor seating makes this a nice little watering hole
author: Melyssa H.

description:
Bell Tower is a great place to get a filling meal and an easy beer for a very reasonable price.

The servers, bartenders, and hosts are all extremely nice and go out of their way to keep you happy, even if they are a bit slow at times. To clarify: they're pretty good about keeping your beers full, they just sometimes are slow to clear the table or bring the bill. (But they all pitch in to help each other out, from the host to the bartender-- which I really like.)

Always find out what the specials are. My favorite meal there was the pork carnitas (on special), which I couldn't finish and had as leftovers the next day. I also like the chicken, spinach, and brie sandwich and the pulled pork sandwich.

We will always come back here: never a wait, and always a table! The only thing I wish is that the food and beer menu had a little bit more variety, but they have a few good food staples for me (in addition to any yummy specials) and Haywire on tap.

The decor is a little random, and the top section of seating a little dark. Sometimes the customers get a bit loud and boisterous, but for a weekend meal, who really minds? Tip: grab an outside table if there is one available.

Great little neighborhood place!
author: Lauren M.

description: What do you want in a bar/restaurant in s.f.?  There's a lot of stuff out there, but I like great food, stiff drinks and a real and friendly staff. Welcome to the Bell. Don't be an ass and you'll be family soon.
author: teague k.

description:
Setting: post new years recovery brunch. 

Reservations: nope. just walked in and they said it would be about 20 minutes. it ended up being about 40 minutes, but I suppose it might've been because it was a special day.

Order:  four of us decided to eat family style. We got the french toast (delicious!), pork nachos (surprisingly big order), omelette (i don't remember which one; it just was that unmemorable!), biscuits and gravy (delicious, but it only came with one biscuit! you might as well call it BISCUIT and gravy!).

Service: the service staff had charming british accents and was attentive. i'm a fan. 

Cost: came out to about $25 a person. ok but not great.
author: Janet Z.

description:
Home to the world's most expensive mac-n-cheese. This bar is, 'meh'. I like the tall wooden chairs and tables outside. They typically have a decent beer selection. 

Burgers are okay as well. They have a few TV's if you can't get into a sports bar near buy.
author: David N.

description: Great place to hang out during the blues festival. Decent food, great service, seating and location.
author: Michael C.

description:
First things first, let's get some things out of the way.

Bell Tower ain't Chez Panisse, so don't come expecting fancy food.

Bell Tower ain't a beer geek's bar like Toronoda or Magnolia, so don't come expending 100 different brews.

Bell Tower ain't in the Mission or Soma, so don't be pulling up in skinny jeans and with a fixie.

All that being said, Bell Tower is a very comfortable neighborhood bar/restaurant where you will get well made comfort food and a good beer.  The guys who run the place don't have the pretensions to say this -- but their place is very close to what a pub in England/Ireland would be.  Hearty well made food, a good beer, and comfortable wooden furniture.  

On some of the Foggy JULY & AUGUST NIGHTS, you can't ask for anything more.
author: Stan C.

description:
This is a cute, clean, and comfortable place. A few of my girlfriends and I came by on a sunny afternoon to have a few drinks and eats. The chairs outdoors are surprisingly comfortable, I also really liked that everything here (indoors and outdoors) is CLEAN! There's also a huge purple plush chair in the center of the restaurant, unexpected and charming.

I was sooo happy to hear they served pear cider on tap! PEAR CIDER ON TAP!!!! This is unheard of, I had to question if she really said that and make her repeat it. It is far more yummy on tap. To all of your bars/restaurants out there: Listen and learn, and emulate. This is innovation.

Our server was so nice, she was really sweet and attentive, even offered honest advice on drinks. But I didn't need to hear much because I was already sold when I heard "pear cider on tap" --- I was snapping my fingers away at my girl friends trying to tell them to hurry up and order drinks so my pear cider can make its way to me asap. I still can't get enough of it!

I was really impressed with this place, very quiet and wholesome. It's a very nice place to enjoy conversation and have drinks with your friends when you don't want to be crowded or unable to hear yourself over music. There are a lot of cute shops near by so after you get a little buzz going, you can wander down Polk St. and unknowingly spend a few bucks. I'd give it five stars but I wish they had more menu items and I did not like how your entire credit card number was printed on the receipt. That is a big no no to me.
author: Stella C.

description:
I think this place is better as a bar than restaurant. The service is hit or miss, it all depends on the waiter. It's really the food that kills me. I've had their pizza -- so bland -- as was their special of the day, fettuccine. 

I just feel like there are so many gems on the polk strip that I wouldn't hang out in this place unless I had to. They do get an extra star for outdoor seating (three small roundtables), which is great for wine consumption on a beautiful summer's day.
author: Jane C.

description:
This place is always packed! I finally got the chance to see why. Two friends and I came for brunch. We all got different omelets- I got the one with bacon and blue cheese, tomatoes and avocados with home fries and an English muffin. It was ok. I'm not sure I liked the blue cheese... a little strong. But the bacon was goooooood- a little sweet! Overall, I would say that my meal was only ok. 
However, now that I'm on Yelp and I see all these great photos and reviews, I'm thinking I should give Bell Tower another chance to make it up to my taste buds. The tuna tacos actually looked delicious... I'll be sure to update if I return!
author: Amanda W.

description: I really enjoy this spot. I have eaten here a few times and they never fail to amaze me with their specials. I love eating on the outside tables to people watch on Polk street. I also prefer a more laid back server who lets me talk with my friends, enjoy the sun and my beer without always being on top of the table asking if everything is "okay" every five minutes. The service is a bit faster inside so if you are in a hurry to eat I suggest you chow down inside.
author: Krystle L.

description: Still a huge fan of this place. Their menu is huge and varied and everything I have tried is great. Their fish and chicken options (and specials) are always delicious. These usually come with side dishes like mashed potatoes and veggies. Other faves include french onion soup, mussels, burgers, salads, and mac and cheese. Portions are huge. Service is friendly. Full bar. Atmosphere is loud and fun during peak hours.
author: Lauren B.

description: Full bar, outdoor seating and the kitchen is open until midnight on a Monday?  You just became the "go to" spot in my neighborhood.  The mussels with chorizo, the spinach salad with bleu cheese and bacon, the red snapper and the fish tacos are all excellent.   Clean place and friendly service.  You complete me.
author: Corey V.

description:
After the Elite event at Press Club, we needed some food. Party of 12. They definitely were not ready for such a large group. The person looked bewildered when we said that our party was that large. So we were split into two tables. 

A few things:
1. Took a while for our drinks to come out. 
2. The food was good. I had the pulled pork sandwich which was a good balance w/ the cole slaw and had the sweet bbq. 
3. The shoe string fries were good, but I wish there was a better serving of them. I had about a handful of fries on my large plate. 

Next time I'm in the neighborhood, I would go back for the mac & cheese as this place is known for it. I wouldn't really come here if I wasn't already in the area though.
author: Angelo F.

description:
Following in the footsteps of Megan D...

Theron promised us steak.  He tried.

Unfortunately, they weren't serving dinner yet, so my steak was ground into a burger topped with gorgonzola plus fries and a few side orders of Bloody Mary's.  The burger was great, perfectly cooked (rare, so more like perfectly not cooked.)  You'd have to ask Merrilee how the fries were...  The truffled mac and cheese was excellent.

The Bell Tower is easy to find even if you don't know exactly where it is on Polk Street because the building is pink.  Also, it has a bell tower.
author: P J.

description:
This is a good spot for a low-key meal. The food isn't going to blow your mind, but it's definitely a tasty and satisfying option for nights when you just want to eat, have a drink, and head to the next place. I really like their burger and the spinach salad, and the boyfriend is a big fan of the pulled pork sandwich.

Also, the service is always good, and the TVs usually show major Bay-Area sports.
author: Alexa G.

description: OMG we ate at Bell Tower a month or so ago, and we practically licked our plates! I asked the waitress what happened--she said there was a schedule change and someone new-ish was in the kitchen. I told her in no uncertain terms she should tell the management to promote that chef! I was expecting a bland so-so brunch, but what we got was delicious! My omelette had green chiles and perfectly browned and seasoned potatoes on the side. My friend had a salmon omelette special, and agreed that our dishes were a huge improvement. They even looked better--the food had color, and looked freshly prepared, instead of tossed around and under/overcooked to death.
author: Matty G.

description:
I like this joint for the price and the overall quality.  However, I bumped it down because of the wait for my food.

Pizza, surprisingly good. Even though ingredients were simple, the crust was like biscuit, thick and crunchy without burnt charcoal, similar to Chicago style.

Nachos, calamari, and steamed mussels were solid. Though, I was disappointed with my buffalo wings because they were sorta cold when I got them. I think they were in the kitchen for a little too long.

Their beer, wine, and hard liquor selections are not bad. However, I think it's more of a restaurant than a bar. Their foods are better than usual bar foods; the foods are better priced than other restaurants. So, i hope this gives you a better idea of how I think of this place.
author: Edmund L.

description:
Came here late in the night in the midst of celebrating my best friend's birthday. I was pleasantly surprised by the service and food. 

The wings were a nice start and the veggie pizza was delicious. My friends were also satisfied with their meals, which included the fish dish.
author: Kamalpreet K.

description: Simply put, this is what a good neighborhood restaurant is all about (and in short supply thee days). Friendly, professional staff that truly does care about their customers. Diverse 'pub' menu, extensive and varied. Solid options for breakfast, lunch and dinner. I've probably been to the Bell Tower 20+ times and have never had a bad experience.
author: Christopher V.

description:
Really a 2.5 because although the place is dependable, it's also not quite exciting enough to be "A-OK".

The bar experience here is better than the dining experience.  Although I've always gotten really good service here, I've found the food itself to be hit or miss.  Still, the portions are appropriately sized and you won't leave hungry or cold, which I know makes it sound marginally better than a Cold War sentinel's wardroom, but whatevs.

However, this is a good place to pull up a stool and drink scotch while watching football at the bar, or on the big screen in the back room.

Bathrooms are super clean and pleasant.
author: Dmytro A.

description:
Hi Yelp.  Long time reader, first time reviewer.  In this case, i have a bone to pick.  I used to eat at The Bell Tower regularly.  It  wanted to be the typical neighborhood restaurant - comfort food prepared averagely, cozy confines, no need for reservations, relaxed atmosphere.  It also has some of the only outdoor seating in the entire Polk Gulch, a definite plus.  It was fine, average dining, overpriced to me, but then, most neighborhood restaurants along the Cow Hollow-Union St-Polk St axis are average and overpriced.  

So the second-to-last time I went I had a terrible dining experience.  The wait for service was long, and when the waiter came it turned out to be a surly douchebag who seemed to think that I worked for him.  Which, okay, the service has traditionally been very friendly there - maybe the manager had an off day hiring? 

Fast forward a month later, my parents are in town from back East.  We have a few drinks, as is our custom.  We head to The Bell Tower for vittles. We sit.  And wait.  And wait.  About 10 minutes later, who should appear but The Surly Douchebag.  At this point we have all figured out what we want to eat.  Douchebag the Wonderwaiter asks for drink orders.  

My brother: I will have a vodka tonic, and I'm ready to make my entree order.  
Dbag: No you are not.  Right now I'm taking drink orders, and you all are going to give me the drink orders and I will come back for the entree orders.  

I flipped.  I asked to see the manager.  Dbag pointed out the bartender as his manager.  As my parents gathered their things and went out to the street, I went up to the bar and got her attention.  As I began to complain, the woman looked at me like, why are you telling me this?  
Are you the manager?  
No.  
Is the manager here? 
No.  
When will the manager be here?  
Tomorrow.  

So aside from poor service and a bad attitude, Dbag the Wonderwaiter is a liar.  

The point being, this place is of marginal diner's utility to begin with.  The menu is boring, the preparation is average, and the prices are high.  Add in bad service, and the possible embarrassment of your parents/friends/colleagues being insulted, and you can ABSOLUTELY find a better meal in Polk Gulch.  For one, REX CAFE  a few blocks down is basically the same model with a little more flair.
author: Ed F.

description:
Solid three stars.  

Decent, but not stellar service (even on a not-so-busy weekday--though sometimes these days call for understaffing that can overwhelm the working servers).  

Yummy, but not mind-blowing wedge salad and calamari.  (Though I hear from many that the mac and cheese is SO delish.)

Nice crowd, nice atmosphere.  

I'd be here frequently if I lived closer.
author: Brianna H.

description: Great place to come out and chill in the sun while eating. The service staff knows when to help and when to let you be. The canivore pizza was awesome and washed it down with a blue moon. It's was good..
author: Johnny P.

description: This place is just around the corner from me and a great casual place to meet friends. I have to admit on my first visit, I wasn't expecting much from the food and boy was I surprised. The waitress was kind, helpful, and completely on top of everything. Our warm pistachio encrusted brie salad was an amazing shared appetizer with it's citric dressing and crisp walnuts and apples. We shared a burger and fries which were also very flavorful and the burger had clearly been grilled over charcoal, with a nice smokey flavor! They have a decent beer selection, even though it's not vast, there's some good stuff on the list! We've been back and will be back again. I highly recommend!
author: Emily S.

description:
I've been here on three occasions and have tried:

- Mac & cheese
- Grilled chicken sandwich
- Tuna tacos

The mac and cheese and tuna tacos were pretty good; my only complaint is I got bored of them and they weren't amazing for the whole meal (kind of like a YUM at first, and then you wish you had something else to eat). The grilled chicken sandwich was very dry and flavorless.

A good place to hang out with friends and get drinks, or to eat while watching the game, but the food is mediocre and overpriced.
author: Jackie C.

description: I rarely visit a place to  twice but this one is worth it! All their food is amazing. The only problem is the service and the wait. the place is small so get there early or be prepared to wait. The food makes up for it!
author: Jason M.

description: I met my son for lunch there today, my first time there. I had fish tacos, but they were ahi tuna tacos and they were fantastic! Good service, very nice atmosphere. I will definitely go back
author: Lisa R.

description:
I can't believe it has taken me this long to finally step into the Bell Tower. Only a few blocks from me, I've walked by it for over a year and finally made my way in last night after an event supporting Dennis Herrera's re-election for City Attorney.

I've always enjoyed seeing people sitting outside and the laid back atmosphere that surrounds this corner, and it definitely carries inside as well.

There is a comfortable wooden bar that lends itself perfectly for a night of watching sports and the back portion of the restaurant has a large screen for easy lounging and spectating as well.

The menu is straightforward but will surprise you with some creative twists. I opted for the pulled pork sandwich and while the bbq was sufficient, I've never seen such a small bun.

2 of these sandwiches would equal the size of 1 burger at Polkers, but taste wise, it was delicious. Paired with warm fries, the dish was ok. Stepped up just a notch, and it'd be a great hit that would have more people coming back for it.

The servers here are fantastic. They were, truthfully, the highlight of the place. Easy going, friendly, and never missed a beat.

I'm glad this neighborhood joint is close to me, and I'm looking forward to sitting out on the front patio graciously excepting happy hour and munching on their snacks.
author: Mike K.

description: The food is not great and not bad.  It fills my stomach and I don't remember my wallet hurting.  They have sangria.  That's important.
author: Byron L.

description:
The food is terrible and the service is not much better... 

Maybe, I have high expectations for restaurants in SF... This place feels like a tourist trap and I'm not familiar with this neighborhood so maybe it is.

Anyways, the potato skins were very disappointing ... They def use the wrong kind of cheese and look very sad and meager dotted with little bacon pieces. Calamari was dripping in fryer grease ... Didnt finish the food and went home with a stomach ache.
author: Liz Z.

description:
I have visited Bell Tower on a few brunch occasions, and it always does the trick.  They serve up delicious brunch food to kick whatever you did last night in the ass.  I love love love their breakfast burrito.  The service is always very attentive, and the outdoor seating is a plus on the rare warm afternoons.

I love that this place is situated right on Polk, it makes people watching that much more enjoyable.  The menu is somewhat limited, but I actually prefer that because after a night on Polk Street, my mind is mush and the fewer the choices, the sooner that my party can order, and the sooner I can take a nap.
author: Katie H.

description:
Absolutely fantastic, I had the most enjoyable experience here last night.  The service was hands-down perfect.  After devouring my order of fish and fries, we took shots with the waiters, and I have never in my life come across espresso-infused vodka; but let me tell you people, it is phenomenal.  I can't believe I haven't had it until now; I am actually Googling places I can order that stuff by the case.  By the end, we also shared a creme brulee and the chocolate souffle cake.  The creme brulee was my fav.

Seeing as this place is walking distance, I will definitely be back.  I have to try the pulled pork sandwich that everyone is raving about.
author: Nick W.

description:
It's been over a year since I've been here.

Why you may ask?  Because I'm terrible with names and could not remember the name of this place to save my life or even it's location, but I dreamed about that New York steak topped with a ludicrous amount of blue cheese horseradish butter, pink inside, juicy and flavorful with  their wonderful cream of spinach on one side and their scalloped potatoes on the other.  The same friend who took me the first time finally took me for the 2nd time and it was just like I remember it!

I haven't tried their pork loin, or their seared ahi tuna tacos, or their french onion soup.  I don't have to, but now that I know where this place is, I will and nothing will stop me! (except maybe my cardiologist). 

Service can be slow and the acoustics can be noisy if it's cold outside and their windows are all closed.  

I'm definitely a fan!
author: Theron L.

description: Visited while in town last month with a few friends. Had come in the night before for food fairly late (probably after 11 pm) and were turned away, but tonight we arrived early enough to enjoy the menu. Party of 5 and we were seated immediately. Place was medium full, with a couple different seating areas as well as a bar. Had chorizo jalapeno mac n cheese ($14-15)... pretty good. Rest of the party seemed to like it more than me though. I'm not a huge mac and cheese fan in general but I love chorizo so I had to try it. Server was extremely friendly, and made suggestions on drinks for my companions.
author: Julia R.

description:
Interesting waitress, nice view of Polk, killer chocolate molten lava souffle cake with vanilla ice cream and caramel!  Yummy!  The tea selection is pretty poor.  The BFF and I aren't the biggest fans of Stash but it made due and didn't ruin my dessert.

Came here another time and had a savory dish, which was the chicken sandwich.  Pretty good but I don't know if I would pay for food that I can make at home.  Then again, if you're hungry and lazy, the Bell Tower definitely cooks up a good meal to keep you from starving.  I'm more partial to the desserts because they're tasty and rich but not too sweet.  It's a clean place with a bar as well, if you're into drinking and eating....perfect place to hang out and watch a game or two.  It's definitely, conveniently located on a corner so you can stumble in before or after an evening at the bar.  I'm quite interested in checking the Bell Tower out for breakfast or brunch because the selection does look promising...definitely up for paying them yet another visit.
author: Dorothy S.

description:
I heard about this place a while back, and then one night... there we were, Girls Night, wandering Polk, looking for some food and more drink. I saw the Bell Tower sign, bells and whistles went off and I made up our collective minds.  

None of us were disappointed in the food.  Me & F each had the quesadilla (ask for jalapenos.)   It was delicious, esp for a non-mexican place. And it was huge.   I totally forget what M ordered, but she loved it and I know I ate about half her fries.  They were the really skinny crispy ones, who can blame me?

The drinks were a bit, umm, weak.  But at that point, that was probably ok.  Perhaps they sensed our *level* and went weak on our respective vodkas and gins on purpose - after all, at one point, we were (very nicely) asked to *use [y]our inside voices.*

Good mix of people.   We made a good choice.
author: Meg W.

description:
I've lived in Russian Hill for the past 4 years and I finally came here for dinner.  My friends and I shared escargot and this was divine.  I grew up in a French household and I absolutely loved this appetizer.  It was served with garlic bread and the sauce was a garlic lovers dream. 
Next I had the pulled pork sandwich which was so moist and tender that I gulped it down.  My friend's bf was shocked when one half of the sandwich disappeared while he was looking down cutting his steak.  My gal pal had the seared tuna tacos--also very good.  And her bf had the steak dish which was served on a huge plate.  He wouldn't let us near it so I guess that means it was good!
author: Sarah C.

description: the service has vastly improved. There's a bespeckled brunette who is simply awesome. Food is awesome, great drinks good vibe. Good job managment on righting the ship!
author: Timoteo K.
