description:
Three hungry/starving/famished and very thirsty adults heading into the City for a night of music and meeting some really cool people. 

The super awesome Yelper Gill C suggested a few places near the music venue that we may enjoy. One of these being The Bell Tower.

First of all, the fact that this was recommended by Gill I already knew the food would be great as she knows her stuff. And it's a short walk to the Red Devil Lounge where we were heading off to after dinner.

My wife and friend were greeted at the door by one of the most friendly waitresses ever. She told us it would be a "short twenty minute wait" and as we glanced at the food being served up on the tables were sold that this would perfect for us. 

Our "twenty minute" wait turned into no more than 10 and were seated near the door. This sounds worse than it is, as the table was more than comfortable. Our waitress could tell that we were thirsty and took our drink orders right away. My wife was in a Manhattan mood, I asked our server if the bartender could put together a caipirinha. Not only could they make one, the caipirinhas were outstanding and included generous amounts of lime. Yes, I am a fan of limed.

The menu is a problem in that everything sounded delicious. Pizza, pulled pork sandwiches, seafood dishes, pork chops, steaks, pizza, truffled mac and cheese, beef stew and bbq ribs. Our heads were spinning at all the choices. 

My wife has a weakness for bbq ribs and especially when they come with French fries. My friend went with the salmon and I the pork cop. I also requested the truffled mac n cheese for the table to share. My pork chop was cooked to perfection and a generous double cut. The side dishes included a bread with apple and blue cheese and southern greens. My wife commented that the pork chop was one of the best she had ever tasted, and I have to agree. It was amazing. The sides complimented the pork perfectly I cant speak for our friends salmon as I don't eat seafood but judging by the way he pulled a Hoover vacuum cleaner and sucked that thing down within seconds of hitting the table I would say it must have been pretty dang good. My wife raved about the bbq ribs and each time I tried to snatch a fry off her plate would get the evil stare. Again this is a good sign that her dish was better than excellent.

The service could not have been better as our server checked on us frequently during the meal and made certain that all of our needs were met. She also had an outstanding fun-loving attitude which made our experience that much better.

$111 dinner for 3 with 4 cocktails, 1 beer, 1 glass if wine. Excellent value!

Thanks to Gill C for recommending The Bell Tower!
author: Rene C.

description: great little bar and restaurant. stopped in on valentines day with no wait we were seated n had a wonderful dinner. great services. all i can ask for
author: Yvonne C.

description: This Place is SUPER DUPER GREAT...great food...very decent prices....I didnt have any cocktails but everyone else in the place had one so they must be good......THE SERVICE WAS EVEN BETTER THAN THE PRICES....THE KIND OF SERVICE YOU WISH EVERY PLACE HAD!..I will definetly be back at this place again......It's a great place to watch a sports game.
author: Chanta' C.

description: The server ignored our table for a good 10 minutes. No acknowledgment, no water, nothing. Interestingly enough, he checked on the table 3 times in the 10 minutes that we were there. Weird.
author: Kiristen R.

description:
Pear Cider?? Really?? Flavored cider could quite possibly be one of the top reasons why I love San Francisco. Does anyone know how hard it is to find any cider other than Woodchuck in Philly? Well, I do, and it's a bitch. My friends and I were wandering down Polk St. and decided that a place with some bar food would appease the greater masses as there were five of us dining. Definitely an interesting beer assortment, two friends ordered Hell or High, two of us ordered Wyders Pear, the fifth failed us on PBR...why mess with a good thing I guess. 

The service was a little slow, I think for all of the indoor and outdoor seating there were only two waiters/waitresses and one bartender, but we were in no rush so really this wasn't a huge issue. Our orders were large, our table went to town splitting stellar mac and cheese and pork nachos while the rest of us respectively ordered a burger, tuna tacos, escargot (yummy yummy butter garlic sauce), french onion soup, and a wedgie salad. No complaints from anyone at the table except that our drinks weren't being refilled fast enough and even that was alright for a lazy Saturday afternoon. If I find myself back in the area, would absolutely eat here again. You had me at Wyders.
author: Rebecca S.

description: YAY! I've been trying to try this place and finally had the chance this weekend, it had great service and was prompt on bringing new beverages. Great atmosphere to watch a game - only had the quesadilla which was yummy. Excited to try more on the menu!
author: Donna H.

description:
$33 for dinner and drinks...Yes please!

The sauteed Calamari is Insanely yummy (thank you waiter with nice mustache for recommendation).

There is a large plush purple chair, the house wine is $4.50 and the ambiance is fun, not pushy; a boisterous crowd without being in your face.  Good for a group, a date, a fun session with a friend pre bars or just for a quick bite in the neighborhood.

Big Fan of the B Tower
(PS i also know the hoisen ribs and tuna tacos kick ass from previous trips)
author: Melissa H.

description: As a former culinary student and big foodie I am in love with the steam Mexican mussels. Great food. Great staff. Great place to have fun on a date
author: Jorge B.

description: The Bell Tower is awesome. 4 times out of 4 times I've left extremely pleased. The BBQ ribs were excellent, almost falling off if the bone. Their starters are excellent as well. Would recommend both the spring rolls and the calamari
author: C T.

description:
Waltzing in after work yesterday, I was ready-freddy, for an ice cold beer. I ordered a Stella, which you can do no wrong with in my opinion. I loved the open and breezy feel of this restaurant/bar; It's all windows and has so much light pouring in, great for a sunny afternoon.

The food was borderline for me. I ordered the pork pulled sandie which, I had read was awesome. I think it was just too much for me with the cole slaw that they put on it...too sweet with both the dressing and the BBQ sauce. I ordered a soup special they had, though, and that was pretty damn good. It was a chicken, tomato, red bean soup and the chicken was just so tender! My only complaint about it was that it may have had a tad too much salt in it. 

Side note, I saw two people who had ordered the Mac & Cheese and it looked like a gooey masterpiece. I will definitely try that next time.
author: Julia N.

description:
Really yummy food, delicious drinks and not TOO bad on the wallet. It doesn't hurt that it's on the corner of my street. 
The staff there is always SUPER nice and accommodating. Try the calamari...it rules.
author: Nicole R.

description: Fabulous service! Potato skin appetizer done to perfection!!! Open-window seat at bar gave us the best of both worlds: eating outside indoors. Totally recommend!
author: Rebecca F.

description: Went for breakfast and it was AMAZING!  I had one of the specials that had carnitas, eggs, and a green chile jalepeno bread pudding that was incredible.  This irish coffee and mimosa was also deliscious (of course)!
author: Jeff E.

description:
This is like an upscale elephant bar but in a good way. They try very hard to be a jack of all trades and the presentation is above average. I was originally drawn to the wealth of menu items however I was quite bummed by their inability to cook food regardless of meal time. 

For example, I wanted to try their fish and chips at 11:30 am on a Sunday Morning but they said, "Sorry we're only serving brunch." I'm pretty sure your kitchen is stocked with fish and chips. Why can't you just give me what I want? That's pretty lame. 

Still not a bad spot to chill though. Two LCD tvs that play nothing but sports and outside seating to enjoy the crisp Frisco weather.
author: Jon H.

description: The service and wait staff is very very friendly and attentive. I had the fish and chips and it was really good. Also the BBQ baby back ribs were even better! It's a cool place to hangout and drink but it's not too big
author: Collin W.

description:
The Bell Tower was a fun place to be--filled with (loud) people, a big purple arm chair and other classy, cute decorations. Minus the occasional snobby women who would not quit with their dirty looks, the place is very aesthetically pleasing. Very happy, friendly servers too.
As for the food, I wasn't blown away. Their grilled salmon was good, but lacked creativity with their pineapple and simply diced mangoes. The white fish was good as well, tender and buttery to taste. The rice was a bit on the mushy side. 
I'll probably enjoy this place much more as a legal, bar-capable adult.
author: Carolyn K.

description: The food here is consistent and the atmosphere nice and bright with two big walls of glass looking out on two streets.  This is our neighborhood "Cheers" bar and restaurant for lunch.  The staff could not be nicer and the customers more loyal.
author: Jonathan B.

description: This is a beautiful corner restaurant with good service and a nice cozy atmosphere and pretty bar, food and drinks are consistantly good and service is friendly.  I like stopping in here when I am in the neighborhood.
author: Anibel B.

description:
San Francisco is the city of greaat food... like great food. And this place has good food. In another city this may be a great restaurant but in this city.. the food has to be good otherwise your SOL. 

Bell tower has a good fun atmosphere to hang out but it's nothing amazing, the food is average for san francisco (which is good but not anything amazing), but it's much more expensive then i'd like to pay for okay food. This city has so many hole-in-the-wall places with delicious cheap food.. i prefer that to over priced american food.
author: Annette K.

description:
ok... awesome bar or not, the food and service here sucks.  The mac and cheese is like plain pasta with no flavoring and it swims in a hot pool of bread crumbs... 

No No No
author: Ivy S.

description:
I'm a fan of this neighborhood bar.  Over the past 2 years I've had almost everything on the menu.  The Ahi Tuna Tacos are my favorite.  You get 3 large pieces of ahi on top of a crispy taco shell with assorted vegetables and salsa.  Another favorite is the Fried Brie coated with honey.  Who knew deep fried cheese could be so good?  

Today we sat at the outside tables since it was so nice, but  the service was pretty bad.  There were 3 other tables outside, but I feel like we were forgotten about.  It took forever for drinks to come and when my friend got up to go to the restroom, she said the server was just walking around inside looking spacy.  It shouldn't take 20 minutes to bring a bottled beer outside.  

Maybe this bar is a little too laid back, so come on a day when you aren't in a rush.  Overall it's a good place to come and relax and be lazy with your friends.
author: Nita K.

description:
Went here for brunch and got the Mexican skillet scramble.  A little disappointed with what came - the food was pretty bland, not much spice in the chorizo.  Service was pretty slow and somewhat forgetful, the place was busy, but not packed.

The one saving grace were the french fries - simply amazing!
author: Travis R.

description:
The Bell Tower is like that pair of cozy sweat pants, snugly t-shirt and cute hoodie you throw on when you don't feel like fussing and want quick, easy comfort. 

I stick with a simple repertoire when I order at the Bell. I know what works there and I really don't waiver. Best in show is the excellent bbq'd pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw. The quesadillas are tasty, offered with or without chicken and spiked with hidden hot peppers. The spinach salad works as does the iceberg wedge salad with beets and blue cheese dressing. Good fish & chips, decent French onion soup and unremarkable, yet crave-quelling calamari when you just have to some and you're relaxing at the Bell Tower.

Yes. It's laid back. Doggies abound outside. A few outdoor tables are hot tickets on nice days. Soft drinks are bottomless, refilled for free. The bar turns out refreshing margaritas and Long Island Ice Teas that are sneaky grenades of giddiness.

The Bell isn't fancy. It's easy, welcoming, friendly and always there to take you in, serve you straightforward comfort food and share a smile. Neighborhood spots like this are often taken for granted amidst splashier eateries. But if it were to vanish, I'd miss it dearly - like losing the cozy clothes I reach for when I want to feel pampered without any posturing.
author: wendella a.

description:
I'm in between 3 and 4 stars..
I didn't know what to expect when I first came here. I know a few people who work here and I just assumed it was just a pub. 

Some friends and I went wondering up Polk trying to find somewhere to get our grub on and accidently found Bell Tower. 
We shared apps (ahi tuna tacos, salad, shrimp cakes) and I had the grilled salmon. Everything was amazing! Very surprising and delish.

Nice decor, attentive staff, great food, awesome beer. It's a keeper!
author: Amanda S.

description: Brunch was good. The portions are huge and it's a nice place to hang out, people watch and get drinks. The food wasn't too memorable though. Overall a nice experience but I wouldn't rush back.
author: Aiasha K.

description: This place is awesome. Friendly bartenders and homey feel. The mussels and mahi taco are both a must. The stuffed chicken ad pulled pork are also delicious. You can basically order anything here and have a good meal. Oh an it happens to be unbelievably affordable. There is nothing about this place I don't like.
author: Keith B.

description:
Oh, Bell Tower, I'd give you 3.5 stars if Yelp would let me. I first grabbed dinner at the BT a few months back, where I found the chicken entree to be surprisingly delicious. Mashed potatoes were fantastic (re: butter) and whatever side vegetable I had (green beans? broccoli?) was also great. I think the bf had steak or something manly, and he seemed to be equally impressed.

Flash forward to last night and it's a different story - the staff was playing with the overhead lights for a solid 15 minutes "off? on. now they're off. now they're on! ok, now they're off again." Chicken quesadilla and grilled chicken sandwich were just so so, but the pulled pork sandwich was actually quite good. Fries were a hit amongst the three of us. 

If you're swinging by for a beer, some fries, and maybe a pulled pork sammie - go for it. But if you're looking for a solid meal that's worth writing home about, head elsewhere.
author: Eva B.

description:
One Friday night, I decided to have a date with myself (...and who better??). 
Wondering Polk street, I came across Bell Tower and immediately knew I must take myself out to dinner there. Upon entering, the crowd varied from couples, to a few loners (like me) at the bar, and some groups enjoying the environment. 
As I sat at the bar, I admired the art-deco painting of chiseled men holding up the establishment. There are a few TV's, so I had entertainment. 

My favorites include:
-Split Level seating (when I came back with friends, we enjoyed sitting above a group of Marina Yuppies who mean-mugged us when we walked in... who's mean-muggin now, huh? Who's higher??? WHO IS HIGHER??)
-Chair from Alice in Wonderland... 
-Awesomely delicious, yet CHEAP menu (I was a cheap date to my wallet!)

Loved it!
author: Rada I.

description:
Other than good location and friendly staff, this place is unremarkable.  Stopped in and had a burger today and margarita.  Ordered medium rare.  The margarita was apparently a "virgin" one because there's was little to no alcohol in and unfortunately it was served in a tall glass, so I ended up drinking 1000 calories of mix.  The burger was okay but cooked completely through.  In fact, when I picked it up, I new it was way overcooked because of the feel of it.  Is it really so hard to cook a burger somewhere less than "well done"?  Also, it was incredibly loud for being less than half full at 5:00 on a Saturday afternoon.

Probably won't be back anytime soon, unless it's just for a beer because the pub aspect of the place is nice.
author: Kevin M.

description: Came here for brunch. They don't open till 10:30 which seems a little late but I guess that's what makes it a brunch not breakfast spot. I had the veggie eggs Benedict and the hollandaise sauce was delicious. Tried my friend's nachos and those were bomb as well. Nice ambiance, attentive and sweet waitress. People at the bar seemed pleased. No standout/signature dishes but id definitely come back again.
author: Siobhan T.

description: I like this place, it is nice neighborhood bar. It has good food interesting specials and the menu has some great items. The Mac and cheese is fantastic. The Brie salad is great and they have Pulled Pork Nachos that I wish I could get at 3 am when I really need that type of thing
author: Sean C.

description:
Somehow I always find my way here on the weekends when I visit my fav shops in the Polk/Bdwy area.

I usually order the burgers or their pulled BBQ Pork Sandwich.( IMO The Best Ever ) with big fries but I actually subsitute them for the Wasabe Mashed Potates....Oh My Good ! Heaven on a fork !

And for some crazy reason, people are actually friendly here, especially at the bar. 
They have two large TV's  for us sports nuts. Actually I'm not that nutty.

The service here can be great and/or not great.  mmm

So I get up and just get what I need. A napkin, or fork or another drink. 
Because I like this place. 
Funny how life gets very simlpe sometimes .

They also have tables outside as well, which I like in good weather.
Sitting in the sun and having a beer with friends is perfect.

Not to mention Barbies' two bull mastifs. 
Barbie owns this place and her two little ones (around 100lbs apiece!) are usually behind the bar or sleeping outside. 

They're as gentle as can be. And usually quite sleepy. 
Very Nice. Love them.
author: Katherine N.

description:
Right off the bat I have to talk about their food. Now typically, there is a  sort of the stigma that goes along with the idea of bar food, but this place has never disappointed me. Everything that I've had off their menu is excellent and the staff are always on point with the customers.

My recommendation is to try the vegetarian burger and fries. Yum.
author: Peter S.

description: I had my 21st birthday dinner here and I was really stoked with the staff. They accommodated my 15 person party, which is saying something because the restaurant is on the small side. My friend brought me a cake and candles and the wait staff stored it in the kitchen and brought it out for,me after dinner with the candles lit. The food was good AND I got to do a birthday shot that tasted like a chocolate cake! i wish it wasn't a two bus ride from my house in the sunset but other than that, it was perfect!
author: Emily G.

description:
Yelpers keep asking, "Why is The Bell Tower so popular?" The answer, of course, is that the Bell Tower is easy. Allow me to explain:

The Bell Tower is one of those laid back places that you're glad to have in the neighborhood. The food is totally unremarkable, but the wait staff are super friendly. Best of all, The Bell Tower is always there when you need it.

Need a place on Polk to get drinks with friends where you can actually sit and talk with one another? The Bell Tower.

Need a place to watch the game that isn't full of screaming idiots? The Bell Tower.

Need a place to sit outside in Polk Gulch? The Bell Tower.

It's really the perfect place for when you want to get out of the house and not have it be a big production. It's easy.

I mean, let's face it kids, we live in a world where easy = popular. Think of your easy friend. She's pretty popular, isn't she? And what about that credit card in your wallet? So easy that you use it all the time, right? These days, even finding a coffee place is so easy that we'd rather pay $1.60 (shame on you, Peet's) than brew it ourselves.
  
Keep on bein' easy, Bell Tower. It's why you're so popular.
author: Brad L.

description:
The best way to describe The Bell Tower is that it's The Balboa without the pretentiousness.  I seem to have developed the habit of coming here after my soccer games still wearing my goalie gear, including shinguards. No one  bats an eye at it. 

Also sitting at the counter I always end up having a really good coversation. The best of which was with an older Scottish woman on Celtic vs Rangers and how Scotland could gain hope from the plight of the Chicago Cubs.
author: Beau G.

description:
UPDATE:

I got a message from this asshole that just registered today - Gee, 'Steven' youre not an owner or a server there, are you?????

This is from Steven M.:

'In the end who was really rude? Do you honestly think your foul mouthed diatribe will hurt a staple restaurant like the Bell Tower? I'll answer the question for you because I feel that you are an ignorant, narrow minded creature. I'm sorry Renee but the Bell Tower will go on without you. I don't believe they need your "kind" in their establishment. Black hair, chubby, tattoos, Asian. These are very personal / racial attacks that you are throwing around. I frequent the Bell Tower at least once a week, and I'm glad that I will never see your face. It's time to grow up Renee, you live in California. 

p.s. Do you kiss your husband with that filthy mouth?"

MY RESPONSE:

"Filthy mouth?" What are you talking about? How was I filthy?
"Racist?" get your facts straight - using those words you say are 'racist' and "personal attacks"? those are called 'describing words' dipshit. And, describing your experience, thats why this site exists.

This is a joke, and youre an f'ing idiot Steven. Enjoy your shitty service at the Belltower.




MY ORIGINAL REVIEW - NOT UNLIKE OTHERS ON HERE:

First, the food - mainly the burger, is great. Why I gave 2 stars. The food deserves the 2 stars. Comfy atmosphere, right in my hood, casual.

The help -  seriously, there should be negative stars available for places like this place. The asian girl the the long black hair - been there forever, she isnt nice, frequently rude, but nothing compared with the complete f'ing idiot I had wait on me today. Black hair, chubby and tattoos.

Today, I left a $1.20 tip. I have done the $1-2 dollar tip to make a point maybe 2 other times in my life. I had to SERIOUSLY think about leaving the dollar and just giving her the $.20 in change.

I had to ask to be seated at a table. I had to ask for silverware-after the food came. I had to ask for bread again after not getting it the first time, and then - never got it. I had to ask for mayo twice. I had to ask for refills, my husband got his but I didnt get mine. I had to ask for a to go box twice. I had to ask for the bill.  

All this -  I had to ask the broad with the long black hair, the one thats not nice - because our waitress was completely never there! Now, Im ok with her not being friendly, because at least she does the extreme basic of waiting tables - she got us shit!!!

She took our order, dumped off the food, and that was it. I waited so long for the silverware that I got up to get it myself. 

I will say one thing though - the place is WAY understaffed which is unfair to the waitstaff, no matter how dumb or bitchy.

Summation:
OWNER OF BELL TOWER -  HIRE PEOPLE THAT GIVE A SHIT.
author: renee m.

description:
I have never actually had the food here, so this is mostly about the beer and bar. I have been here on two occasions and both times I had a blast. 

The 1st was after hours with my friends and James (the owner of Black Horse London Pub http://www.yelp.com/biz/kM64kcWiK3TqhB0HeAUGeg ) 
He closed the bar and we came here for an after hours drink. I don't remember specifics about that night (except for the nice Irish man that chatted with me ALL night and then never called! Bastard!) but the bartender was great, she served all of us drunks until we could barely stand and then sent us on our merry drunken way at about 3:30 a.m. to stumble up to the pizza place on Polk that stays open to feel us drunkards. 

The 2nd was last Saturday where we stopped with a large group to buy a birthday boy shots and beers and hang out! The waiter was nice and let us push tables together for us all to sit and drink at! (Actually he insisted that we do it!) This impressed me since people were still eating and he was basically giving up tips by letting is invade his space! The drinks are not a bad deal (4 bucks for a cider beer), and the bar tender is still the nice lady I remember from last time! 

On another interesting note: There was an orgy going on, on the patio behind me. I guess 2 ladies (one in very questionable attractiveness) and a man decided that it was a superb idea to begin a 3 way make out session right behind my head (my back was to the front glass window) so it was kind of awkward until I figured out what was going on. I felt like I had something on my face because it looked like half the bar was staring at me. I chalk it up to that weekend, because I saw similar trashiness at the Holy Cow the night before (I did review my experience there too!)
author: Jessica R.

description:
Pirate Pub Crawl bar #2

(OK, who said pirates were timely?  So I missed bar #1.  What of it?)

To be fair, I have not partaken of any of their food or drink.  But it was a fine spot to meet up with a bunch of pirates.  The pirates seemed happily well into their cups, and there the civilians were contentedly eating meals on the other side of the room.
author: Andi T.

description:
I would like everyone to take a moment to appreciate how hard it is for me to give a restaurant, especially one with a full bar one star.  And extra especially one that has a cobb salad on the menu.  The perfect food.  Completely impossible to mess up it involves all of my favorite things, bacon, cheese and crunchy veggie's so I can feel like I'm being healthy. Given a full bar and a cobb salad, anyone who knows me would think there was no way possible for a place to get less then three stars.

So let's take a moment to look at just how this amazing feat of disgust was accomplished.

First, I must say that I have heard about how bad this place is and had absolutely NO intention of going here.  I was on my way to Nick's Crunchy Taco Happiness which was closed for Easter.

Hmm... I thought traffic was a little light that sunday.

Any-who. After walking around the area, seeing everything closed for Easter, getting worried about making it to Red Devil to see Colin Hay, I see that The Bell Tower is open.

Cue ominous music.

I order a cosmo from my overly chipper waitress.  I'm in the mood for something a little tart, so I even ask for Charbay vodka for a little extra kick.  Some strange game of telephone ensues between myself, the waitress and the bartender and I find myself with a sirupy sweet Kamikaze.  Oh. No. Way.  This is WAY to close to the Marina for this type of mistake to be made.  Unfortunately, Colin is waiting so I smile and go back to my day dream in which I slap the chirp out of the waitress and keep the drink.

Then the food arrives.  My partner ordered the burger.  It was... well.... in his words "OK I guess".  That is slightly less tasty then just "OK."  He's nearly as picky about his burgers as I am about my cosmos so you can take that how ever you like.  

My Cobb Salad however will go down in history as the Cobb Salad that broke my faith in the Cobb Salad Religion.  And on Easter Sunday no less!  I knew the chicken was going to be fried.  I'm ok with that.  I like me the fried chicken.  However, I had assumed that they would at least blotted the grease off it before plopping it down on an overly dressed, under bacon'd pile of greens.  I felt like I would have had a healthier meal at McDonalds.

We finally got our check from a waitress, ours having figured her job was over after she took our order had gone on to spread her chipper self elsewhere, and ran down to Red Devil and my date with Colin who made me feel immensely better. Not only can that man sing, he's funny and it's hard to dwell on bad food when you're doing a spit take with a (real) cosmo.
author: Cosmolicious L.

description:
Because we live just a few blocks away and really want to support the neighborhood joints (i.e we're too lazy to walk much farther), we've been foolish enough to give Bell Tower a chance multiple times. With the exception of a passable dinner of mussels in white wine sauce- the food snob buried in my brain sits up, yawns, proclaims "how passe", and goes back to sleep- all meals taken here have been miserable.

Greasy, undercooked food + rude, inattentive service = Bell Tower, so mediocre even the owner's dog won't sleep inside.

Update: We were somehow convinced to go back here a few weeks ago, at which point I was served a pulled-pork sandwich that looked worse than a McDonald's happy meal taken from the box and placed on a plate. Brown plain bun, a handful of obviously pre-frozen fries, and absolutely no garnish of any kind. 
I'd previously rated it with 2 stars, but now really wish Yelp allowed zero or below. 
Simply terrible.
author: Justin M.

description:
I hate to use the word "weird". But that is all I can think of to describe this place. The vibe in here is just weird. It may depend on the night you go or the time. Maybe it depends if the Corkey guy sitting alone chatting it up with anyone who walks by and tries to hold the waitresses hand is there or not. 

The bartender was nice, I think a little drunk, but nice. Not that I'd complain, but she forgot to charge us for our first to beverages. She was playing text message phone tag with someone on her phone and forgot she was working for a bit, but hey I do that too, I just dont serve people at my work. Hello!!! It's rude and when attention is needed, it's not cool at all. 

The paints on the ceiling and wall with the man body's and woman faces are creepy. The food smells like fast food. 

The cocktails were delicious!

Cheers!
author: Dee C.

description:
I have been a few times in the past, sat at the bar and had an OK time.  This afternoon I was there with two friends so we took a regular table.  What followed was such an unpleasant experience that not only did I try to lodge a complaint (the waitress proceeded to cut me off and argue with me and no "manager" was available when I asked) but we left a small tip and none of us will return.  Too bad for the Bell Tower.

As I see from other reviews, the "waitress with the long black hair" has not only thrown her piss-poor attitude our way.  Why is she still working there?  We waited FOREVER to get our drinks, to begin.  Everything was delivered to the table with a curt or short comment.  We waited for the second round of drinks until our meal was more than half done, and when my friend got up to inquire (we had already asked about them once before) she was told, "Why don't you sit down so I can bring them to you?"  Nice.  We also ordered a side of guac which never arrived and yet we were charged for.  When we pointed this out, she just disappered with the check.  No "sorry about that".  God forbid.

I worked in the bar and restaurant industry for several years and many of my friends still do.  We enjoy going out, are friendly and good to our servers and always tip a solid 20% or higher.  We are not high maintenance (unless wanting to receive what you order and not pay for things you don't get counts as being difficult.)  

If it's shitty attitude, arguments, and a hard time you're looking for, you should do well to visit the Bell Tower.  Personally, for my time and money, I will visit any of the numerous other destinations on Polk St in the future and skip this place all together.  I gave them one star for a spicy bloody mary and a good quesadilla, wooo hoooo.
author: Rina A.

description:
This was my second experience at the Bell Tower but the first merely consisted of waiting to be seated, having the hostess be rude to us, and finally giving up in frustration 30 minutes later.  

Happily today's venture was much more successful.  We were greeted by several of the friendly staff, promptly given our choice of seats, and the service continued to be attentive.  

Actually, for a place that has the reputation of being overly crowded most days, we witnessed a minor miracle: room to slide chairs and walk around despite the World Cup game on in the background (congrats to USA, a tie with England is huge!)  The crowd was excited about the game and had that congenial atmosphere so many sports bars lack.

I had the Ceasar Salad (meh) and the pulled pork sandwich which I would throw in the top third of pulled pork sandwiches I've eaten... it's not from Austin or Kansas City but it's definitely good.  

Only downside was lunch for 2 and a couple drinks each came to $60 with tip.  Hard to say it's a good value but it's convenient and the atmosphere was nice.
author: David K.

description:
Best French Toast I've had since they discontinued it at Fresca.
We've only been here for brunch and keep coming back every few weeks.  The food is consistent, outside seating is a huge plus, and the prices are reasonable.

The only minus is that the portions (specifcally the french toast) are small.  Granted, I eat like i should be 300 lbs so this may be a non-issue for anyone normal.
author: Joshua J.

description:
When you're in the mood for good IPA on tap, head here for some Dogfish.

The bar is not too big, but not too small either.  Good seating.  Bartenders are nice and take your order promptly.

Two plasma screens for the games.  Big screen towards the back.

Lots of tables and the outside area is perfect for those warm days.

Drinks are ok, but I like their tap selection for being a little different from other places.

Crowd is here for dinner last night I think and it's sort of an odd bar / bistro like kind of joint blended together.

I like how this is the only bar between the Broadway scene and the lower Polk area.  Kind of off the radar a little, which I like.
author: Patrick K.

description: I love the friendly atmosphere here.  The bartenders are always attentive and create a fun filled environment.  I love relaxing at the bar or at the outside tables.  The specials are always creative, flavorful and plentiful in size.  Pork Chop was amazing! Love the steak salad and mussels and clams.  One of my favorite non pretentious San Francisco hang outs!!!!
author: Joan R.

description: Great service, great drink prices. Did not eat food, but looked good from what I saw.
author: Carl C.

description:
Let me start by saying that the chorizo breakfast burrito here is AHmazing. I occasionally dream about eating this burrito. It's fabulous, and I could go on and on about it....

The really unfortunate thing about the Bell Tower is that, like most other Yelpers have mentioned below me, the service totally SUCKS. I've convinced myself to go back because I'm obsessed with their chorizo burrito, but every time I end up kicking myself in the end because the service is so terrible- might even be the worst Ive experienced in SF. 

The last time I was there the food took about an hour and 15 minutes, we didn't get drink orders taken until 30 minutes after we were seated, we were desperate to get our waters re-filled but it was impossible to get our waiters attention (and it WASNT EVEN BUSY). I ordered a side of fruit and ended up getting a chopped up bruised banana. I'm sorry, but I'm not about to eat a piece of brown fruit. Try again.

One of my friends ordered a tea and and the lid to her tea pot was a shot glass that still had remnants of whiskey in it. Um...is this a joke? I felt like we were being taped for that MTV show 'Boiling Points'- where if the victims can keep their cool then they win $100. Nope, that definitely was not the case. 

And then there was the bill....ohhhhh dear lord...the BILLL....I don't even want to remember how long that took to get. 

Everyone I was with, including myself, went delirious at the table because we had been sitting and waiting for so long for everything. It was absurd. And, I haven't been back to the Bell Tower since then...which is really really sad because I miss their chorizo burrito :(
author: Katie S.

description:
I still remember the first time Henry brought me here...sometime in 2000 when we were working on Sutter & Franklin....Sally was already workin here and I thought it was a good neighborhood bar/grill...I was not a drinker then, so I was there for the FOOD only..it was great....lol

And now, 8 years later, our office has moved and Bell Tower is just down the block.  This is a place we would come about twice a week...

On the menu:

1) DO try the mussels, its TASTY and a VERY good deal, for only $ 8.50..Its listed as an appetizer but trust me, it will fill u up, the broth is amazing!!! 

2) I also like the sauteed calamari, in marinara sauce( $ 8.00)... 

3) The beef salad is yummy but they do give u alot of beef (sirloin), so be prepared to be stuffed!! 

4) They start serving the bar menu at 3pm, its basically the same as the regular lunch menu, except for the buffalo wings, which is MY FAVORITE!!  

5) As for the dinner menu, I would recommend the ribeye...Its tender and juicy and perfectly cooked...( $ 21.50)

As for the staff, they've got the cutest waitresses...Tara, Shayda and Megan and the owner Barbie...AWESOME!!!  Be sure to take a shot of fernet with her!!! lol
author: Pris C.

description:
The best thing I can say about this place is that the service is good - fast, attentive and responsive. The food was just alright. The dinner menu seemed a little fancy and expensive for bar food but the bar menu was more my speed - classic appetizers, sandwiches and burgers.

I got a burger that had a pretty good patty, but the bun was some focaccia-like bread that was so crispy on the top and bottom that my burger was annoyingly unflexible and scraped the inside of my mouth the way super hard sourdough crust can. Not a very pleasurable experience. 

I'd probably go back to this place for drinks, but only if I can Muni or cab there. We drove around for what seemed like an eternity looking for parking and didn't see a single open spot or even a "P" parking sign to direct us to a garage. We were about to give up on meeting our friends when we finally stumbled across what seemed to be like the only garage in the entire area. Ridiculous.
author: Kristina A.

description:
This place has a good vibe and good reasonably priced food. The crowd varies in age, but they are all pretty down to earth. Barbie is a whip behind the bar making it a pleasure even if you have to have your meal at the bar in the evening. AND I love their brunch... 

AND Mimosas. ;-)
author: Alexis M.

description:
Awful!!
They refused to seat us a party of 4 at a 5 top. It was 10pm last Fri. We wanted to grab a bite and have drinks. The only thing worth eating anyway are the Tuna Tacos. We even asked if we invited someone to sit with us if we could then sit there. No! The chick was a flat out bitch about the situation. She then agreed but with a sneer and a condition. If a party of 5 came in then we would have to move.
   I don't think so. I said Fuck that shit and we had a GREAT dinner with EXCELLENT service at Street.
author: Douggers M.

description: Solid spot for lunch. The food is great (get the salads and tuna tacos and nachos and french fries.... that should be enough food right?) and they're extremely friendly in there.  Probably wouldn't go for dinner, but it's a perfect neighborhood gem lunch spot!
author: Victoria L.

description:
I've eaten here four or five times now and have always enjoyed the food.  Today, however, the poor service I've read about in other reviews reared its nasty head.  If you cannot get a glass of water and an iced tea to my table before the food comes out, then we've got problems.  Refills?  Forget it.  I really don't ask for much when I dine out, but this kind of lackluster indifference really sours my grapes.

That said, I really like the food here.  The pulled pork BBQ sandwich is fantastic.  The breakfast burrito and Southwestern omelet are also quite tasty, chock full o' black bean goodness.  Wife has good things to report about the grilled chicken sandwich.  They don't skimp on the french fries, either, which are skinny and crispy.  All good.

Unfortunately, it might be a while before I venture back here to pay $20 to be ignored and go thirsty.
author: Daryl E.

description:
If it weren't for the awesome burger, I'd give this place one star.   The service was absolutely horrible.  Once we had gotten our food (my burger had the wrong kind of cheese), our server didn't come by our table again for the entire meal.  Our party of five had empty water glasses and even worse, empty beer glasses.  I decided to go up to the bar and take matters into my own hands and order the drinks directly.  The bartender refused to serve me and said that our server would take our order from the table.  Even after this, our server didn't come by again until she brought us the check.  No water refills, no beer refills, no basic service.

On the upside, my burger was great (minus the cheese issue, but I was hungry, so it was ok).
author: Kathleen B.

description:
Brunch here is not very good. I always end up coming here though because my friends don't want to wait for a table anywhere.

The last time I went we had a really bitchy waittress who was rude and unattentive. Usually when I have a few mimosas I feel like I tend to get a little friendlier but the waittress was still noticeably bitchy, even at the end of the meal when I was a little boozed up. She also took about 3 years to get us our check. Foodwise, my eggs benedict was completely flavorless. It was probably one of the worst bennies I've ever had. How one fucks up poached eggs, ham, hollandaise and an english muffin is beyond me. Next time I hear, "let's just go to Bell Tower," I'm walking down to La Boulange to get a giant coffee and an almond croissant (and a macaroon and a cannele).
author: Alli J.

description: Food was nothing to brag about. The service I encountered at this place was completely uncalled for. Very very rude and you can tell they had no interest in working and you are bothering asking for anything. I suggest not being in the service industry..It's very common in this area to have nothing but rude customer service, just amazes me that the owners tolerate that kind of behavior.. Go somewhere else unless you like terrible service.
author: Joshua s.

description:
One of my newly found spots, I may still be in the honeymoon phase, so what.  Not only did my friend am I meet some REAL down to earth and handsome men next to us, but the bartender kept us laughing the whole evening.  We only expected to grab a beer, but stayed until the place closed on a school night!
This place could not be overpriced at all!  Good food, made from scratch, and the prices are surprisingly low, seriously.  The service is personal and always works with a smile on their faces.  Reminds me of an East Coast bar, so give it try for a change of pace.
author: Lulu B.

description:
This place is really cool. The staff just has energy. At a lot of places the staff act like they are at work, and in my experience here that staff acted as if they were hanging out with their friends (in a really professional, good kind of way).  I was taken here on a  "hot date" and was thoroughly impressed with the whole experience. 
We arrived, saw a open table outside, and since it was a gorgeous day we decided  to sit outdoors and soak up the sunshine. We told the hostess and during that awkward moment where you aren't sure if you should just go sit down, or wait for her to hand you the menu's someone sat at the table. She noticed went outside and politely told him we had already  "called" the table (plus a couple stars for that). 

We started out our dining expirience with the most wonderful potato skins I have ever tasted. I had heard rave reviews about the awesome garden burger, so that was my meal selection. IT WAS AMAZING. I was surprised. It was not like the one's you get in the freezer section ( I like those too though) It was bigger and juicier, but made out of the same stuff. The fries that accompanied the burger were just ok. 

We were pleased to have dinner and a show as one of the patron's doggies was outside being oh so well behaved. Her name was Bodi, and she was so cute !! Everyone there seemed very friendly and as if they all knew each other. The only downfall of the evening was that it did take a while to finally get the ticket, but not so long that it was a big deal. I will definitely be coming back !!
author: Camille A.

description:
I love Bell Tower! They have amazing brunch, and really surprising lunch/dinner food. The place looks like your average pub, so it is shocking that the menu has more to offer than chicken wings and mozzarella sticks. 

The service is okay, not great. The place is always crowded, and they aren't the most organized and managing the crowd, but the food makes up for it. 

This is one of my neighborhood favs!
author: Jamie C.

description: The server messed up and served my quesidilla with chorizo instead of the pulled pork. It was pretty gross.... I like grease and all, but I don't want my food swimming in it.
author: Amanda B.

description: Today the bell tower made me do something I haven't done in years. Walk out without leaving a tip.  I had to walk to the bar to get my silverware, napkins and my drink and refills. The only time I saw the server was when he dropped my food off. I even had to order from the bar. Not tipping is not something I take lightly. I consider it an insult however I felt that it was justified in this case.  The food was ok, I had the nachos but for $10.50 I would expect some guacamole.  It wasn't good enough to pull the star meter off 1.
author: Isaac S.

description:
This is a good place to go if you have time on your hands and are not interested in the service aspect of the dining experience. 

Food is decent, portions are good.  Just don't go here before a show or anything because the times I've gone, we've often had to wait a LOOONG time for our food.  Not always... but sometimes - disaster.
author: Rose Q.

description: Great bar and restaurant. Has been here for 17 years for a reason! Classic bar food and friendly service. Have walked in multiple times and even booked the back area for about 20 of us. Very accommodative and just a great all around bar/restaurant.
author: Tom W.

description:
The Bell Tower definitely fills the void in Russian Hill of a place where you can get decent food, cold beer and a football game on TV.  The only reason that I ever go here is because it's convenient. It is what it is.  The food is never outstanding, the service is never great, but they both get the job done and I always leave with the thought that 'hey, that was a wholly unremarkable meal, but I'm full and I'm somewhat satisfied...' The only thing on the menu worth mentioning is the pulled pork sandwich, which is quite good (order it without coleslaw though!!) I always wonder if all the other people in the restaurant (it's almost always full) leave with the same thoughts in their heads....

So...a couple weeks after originally writing this review and giving the Bell 3 stars, I've had to revise it.  My girlfriend and I come here often and have always had a good time. The bartenders are GREAT!! They take good care of you and remember what your drink is.  Also, their Saturday morning breakfast is awesome and the mimosas are made with fresh-squeezed OJ, which is key for a good cocktail at 10am.  The regular menu is still unremarkable but it gets the job done.
author: Craig E.

description:
I would give this 2.5 if I could, but I'll be nice and round up.

There were plenty of people in the restaurant, but I would in no way call it "really busy" or full. After being seated, my friend and I waited a few minutes for the waitress, who finally came and listed the specials- too quick for us to catch them, then TOOK OFF without asking if we'd like anything to drink (even though we both tried to interject).

About 10 minutes later, another waitress stopped by to get our drink orders, then quickly left before we could give our food orders. Finally, our original waitress came back and took our order. It took quite some time to get, and during that time we never saw our waitress. 

Once the food was there, she asked my friend if he'd like another beer, then kind of took off as he answered. He repeated that he would like one in a few minutes. We never saw our waitress again....until after the bill came. Once she saw our money down, she quickly came by, swept up our plates, and asked us if we needed change. Never got another drink, never any sort of decent service. 

My food was lukewarm when I got it. I ordered the chicken sandwich with brie, and was super excited to eat it...turned out to be a very dry dry sandwich. No sort of dressing (aoili, mayo, nada), not warm, cheese barely melted, fries not really hot. 

Luckily, I was having a good time with my pal. But as I write this, it's making me kind of pissy so I am going down to 2 stars...
author: Annie F.

description:
I went here with some friends that live in Russian Hill, and I totally dig the atmosphere. Small, intimate setting, cool decor, very Medieval feel, which I adored. I felt like a child in a storybook, to be completely honest.

We sat in the upper section, right next to this mega huge purple chair that looked like a throne. I totally wanted to eat my dinner while sitting in that chair, but I restrained myself from indulging this clearly immature impulse. Like I said, this place seemed to bring out the child in me.

Our waiter, a tall black-haired man, was very courteous and took good care of us. While the size of the place says "cafe" the service was par with a much nicer grade of restaurant. I order the French onion soup, which was probably the best of its kind that I had ever tasted. We also ordered a bottle of Pinot Noir (the name of the exact variety escapes me) that was incredibly delicious (I'm on a total red wine kick lately).

There was also an old, weathered door with one of those antique knockers right by our table that looked like it led to some enchanted land beyond. "I wonder where that door leads to" I said to my friends with a wide-eyed stare, my imagination running wild. "Eh, probably a wine cellar or something," they dismissively replied. Turns out it was just another door to the outside, which I discovered with some disappointment when someone used it to exit to the street. *Sigh*

This place completely charmed me. I'll certainly be back for more (and maybe I'll even try eating my dinner in the purple throne next time).
author: Marie W.

description: Good bar food and atmosphere. Service was great.
author: Erik S.

description:
I've only had brunch here - and as a rule I have brunch when it hurts too much to get up for breakfast so my perception may be a bit off - and the food was fine.  They had  fresh, housemade, cilantro-filled-yum salsa for my homefries which always makes me happy.

I've found the service here to be consistently friendly if a bit quirky.  If you are not a fan of the slightly familiar, yeah-I'm-hungover-too type - don't come here.

And they get an extra star for having a wonderfully light and air-filled dining room on sunny Sunday mornings.
author: Suzanne B.

description:
The Bell is great place to grab a quick cocktail or 3. The staff is always friendly, the drinks are strong and the atmosphere is usually laid back.

Great place to bring out of town friends for a locals type of experience.
author: Brian M.

description:
The Bell Tower started as a mistake, and grew to be one of my favorite local haunts on the Polk Street scene. 

Understanding from the beginning that this is not a "hip" or "cool" place to hang out is important, and is part of its draw. There are plenty of bars to meet people, listen to music, or rub up against the other sex while horrible techno music thumps through your ears, and The Bell Tower is not one of those places. 

It serves food late, typically until midnight, which means it retains a dinning room feel well into the evening. The ambiance is subdued and their are usually a few colorful characters hoisted onto stools at the bar. It has a very local pub feel, where conversation is easy and the lights are dim. 

The food is tasty, albeit nothing to rave about specifically. They do have a decent burger and a few salad options, as well as a few more up-scale menu items. The bar is complete, and Barb knows how to make all the normal fare. 

All in all, a great late night pub.
author: Peter C.

description:
Came in for a late Sunday eve dinner. I've been in SF/northern Cali for almost a week and I don't want to leave! So after a wedding weekend of partying I wasn't looking to drink and  just wanted a mellow meal. my buddy who lives near by suggested this spot. We got there and were greeted by a friendly waitress who let us sit at a big well located table even though it was just two of us. 

For food, I had had a late huge lunch, so I just went with the french onion soup which was gooey and just the right temperature. I also had a spinach salad with walnuts, blue cheese, and thick cut crumbled bacon. It was all solid. Nothing mind blowing, but just what the doctor ordered. My buddy had the burger and I tried it, also very juicy, flavorful meat and on an interesting not quite foccacia, but cousin of foccacia type roll. 

The place just had a nice warm vibe to it, and I felt at home. The prices were reasonable. There were some people but it wasn't packed or busy, so i'd suggest hitting it at similar hours after the dinner swell.
author: John L.

description:
Why am I writing this instead of frantically flash-carding like a disgruntle 1L-life-is-hell?

Because I've developed a mild-but-still-painful repetitive stress/strain injury to my wrist.  From what?  FLASH-Effing-CARDS.

Want to ruin a tennis great's backhand?  Or his fore-hand?  Or just take away their ability to hold ANYTHING heavier than a cell phone?  Give them a semester's worth of property, civ pro, contracts, and torts, 6 decks of flash cards tell them that unless they fill the flashcards with impossibly small print, all the Disney fairies will come poop on the grave of your ancestors.  

ok, it's not as vivid as that.  

It's more like a slow, casual, disintegration of one's grasp on reality.  I've gradually lost the ability to make sensible food choices.  However, I have developed a knack for picking possibly the most disagreeable thing on the menu.  This is not to say that it will disagree with everyone.  Just one who has eaten more beige colored things in the last 2 two weeks than any other color.  And the last 5 green things I ate were a pack of Now-and-Later.  Lime.  Yum.

I got the salt and pepper calamari.  Fried.  Crisp.  The breading was a bit too-too.  Not unconscionable, but not entirely agreeable.  I was trying to chose between that and the fish and chips.  Louis got the fish and chips.  He didn't finish it.  The chips were shoe string.  Not thick hearty wedge cut.  Maybe I've finally learned that fish and chips in the US are like PF Chang's?  

Tori got the quesadilla, she didn't finish hers either.

Chris got the spaghetti and marinara with garlic bread.  He did finish his.  Possibly the only one.  Should have ordered that.  Should not have ordered another fried, battered, drippy-dippy appetizer.  

Oh yes, the Thai dipping sauce that came with it was surprising.  And not in a good way.  Marinara would have been better but I attribute this to every trendy SF's weak attempt at Asian Fusion (i.e. use soy sauce to appeal to a wider audience).  

Can someone just make a decent fish and chips so that I can order something at a bar and not feel sick after?  It may help if I stop taking finals.  I'll let you know after this Tort-ure.
author: Christina C.

description:
Standard food executed fine.  Beer selection nothing special - they were out of the one my buddy ordered.  Had a burger which was served on an interesting roll - thin but hard.  

Nobody was there at 7 when we got there but by 8 pm every table was full, including a table of hyenas.  They shrieked like there was no tomorrow.  Always nice to have free entertainment with your meal.
author: Aaron T.

description:
Left with a bad taste in my mouth. 

In search of a place to have breakfast on Jan 2nd we end up at Bell Tower who is only serving lunch. Not a big deal. We have a party of four and sit at the bar waiting for a table to open up. Three people come in after us and are seated at a small round table that could easily accommodate four. O well guess we can be patient. 

Finally sit and are ready to order. After 10 minutes the waiter comes over to drop off menu's but we let him know we are ready to order. We give the order but rather than writing it down he tries to remember it. 

Tuna taco was great and a great value
Two orders of mac and cheese, both were under cooked, soupy in consistency, and he forgot chorizo in one of them. 
Veggie burger and salad were fine. 
Completely forgot the fish and chips or the coffee. 

Overall food was below par, service was very pour being exacerbated by a waited that wants to try to remember the order rather than writing it down.  

To make up for it the waiter offered to "get us next time". ?????? (How thoughtful)
author: Jon S.

description: This place is good if you're in the mood for a beer and some hearty American pub food, but don't really want to go to a pub. There's a bar and a TV if you want to hang out and watch whatever game is on, but there's a good number of tables (inside and outside) and it seems to feel more like a restaurant than a pub to me. While it can be lively when it's full, I've never found the Bell Tower to be super loud, which is nice when you want to catch up with friends. My roommates and I have come here a number of times after work, and have really enjoyed all of the pulled pork options (pulled pork sandwich, pulled pork quesadilla, and nachos with pulled pork...mmm) as well as the fish and chips. We may have tried some of the pasta dishes at some point too, which I remember being satisfying and tasty but not particularly memorable. My advice is to order the pulled pork!
author: Caroline T.

description: The neighborhood bar for grown-ups. Good food and the nicest folks in the world. Ktichen RELIABLY serving until midnight.
author: David N.

description:
nothing special... seriously.

We went for some snacks. Got pretty much every single app on the menu. First of all they failed to mention the mass amounts of sour crem placed on top of the potato skins. now I know this is a common practice but usually it says some where on the menu that this normally delicious treat will have nastiness spread all over it.  Watch out if you arent a fan.

besides mac and cheese at resturants if I see an blue cheese wedge on the menu... game on. Really good and I was alittle upset when my partner in crime bogarted the whole thing. 

"Save me some blue cheese crumbles!!"

I'd go again to try the breakfast. I love me some greasy delicicousiness after a long ass three day weekend in LAS VEGAS!
author: Nancy B.

description:
I have walked by this place for six years and never made it for a drink or meal until today.  I was missing out.   It is a great place for a sunny afternoon lunch in SF.  The seats outside are nice - somewhat shaded, but sunny too.  The food was delicious.  I had the chicken and brie sandwich.  Tasty.  I love brie. My friend had the ham and cheese and told me several times how much she loved it.

The service was nice too.
author: Angie C.

description: Great food, fast service & drinks are right on! We had the stuffed chicken breast with steamed vegetables along with mashed potatoes. Each bite was delicious! Vegetables were steamed to crisp perfection, the goat cheese gave the chicken a nice flavor, mashed potatoes were perfect you don't have to add a thing.
author: Teresa W.

description: My boyfriend and I were going out to lunch and I made the decision for us to go to the bell tower. I had been there a couple of times before and it was great but this experience was very different. My boyfriend and I were seated immediately, but waited 35 minutes just to put in our drink order and 45 minutes to put in our food order. Along with our entrees we ordered nachos as an appetizer. The nachos were the only thing that came out quickly and when we asked for tapatio we never received anything. After an hour after the nachos our food came out and was freezing cold and disgusting. I don't understand how the brunette waitress that has seemed to work there for a while now doesn't comprehended standard manners nor how to run a restaurant. Clearly this place really needs to rethink their priorities and hire some better quality workers
author: Heather J.

description:
Damn good burgers.  Not quite as good as Street, but a close second.  We don't make it to the Bell Tower much anymore, partly because it's up the hill and Street is closer.

We usually get one of two waiters, and both are super nice.
author: katie m.

description:
the bell tower is the perfect place to start a lazy sunny day, you can seat outside and enjoy people watching and a cold beer with a plate of fried calamari........yummy

They have things on the menu that are just ok, but if you try a caesar salad with salmon you won't be disappointed, and check out the daily special
author: Giu G.

description:
Food is average @ best. The staff was incredibly friendly, which is the only reason I am giving them 3 stars. 

Not that difficult to make a medium rare burger.. but apparently most places cook medium well rather than medium rare. Eh.

Good location, friendly staff, average food.
author: Art A.

description: Nice to be able to walk here from a friend's apartment, sit outside, sip a whisky with some friends and enjoy the setting sun on a very pleasant day (2Feb.2009).  Great place to watch passersby.
author: Jennifer S.

description: I go there often and have for many years.  However, I am fed up with the "service dog" scam by clowns claiming any dog is a service animal. You want to eat around dogs?  be my guest.
author: Joe R.

description: Bell Tower feels like being at "Cheers." Always friendly, with a nice buzz. Love their fish tacos and pulled pork. Brunch is great: omelets, burritos, and much more. Today I had a black bean and chorizo burrito that was outstanding. Two different games on the tv's, a lively crowd, nice outdoor tables under some trees, a perfect Saturday at a favorite neighborhood p;ace.
author: Anne G.

description:
I think I'm slowly realizing that I'm not a brunch fan.

Anyway, I came to Bell Tower with a few friends and were seated after waiting a few minutes.

I ordered the French onion soup and chicken andouille hash which was served with an english muffing and two poached eggs.  The French onion soup was pretty standard, cheesy goo and quite tasty broth.  Regarding the has, it really wasn't what I expected but it was tasty.  A bit on the greasy side from the sausage.

It was really loud at the bar, it was about 1p and people were slamming shots (I was secretly jealous).  

Service was quick and the staff was friendly.

I'd recommend this place, however, I'm not dying to go back.
author: Clifton T.

description:
Last year i would have given this place 5 stars - the wait staff was super friendly, the buffalo wings were good, the burgers were great, the mussels were very good.  

It has dropped down though because the last few times i was there, the service has been awful (which is a shame considering how great they were), I was left at outside table for 15 minutes before anyone took order - which we eventually got by going in to the kitchen and ordering there. Waited another 15/20 after we were done eating to get check - 0 check ins as well.  We also went in to the kitchen to pay.  

Next time we went there same thing.  Also the dishes have gotten smaller (much fewer mussels and less broth) and less tasty (though still good).
author: Greg M.

description: When I go to the Bell Tower I am rarely disappointed. I just returned from the Bell Tower. My friend and I ordered the Nachos. They were absolutely delicious and there was plenty for two! My friend enjoyed a nice Margarita with his nachos and I had two glasses of house white. We also had dessert, both selections, outstanding. I chose the banana bread pudding. The service was good and quick. An enjoyable experience over all.
author: Michelle V.

description:
I went to this place to watch the Minnesota Viking game today (Sunday) it was a pretty good place, i sat at the bar and i had great service from kate or katie i am not sure, but she was really nice and helpful and great on refilling your drinks and asking you if she can get anything else for you I had a great experience as well as my fiance and his friend we were really impressed by the food as well! We went during brunch and they had great food! 

Also if you are a MN Viking fan this is the place to go. The owner is from Minnesota and ive heard good things about her. This is also a HUGE purple and yellow chair! So i am pretty sure she is a viking fan too!
author: Karen M.

description:
Went here with 2 of my girls on Sat. morning for a much needed hangover breakfast. One friend and myself got 2 poached eggs, chicken andouille potato hash with tomato creole sauce and an English muffin. I will give it to them that they did not skimp on the portion bc it was huge, but the dish really missed the mark. We were served a huge mess of chicken, andouille sausage, pepper, onions and tomatoes. The dish was not seasoned well unless you like oil as your main season. The eggs were overcooked which I hate, but shame on me for not asking. 

On the other hand my other girl friend got the breakfast burrito and that was super good, I would have given that a 4 star. Although breakfast burritos are yummy I usually never order them because I feel like a tons of bricks after I eat them.

The menu did not have enough exciting other options to get me to try this place again especially when there are so many more places to eat in the city.
author: Sophia D.

description:
I really like their fish and chips here.  I don't like eating sea food unless it's fried and I can't tast it but ocassionally I will crave fish and chips (weird) anywho, I live around this area so I wanted to give this place a try and I was not disappointed!  I recommend coming down for lunch and sitting outside if the weather permits!  Their pulled pork sandwich is really good too!  

I've been here a couple of time and end up ordering the same thing so if there is a dish I have to try let me know!!
author: Maria E.

description:
The atmosphere is nice, it has potential to be a nice place to sit down with friends and have drinks, but the food and service were deplorable. In the interest of full disclosure I should say that I was there with a fairly large group for a friend's birthday party, but I don't think that's any excuse for our poor meal.

Drinks: Fine, decently priced for a restaurant type place, and were served fairly promptly. 

Appetizer: The calamari was far too fried--I'm not sure there was even any squid in there; all I could taste was the breading. 

Salad: Was decent, but then again, who can't toss some spinach and dressing in a bowl?

Dinner: I ordered the fish--Salmon, it was reasonably priced, $17, I think. It was supposed to be served with gnocchi. Instead they brought me salmon in broth with veggie balls. I'm not quite sure what they were going for here, but I WAS NOT impressed--my salmon was overcooked, the vegetables were undercooked, and the broth tasted like something that came out of a soup can.

Desert: Lemon pie was edible and welcome after the bad dinner.

All and all I stopped and got a slice of pizza on the way home--I was that unsatisfied.
author: Lara L.

description:
SO, we went there the night before Thanksgiving (since everything else was closed) and while one of us had the chicken sandwich, the other had the veggie burger. The food was good, however the service was quite slow and we ended up paying for our bill at the bar. There was a drunk guy who fell going up 2 stairs...amazing. The fries were good.

Speaking on behalf of the vegetarians, the veggie burger was decent. 

On the other hand, the chicken sandwich with brie and balsamic onions was on the money.
author: Aryakaz K.

description:
2.5 stars.

This place doesn't suck.  Its not great. Its not really anything at all.  I ordered a beer and the Wedgie salad - which is literally a half a head of lettuce (not cut up, mind you...but still in lettuce head formation) with six pieces of sliced beets and a side of blue cheese.  Oddly enough, it was very satisfying, but I can be a freak like that.  

Eh.
author: Tamar N.

description:
Good service every time we have gone in there.  The burgers are really good but so are the salads and the brunch options.  Prices are good.  The menu is very typical at times but there is something comforting about   that.
We like this place and we've always been happy here.
author: Nilu r.

description:
Greens too crowded? Need some good bar grub? Check out the Bell Tower on Polk Street for some reasonable chow and beer. On a sunny day, this place is packed on the weekends with everyone downing bloody marys but at night this is also a great place to catch a bball game and beer with some good friends. 

The menu serves up plenty of options including appetizers, sandwiches, and burgers but they also have some decent entrees. My friend got the special surf n turf which was actually a good piece of filet mignon. The pulled pork sandwich is full of tender pieces of meat with a delicious sweet bbq sauce. Burger and fries are also a good staple. 

Wine list is actually pretty decent with a few Napa classic favorites. Wines by the glass aren't that sophisticated so maybe stick with beer. If you're looking for a laid-back place to get some good bar food w/o the cheesy Marina bar scene, check out the Bell Tower.
author: Josephine H.

description:
i like this place because it's sorta no-fail with it's basic american fare and decent prices. however they are always extremely short staffed. it always takes a while to get your drink and someone will take your order and then someone else will drop by and take it too. i had friends who were already in weird moods so the fact that we were asked to move tables twice upon arriving to accommodate larger groups put them in even funkier states and it ruined my intentions for a nice relaxing brunch. also, we had planned on sitting in the sun and ended up in a dark corner next to a christmas tree in like, june. still, i was optimistic. 

i've waited tables before so i understood that she was pretty slammed.  they had two people on the tables, and i think the place sits like 50 at least. she was friendly and upbeat despite being in a rush and complimented my watch (which always earns points in my book, the girl clearly knows how to dress). my boyfriend recently got a physical and so this week is obsessed with cholesterol (borrrrringggg) so he huffed and puffed and ordered the french soup when she informed us that they don't have egg whites or fruit. my friend said her fried egg sandwich was bland and the waitress comped it (i thought it tasted fine). my egg scramble was decent, not spectacular. but i didn't expect spectacular, so i was satisfied.

a lot of places are hit and miss, but i am keeping the faith that this is a consistent spot. next time i'll bring different friends.
author: J R.

description:
Absolutely love this place! 

So my boyfriend and I just moved to the neighborhood and said we'd eat at the first place we came across on Polk. Fortunately for us it was the Bell Tower.

The food is absolutely amazing and extremely reasonably priced. No matter what kind of food you're in the mood for, they have it. Our favorite is the Pistachio Crusted Warm Brie cheese salad! 

They have every single type of drink at the bar and the service is great! The portions are huge and I always have left overs as well. Definitely worth trying a couple different times so you can taste everything on the menu!
author: Beth H.

description:
This is a fabulous SF version of Cheers- great bartenders (who learn your name quickly), fun crowd of locals, perfect place to watch sports, etc.  AND the food is actually great.  The breakfast quesadilla & chicken quesadilla are both amazing - could eat the homemade chipotle aioli and pico de gallo with a spoon all by themselves.  French onion soup, pulled pork, chicken sandwich w/ brie, escargot (yes, at a sports bar), mac & cheese, and fries are all delicious.

Unfortunately the service at tables does tend to suck, but eat at the bar (or counter behind the bar) and you don't have to deal with it.
author: Maggie Z.

description: It was an ok place for a meal.  On Sunday there's a small crowd watching some football games on the big screens they have.
author: Aaron W.

description:
Decent but not great and parking in Nob Hill is a total mindfudge. By the time I found an open lot (no thanks to the zero parking signs posted on the street) I was starving. I opted for the more expensive steak over a burger because extra meat = extra good. The steak was slathered with some kind of gravy or sauce that tasted all right. They used so much that it kinda made me think they were covering something up. 

My two dinner companions complained that their burgers were only average and the buns were so crispy as to be almost inedible. Overall, I wouldn't rush back here but it could've been much, much worse.
author: Aaron V.

description:
This is one of those mixed places where can get dressed up for drink for or even just head after work to snack on appetizers and beers.  Great snacking foods and great beers.

Its on top of the hill and surrounded by little shops across the street to make this a really fun joint to be at during any time.  

People are always fun and half the times if you're there during the day you'll catch a few dogs sun bathing outside with a fresh water bowl!
author: Harry H.

description: Try the fried chicken with the mashed potatoes. Or the Mac & Cheese with the jalapenos. OR the burger. You really can't go wrong with your choice. I'm happiest with Rachel as my waitress, but everyone is helpful. A few times I have been there and they are out of the beer I order, but a greyhound is an easy second choice. Also, they prefer to run on 2 credit cards per group.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
OK,

Not the best place in the city.. but wholly sufficient. They also didn't kick us out, despite ridiculous amounts of rowdy coming from my table. The beer selection was OK, nothing super crazy but more than acceptable. It seems to be a common feeling that this place is adequate, and you know what? I think adequacy is far under-rated. It's a good place to crash into and fuel your boozing at 10 or 11 at night. Also a great neighborhood place for Russian Hill. I will go back soon, the only place I know where the staff will watch a man try to dance with his girlfriend -- accidentally send her flying into a planter box, than serve both of them 3 beers while they yell obscenities at their table.

My kinda scene.
author: Tyler W.

description:
A large number of us besieged this place after last Saturday's afternoon event.  Free wine and cheese plates had awoken our inner barbarian and we wanted steak, we wanted steak BAD, but were a little too early. 

To be honest, I just wanted food, but heckling is fun so after a little fuss we settled for no steak. So if you go for the steak, make sure they are serving their dinner menu.

I had a medium rare burger, which came out medium well, so while I still ate it -- I wasn't thrilled.  I also wasn't that into the bun.  It was a hard bun.  Normally hard buns are good. Especially the derriere kind, however, hard hamburger buns are less than satisfactory.

Their Bloody Mary hit the spot though.
author: Adam C.

description:
Decent, consistent, super friendly neighborhood spot.

Their fries are always solid. It's almost never crowded and they have big TVs so it can be perfect for watching a big game if you don't feel like being mauled at Shanghai Kelly's, Greens or Buccaneer. Plus they serve Chimay- major points!

The waitresses are usually super nice. 

The ambiance is ok- anyone else find the paintings creepy yet oddly entertaining?- but that's not really the point.
author: Claire G.

description: I've walked/ drived by this place a million times as it's in my neighborhood. Finally ended up going there for lunch last weekend, and I have to say it was OK. A pretty good neighborhood joint to grab a bite and/or a beer.
author: Yasmine F.

description:
My co-workers and I came here the other day for lunch. Not bad at all for a work week lunch option. We were a party of 8 and they were very accommodating and efficient with the service.

I had the tuna tacos for lunch and they were delicious! Each taco were served open face. A flat crisp corn tortilla on the bottom and topped with fresh guacamole, salsa and seared ahi tuna. The serving came with 3 huge tacos, I barely could finish two. I really enjoyed it. Along with the tacos, I had a glass of pear cider. It was very sweet, light and refreshing.

They also have outdoor seating, so great for a sunny day.
author: Denise L.

description:
BLAH!
I've had a better chicken sandwich at Wendy's than at the Bell Tower. I don't understand why they would add brie to this sandwich just to ruin it with bad caramelized onions and disgusting chicken. I think the fries were from the freezer. 
It's almost unfortunate that the service was good, however I did notice that no one asked me how I enjoyed the food-I'm sure they know better.
author: Justine K.

description:
I live two blocks away, and after about an hour and a half walking all of Russian Hill and the Marina looking for a place to eat, I wound up back at the Bell Tower.  I could have saved myself the walk and gone straight there, but I wouldn't have discovered that it's pretty much the ONLY restaurant in the area that serves dinner past 10pm.  It's a weird  "I didn't think I lived in the suburbs" moment when every place is locked up for the night.... BUT!  I had been the the BT many times and had a great experience when I dined that late night.

The service is hit or miss - we had two servers that were kind of switching off and one was excellent and the other blew... but it was a great meal and relatively inexpensive for a sit down restaurant. 

Every time I come to Bell Tower I have a new appreciation for it - most recently and now at the top of my list of good qualities is that it serves dinner late.  Very nice.
author: Alice H.

description:
If you just want a drink, this place would be fine for that.
