I don't know about you, but moving to California gave me a new appreciation for GOOD FOOD.  I came from a place that was much more about high quantity than good quality, think all you can eat buffets, Denny's IHOP, and the rest. Moving to California and the Bay Area really awakened me to food, and has made going out to eat high entertainment. 

If you re looking for an an exciting food experience, Bell Tower is not for you. 

If you're not expecting anything more than the the microwaved fare you'd get at a chain restaurant, you might find the food at Bell Tower to be more than fine.  I had the chicken sandwich-- very processed and more like my high school cafeteria's chicken than I'd thought possible outside of the public school system.  I didn' t eat more than half the fries... Another red flag to you (I always finish my fries).

Hope this helps.
author: Mark N.

description: The pulled pork nachos and breakfast burritos are my cure after a big night out.  I only wish is that they had bottomless mimosas...then I would be in heaven!
author: Kristian B.

description: Love this place. It's just a great option to have in your back pocket, especially if you live in the neighborhood. Their tuna tacos and the beef salad are fantastic. Again, nothing mind-blowing or exotic, just well-made, upscale bar food. The prices are really reasonable and I've always had great service. Go in often enough, get to know the staff, and you'll find that the service just keeps getting better.
author: Steve B.

description:
For some reason, I did not venture to the Bell Tower for a long time, despite living within 2 blocks of it.   It appeared to have a weird vibe to it, like it was a good place to breakup with someone.    I have since rescinded this idea, as the food is actually very good.  Another reviewer called it very consistent, and I would agree.   I recommend going for the spinach salad, followed up with the cheeseburger.     
I also like the fact that you can sit outside and have a beer on a sunny day.
author: Dan G.

description:
This is a nice lazy Sunday kind of place. Nothing too special, just casual atmosphere and average food. Really cute dog though. This place is better on a sunny day when you can sit and people watch on 
Polk.
author: Cathy T.

description:
This is the second time I've been reading reviews of a bar/restaurant, and completely forgot that the place even served food! I'm guessing that says something about me...

Anyway, the Bell. Oh, how I loved it. I was in there multiple times a week. I guess that makes me one of those "colorful characters" at the bar. One night, I taught the stranger sitting next to me all of the basics of calculus by drawing graphs and diagrams on a piece of scratch paper scrounged from the bartender.

I know I said I forgot they served food, but that's not quite true... I remembered ordering food at the bar, but zoned on the fact there's a whole restaurant attached. The french onion soup is a nice treat when it's 11pm and you worked through dinner, and the lavender creme brulee is always a nice end to a long day.

The stained glass mosaic mirrors in the bathroom were made by one of the bartenders, Kate. I ended up going by her open studio event a couple of years ago and have two of her pieces hanging in my home!
author: Natalia M.

description:
I like this place. Have been here a few times, it is local to my area, and it has a nice feel to it. 

Sat at the bar, happily shared some good food, and a nice salad. 

We had the steak special, which was really nicely seasoned. 

I had a few side cars, which made me feel quite sophisticated.
author: Danielle V.

description:
My buddy and I rushed in here at 10:30pm after scouting for food in a 3 block radius. We were trying to get dinner and be inside Heights (review coming after this one) by 11:30pm.  We walked through the room, found a waiter, and asked if the kitchen was still open for dinner. He seated us, and after we told him our predicament, took our order. At that point, we had a few more minutes to order from the dinner menu (till 11pm, I think), but we chose to order chicken sandwiches from the bar menu.

Food took  a bit of time, but our waiter rushed the order and so we got it in about 20 minutes.  Sandwich looked a bit on the small side, but was actually very filling, and really tasty!

I finished faster than my friend, so I chatted with our waiter. I'd heard him introduce himself to another table:
Me: So, you're Greg?
Waiter: Yes I am!
Me: Well hello Greg. I'm Greg!
Waiter: Really? Greg's a good name, isn't it!

He was really helpful (brought our check right after our food, so we could sign while we ate, and then dash). I'll definitely be going back to The Bell Tower to visit Greg. 

And we didn't check, but there might be a second floor (we saw people coming out of a door that looked like it might lead to stairs)... Something to look forward to for my next adventure!
author: Greg S.

description:
OK - so I have to update my review of the Bell Tower due to the Mimosa Debacle of 2009.

So, my friend and I wanted to go get some mimosas one morning. Another friend (who usually seems to know a lot about drinking in the Russian Hill area), suggested hanging at the Bell Tower. $15 bottles of champagne! Carafes of orange juice! Perfect for a day sitting in the sun outside.

So, gal pal and I are super excited. So, we get to the Bell Tower, sun shining and all, and look at the menu. Where's the $15 bottle of champagne? Apparently, it doesn't exist. OKKKK, I guess our friend was wrong. We can deal. 

So we tell our waitress - we'd like the $30 bottle of champagne (cheapest they have), plus a carafe of OJ. We plan on drinking a lot here. Celebrating the new year and all. Yada yada. She laughs... then disappears. No champagne. No OJ. Nothing.

I think our waitress quit us. A new girl comes out and takes our food order. Our food arrives before our champagne. Where's the champagne we ask? Oh, our champagne cooler broke. I'm chilling the champagne for you in ice. OK, but we're almost done with our brunch.

So finally we get the champagne. Food is taken away. Can we have a carafe of OJ to go with the champagne? The waitress doesn't understand our request. We'd like to make mimosas. Can we order some orange juice to mix in?

A few minutes later... the waitress walks out with OJ in a tiny coffee creamer cup. Not even a big coffee creamer cup. TINY. My friend and I bust up laughing. What the hell kind of mimosas can we make with this?

We downed the bottle of champagne and moved down the street to Rex Cafe. No mimosa debacles there.
author: Ava S.

description:
This is one of the best all around places I've been to in awhile.  All around because it has high quality food for brunch, lunch and dinner, and a decent sized bar if you just want to have a drink with friends.  It also has TVs to catch the latest USC football game or other sporting events to your liking.  Given its chameleon-like nature, I was surprised with the good food, and especially like the sautéed calamari (they also have fried calamari, but I prefer the former).  Their burgers are well prepared and have nicely cooked meat, and the first time I've had a tuna taco was here and the creation worked very well.

Another great thing about the Tower is it has some of the friendliest waiters and bartenders around.  Very unassuming but also attentive, this is another things that is special with this many faceted place.  It is able to accomplish several things:  Good bar vibe, TVs, solid restaurant food and service that stand on their own.  I'm just glad I live in walking distance.
author: Lemar H.

description: Great place to get a drink after work and to watch a ballgame.  Bartenders are friendly and know what's up.
author: Peter R.

description: This a great little place for some good food and drinks. The staff is attentive, and fun. I would say it is great place to meet your friends or make it your very own Cheers!
author: Mark D.

description:
Overall, a great neighborhood spot. Not my absolute favorite restaurant but definitely my favorite "go-to" standby. 

On a nice day, this is an excellent place to watch people on Polk go by and soak up the sun with a beer (or margarita) and rare ahi tacos in hand. (Beware though... table space is limited.)

On a not so nice day, this is a great place for French Onion Soup (which I'm obsessed with.) The extra cheese really does it for me! I pair that with a spinach salad or the pistachio encrusted brie with honey  (yes, more cheese) and I'm happy as a clam. 

The service can sometimes be a little slow and/or unfriendly, but certain servers are awesome!
author: Alexa W.

description:
This belfry sure doesn't ring my bells. 

When does OK start to mean just plain crappy? The answer is simple: when all of the food at The Bell Tower is just OK. There are a lot of other places where you can snack on mediocrity. I've been to this spot twice because I had to yield to the desires of poor souls with misguided taste buds. 

Go if you must but I suggest foregoing your bell tower excursion for other sites.
author: Jessica D.

description:
I never thought of coming here for food but I guess it is a restaurant in some way...

My crazy sister used to live around the block so this was the place we come to have a drink or two and chat about the good old times.  We always sit at the bar near the corner.  Service was always attentive.  Drinks are good for the price.  My sis likes the lemon drop and it's actually pretty good - they even use fresh lemon (I know they should but too many places don't!).  I have had a variety of drinks and beers on tap.  

We had a fantastic time on our last visit.  The bartender, Eric (I think), is so nice and funny.  We also met a couple of regulars...and later the owner even bought us a drink, how cool is that!

Eric, blessed his heart, suggested I try the pear cider w/ fresh OJ - he said it is poor man's versioin of mimosa.  It was very refreshing and tasty.  My sister tried it and wanted one so we started fighting over it because they were running out of oranges (at the bar) and he said he will NOT go downstairs to get another box.  Well, we won - we are the customers after all but it was all in good fun.
author: Gloria H.

description:
I like this place.  Overall good feeling and food.  I've only ever been here for dinner last minute and its usually pretty empty.  They have a regular menu and a bar menu so there are lots of options. Good beer.  

Its usually packed on weekend mornings and the owners bull mastiff is always chillin outside.  (They also have portraits of him in the restaurant too.)  I'll have to come to brunch here soon.
author: Angela S.

description:
You know what really bugs me?  When people give a 2 star rating to a place they went to ONCE and had a bad experience.  I can understand finding a cockroach, freaking out, and posting something about it...but come on, Bell Tower is amazing!!  So your burger was overcooked ONCE, the waitress forgot something ONCE, please - it's called being human.  And not to pick any fights because we are all entitled to our opinions, but let me give this place a real review.

First of all, the staff is amazing.  The kind of people that will talk a little bit of shit to you in good fun (they are good people-readers, so this would only really happen with someone like me who would also talk a little shit and have a couple laughs...if you are the quiet type, I think they would just give you a friendly smile).  

The tables outside (although the chairs wobble a bit) are such a delight on a sunny Sunday morning.  Speaking of Sundays, the Blood Mary's are great!  The brunch menu is affordable - approx. $8 sandos/burgers/salads!  They have a great dinner selection as well.  My all time fav is the Baked Brie with Truffle Honey (anything with Truffles and I am in) and they make a mean rack of ribs.  This is all coming from someone who has been there about 20+ times in the last 2 years and every experience has been one to write about.  One of their Blood Mary's saved me from imminent death once, for example.

Rant done.
author: Carlyna R.

description:
And who knew that this spot had good food?  A- I always assumed this was a Mexican place by the name.  Wrong!!  I was pleasantly surprised when I popped in on Friday night for a late snack.  B- They have escargot, which to be honest was really good.  The baked brie was also yummy.  Possibly a bit to sweet for my taste as there is a sweet gooeyness on it then covered with almonds.

To be honest I was a bit in shock when the yummyness was brought to the table.  Now apparently we were not the only people to think of going to get a late dinner, but a great smile will get you a lot of things in this world, trust you me...

Oh, also and this is a big thing on my list, big bathrooms and not much of a line.  There is a god and now I have one more loo in the city clocked to my list!!
author: Nicole F.

description:
Great place to go to grab a meal and then linger around for drinks afterwards. 

They've got your typical American fare (potato skins, buffalo wings, burgers & fries, pasta, etc...) and some dishes with an Asian highlight. For example I had the ribs that are made with a hoisen bbq sauce. We ordered the fried calamari, collectively, and it came with a Saracha dipping sauce. 

I've been told the Breakfast Burritos are outstanding, but I'll need to go back and check those out.
author: Rana A.

description:
From the reviews, I was expecting a place with shitty customer service and great food, but I was happy to be wrong. I have been here 3 times now, and the food was good to great all times. I had to wait like 15 minutes the last time I went, but it was a Friday night at 7, so its no surprise. The prices are real good, and the food comes out quick. The wings are nicely spicy, the bbq pulled pork sandwich is meh, like it came out of a can, and the grilled chicken sandwich is damn good. The greek pizza is SO heavy, that after one slide, you will be asking for a box.

Nice looking place with a full bar and TV's all over the place. Last time, I saw a kid who was about 5, playing on a blackberry. I just hope to god he was not texting anyone, or else, fuck the economy, the end of the world is here, and the gates are bell tower....great burgers though :D

Update: Due to my crush putting her napkin over her unfinished food a tad bit earlier than she normally does, you get a MEH rating as well. Not like it takes a lot for her to do that, but still...MEH to you
author: Nic K.

description:
Terrible service... I don't expect Michael Mena type service but acknowledging my existence as a customer would be nice.  I've been to the Bell Tower more than a few times and my party has been pretty much ignored each time.  I will be happy if I never go back.  

I can understand that you are busy, I can understand that you have 10 other tables but I can't understand rudeness without justification.  I can't understand completely ignoring my waves and attempts to get your attention... I know you see me b/c you looked me directly in the eyes.  Maybe you should pick up my wife's purse when you knock it over or even a rushed apology would have been OK; do something besides walking away without a sideways glance!  Maybe a smile, some good old fashion courtesy and a thank you would have saved this review but alas none was received.

Food is OK, decent for bar food but overall I'm not a fan.
author: Micah W.

description: Solid neighborhood bar/restaurant. I've been here three times, always at night. This place seems consistently easy and low-key. It's open late and the staff has always been really friendly and attentive. They have pear cider on tap (which I really like!). The food is good (the tuna tacos are great!). My bf said the ribs were some of the best he's had... so those are great too it seems. The portions are large. This place is located in the heart of Polk and is a nice spot to watch the Giants. I want to try this place for brunch since there's a bit of outside seating.
author: Margot G.

description:
2 stars = not going back.  They're not 1 star quality, but definitely not that good for breakfast.  I ordered the eggs benedict and it was sour.  It tasted like there was some sort of vinegar in it or something.  Unless that's what hollandaise is supposed to taste like.  Gross.  It was also too damn loud with mimosa drunken people yelling at the TV about some football match.

Not going back and I wouldn't recommend.  Try Modern Tea if you graduated from college.
author: James F.

description:
Our "home" restaurant.  This place is all about atmosphere, lots of relaxed people having fun and great lighting ambiance in general.  The food is OK, I have only tried a few things - the burger which was good, wings were well flavoured and spicy, but I would skip the fish and chips - not the greatest flavour.

We will definitely be going back - great place.
author: Jesse D.

description:
love this spot. once i came here on a date.

for a small kitchen in a bar...they do a fantastic job...i mean just look at the size of the kitchen!

he had the fish and chips while i had the chicken sandwich with brie. all was well.

fyi--red lipstick and sandwiches are an embarrassing combination. i ate most of the lipstick.

i really like their hot wings.

one time the waiter lied about the salmon being local. for $17.95? don't think so dude.
author: Alex P.

description:
This place is close and always packed so when i finally tried the place out I really was hoping it would be good. But the bell tower really let me down. First of all the waitress we had was awful-she only came to the table to drop off the food and take our orders-no checking up no refilling of drinks. She never spoke to us besides an occasional "yup" or "ok". Then when our food came it was mediocre. My hamburger was dry and over cooked- ive have had much better burgers for half the cost ($10). The calamari and the onion soup was good but nothing special. 

One of the stars is for pretty nice outdoor sitting and the other is for the beer selection and overall atmoshere. If you wanna grab a few beers and sit outside or at the bar then this would be a perfect place, otherwise I wouldnt spend waste my money.
author: justin b.

description:
lil neighborhood spot for some sunday hangover food.

the tables out in the sun were all taken by boys sporting their ray bans.  that was ok since we were more into watching wimbledon on the flat screens.

most diners were crowded by the windows like lil sunflowers. i suppose the tables in the windowless back room are ok at night.

you can never go wrong with huevos rancheros in california.  i like mine with a healthy dose of sour cream and hot sauce.  it was the perfect cure for the extra round of drinks we had the night before.
author: Anh V.

description: Neighborhood bar sliding down hill. I like the staff and atmosphere here. The French Onion Soup is the best in the City. The chicken sandwich with brie is affordable and delicious. Some of the other food used to be good and now seems to be just average. Make the food better. Keep the staple items. Upgrade the menu!
author: Peter N.

description: A great neighborhood go to joint. Friendly bartenders, outdoor seating (until 11pm), good beers on tap, and food that isn't just pub grub. Two friends used to live next door and a couple blocks away, so we ended up here often. Their chicken fried steak is quite yummy and their tuna tostadas are definite must. Also, their prices are really reasonable. Best nights to go are during the week when the Polk Gulch hasn't been invaded by hoards of people roaming the streets. Luckily though, the Bell Tower doesn't look as hip as some of the other bars around, so even on a busy night you'll still probably be able to get a seat.
author: Rebecca D.

description: Bell Tower is a great neighborhood spot. Love Barbie, Eric, Jen and all the others. My only complaint is that the entrees are too expensive for the quality. It's pub food and its only ok pub food so it shouldn't cost so much. I feel robbed whenever I leave except for the drinks. They are stiff and yummy.
author: Katie M.

description:
I love the idea of a neighborhood bar/ pub food place.   As a resident of Russian Hill, Balboa is as close and good as it gets... until I discovered Bell Tower.  First few visits were super, as I sat at the bar.  Great drinks, burgers, nachos, etc.    Top notch service there with a lot of local "color", so to speak.  Branched out to the tables when I was there with my family.  Still pretty ok, but a decided difference in the drink and service quality.  

Fast forward to today.  Forget about it.  I sat adjacent to the bar and there was such a HUGE discrepancy in what I was being served vs. the people at the bar that it was disgraceful.  All the "regulars"...at 2 pm..  were receiving this amazing service vs. me...  Apparently if you want consistent service at the Bell Tower you have to drink at noon and sit at the bar.  As nice as the wait staff is and as fun as the food can be, this only puts this one notch ahead of the local saloons... fine, no judgements here.....but not for my kids.. or me  anymore.  Sitting in the dining room, I felt like the bar gal was making her bar costs on my back, considering the over pouring that was going with the regulars vs. me there with  my sad drink.  
Bummer... I sincerely thought I'd found my local gig.....

This is a bar folks.. and the only thing that keeps it from the classification of dive bar are some of the staff and the tables outside. Sincerely wish it was different, bit I see who they treat the best.   The bar.  Good luck getting a seat.  The ones that are there know how good they have it!!  Just don't expect the same quality at your table.....
author: julie M.

description:
So here's the thing about The Bell Tower. Overall there will be something- some item on the menu, a place to sit, a cool bartender, just some little quirk that will make you want to come back here. And you'll keep coming back here. But you might ask yourself why.

I first came here eons ago with a friend of mine who no longer lives in the neighborhood. She had The Magic Bell Tower Touch meaning it could be a balmy Sunday afternoon on Polk and as soon as she would saunter up to The Bell Tower poof! one of the coveted outdoor tables would open up. I hadn't returned in forever but I recently came for brunch and a girls pow wow. Both times were popping and let me tell you, the acoustics inside can be pretty bad depending on where you sit. You might find yourself shouting "what?" more than once during your meal. 

The food is the primary draw. I like many folks am partial to the french onion soup. Seriously, french onion soup is right up there with clam chowder and pho for combating the chilly inner cold a strong misty fog can bring on and they do a killer job with their thick warm gooey crust and fat soup soaked chunks of bread sopping throughout the broth. The pulled pork sandwich is quite tasty and I found it to be a few steps better than the chicken with brie sandwich my friend got. Ditto for the option of spring mix as opposed to fries. The mac and cheese with truffle oil was ten shades of rich, heavy cheese goodness. Yes, the accompanying spring mix eased a bit of my guilt (because let's face it when you choose mac and cheese with truffle oil you're not exactly all up for health conscious decisions no?) but the mac and cheese was so heavy and filling I only got through half. My friends went for equally delicious choices of potato skins and chicken with mashed potatoes and broccoli. Sadly, the friend who didn't throw caution to the wind and ordered a caesar salad was seriously disappointed. I couldn't blame her. The salad itself looked a little sad and uber white iceburgy (if you can understand that). Both occasions called for some drinks and I enjoyed both the white wine I shared with the ladies and the bloody mary that accompanied my brunchy sandwich.  

My only complaint is that service is a little hit or miss. The waiter we had for ladies night of planning was nice, accommodating and attentive in our wine selection. The waitress on brunch day was not as great until she cheered up mid meal. It was also distressing to arrive a half hour before brunch ended (according to the signs) and told that in order to have brunch we would have to "try and find a seat" in the overflowing bar by the host. A little irksome but not detrimental to a decent experience. Lively atmosphere.

P.S. In the bathrooms, the hand dryer is next to the sink and the paper towels are right behind you. A little extra something you might want to know especially if hand dryers bug you.
author: Veronica G.

description:
After receiving a hearty recommendation from a friend, I went with another friend from out of town to The Bell Tower on a Wednesday night.  We chose to sit at the bar, although there were plenty of open tables around 11pm.  Barbara, the owner and bartender, served us up right.  She was hilarious to watch as she vivaciously interacted with all those seated around us.  I would go back just to chat with Barb.

In terms of food and drink, Barb makes a mean Lemon Drop Martini without added sugar.  We were still hungry from a light dinner earlier, so we ordered a Greek Pizza and an Apple Cobbler for dessert.  Both were filling, although nothing breathtaking and new.

Overall, The Bell Tower is a great neighborhood bar and restaurant, serving up comforts one expects from such an establishment.
author: Andrew F.

description:
the fud here is like iht or miss

get either the burger or pizzas, or steak
also potatoe skins are solid

one time i went here with kas and her dad and  ihad mb hella bad, so like we were walking back together and i was in panci mode

so like while we were walkin by big foot i saw my friends so we had to stop and talk to to them and introduce kassies dad and stuff

by the time we split up, i lived on sac, she lived on pine,  iran up sacto cause i thought i was gonna mb my pants
author: Cristopher K.

description:
I want to give Bell Tower 4+ stars, I really do... but they just can't seem to make it out of the fat part of the bell curve (ironic pun intended- their name is also a graphical representation of their mediocrity)

Why I want to give Bell Tower 4+ stars: The location and vibe is awesome (I live close enough to throw a rock and hit BT from my apt). Outdoor seating is at a premium on Polk St, and Bell Tower has the benefit of southern exposure with floor to ceiling windows. They even keep dogfish head 90 minute IPA on tap!

Why I can't: The food, it just isn't good

Overall, come here for a few beers with some friends and bask in the sun before heading someone else with better food. Can't beat the location
author: VL K.

description:
This place is a nice unique restaurant for the neighborhood.  Somewhere low key where you can have a beer and burger.  Nothing wrong with it. 

It doesn't pretend to be a gourmet place, and isn't.  It's a place for a halfway decent meal...cheap.  Try the lamb chops, 3 chops and a salad for $12.  You're not going to find that sort of thing elsewhere in the city.

I've always had reasonable service here, and I stick to beer, so the drinks don't bother me.  Give this place a try.
author: Chris C.

description:
Great space to eat and drink a couple of beers at with friends.  The outdoor seating is probably the main attraction at this place (and also doubles as a doggie lounge...lots of them hovering around...one lab literally stared me in the eye through the window while I ate/drank) although the indoor area is comfortable.  There's a fairly large beer selection of the usual suspects.  

It's hit or miss with the food.   Hits: the ahi tuna tacos and ribs.  Misses: Shrimp cakes were average.

If you're looking for a casual place for food and drinks on Polk (but not something completely divey), check it out.  The near floor-to-ceiling windows are beautiful on a sunny day.
author: Jenny K.

description: Just had dinner at the Bell!  What a great neighborhood pub.....Barbie Tice, the owner, is fabulous.  The food is delicious and very reasonably priced.  Everyone working at the Bell makes you feel at home....friendly, professional, competent, and enjoyable.  Warm environment, great activity and a fun place to celebrate a birthday, promotion, or even an engagement!  LJB
author: Lori B.

description: delish meal! We come here for dinner before a concert. The food was great and friendly service. The pulled pork sandwich lived up to the many positive reviews on yelp.
author: Sarah  P.

description: I went to the Bell Tower with a couple of friends on Sunday for brunch. The host told us there would be a 20 minute wait. We sat down at the bar and I ordered a coffee that was light brown and tasted like hot water with an almost coffee aftertaste. My friend ordered a green tea and it came in a pot that smelled very strongly of alcohol. when we leaned closer we noticed that a small glass cup that was acting as a lid to the teapot had half a shot of alcohol in it... After an hour we were seated and each ordered the breakfast burrito. It was nothing special and came with a side of very bruised bananas. Needless-to-say, I was not impressed with this place.
author: Alex O.

description: FInally went...sigh, not the experiance I was expecting at all. Sure the game was on and there were other Vikings fans there, but the food was ok at best and a bit on the high end for a ok burrito.
author: Ka C.

description: This is the kind of place to go with no reservations on a saturday night and you'll be likely to get seated.  Nothing fancy but the food was actually okay.  Ordered a spaghetti dish along with crispy tuna tacos and I was pretty pleased.  Cheap too but don't expect stellar service..they serve drinks and that's what they do best.  Think pub food with flair and a short walk to the neighborhood bars afterwards...
author: Darren B.

description:
Scouting for a place to watch some finals action, spotted a game on and decided to head in and sit at the bar

Two screens on mute playing diff. sports

Service was fine, no pressure
Had one of the specials, everything tasted good (tm)
Menu had variety and neighbors dinners looked good too!

Based on the staff working at the time, had an almost homey feel to it - read:  real
author: mof m.

description: The bbq pulled pork was tasty, and the fries were not bad. The bloody mary's were tasty enough that I ordered two, and the service was just fine. As per the usual, I was with a very large group of drunk and hungry Yelpers, so we may have annoyed the crap out of the waiter, but he was patient with us. We tried to be charming, but he was immune to our charm, and never was able to relax and joke around. Because I had been drinking, I never quite figured out what the deal was with the dressing on the iceberg wedge. It was a little bland, and they are stingy with the spiced almonds. Other than that, the portions are pretty big, and I was satisfied with my meal. I will have to try this place again.
author: Merrilee T.

description: They have a huge screen tv great to watch matches, games. Outside patio is great when its sunny. Food is decent, some dishes are great some i had are mediocare.
author: Ekin G.

description: This place could be a 3 I go back and forth. I had a 2 experience here for brunch, really sub-par food. But I have been here for lunch several times (sf lacks outdoor seating and there are a few tables outdoors here) and it's been ok, not inventive or fresh mind you, but ok. It is a decent place to come on a weekend night for a drink if you don't want to be shoulder to shoulder with douche-bags..
author: jen w.

description: You can never go wrong with the Bell Tower! Love the spot and nice for group settings with friends!
author: David J.

description: Great place for drinks and appetizers.  The brie and nachos were both fantastic. I also really enjoyed the Hell or High Watermelon Beer and Bloody Marys.
author: Emily M.

description:
This place is best of the best in a real neighborhood bar and restaurant.  Makes no different if it is your first time or you have been their 100 times, you're treated like the important customer that you are.  
There are great specials and prices to make you smile when you get the bill.
Always say "hi" to Barb behind the bar.
Alan Sussman
author: Alan S.

description: While I went for the BBQ pork sandwich, my wife wasn't ready to fall off the vegan wagon ... so she requested the spinach salad, minus cheese & bacon, and added steamed veggies. It turned out really well - a nice, cozy dinner for both of us!
author: Eric W.

description:
This is the third time I have eaten at Bell Tower. 

The first time, maybe 10 months ago, I got the Veggie burger (with all fixings) and my boyfriend got the Fish & Chips. We were both incredibly satisfied with the food. I am a bit hesitant when ordering veggie burgers because they are usually just a Garden/Boca burger with some extra stuff, and usually not worth the $9. But this was really good. I would order it again. The fries were perfectly, well, fried--not too greasy and I ate all of them. 

The second time I went, I shared a pizza and a salad with the bf. We both were excited to go again because of how yummy our first trip was. I actually preferred the salad over the pizza...

And today, the third time: I got the Atlas omelet and he got the Blue Omelet. His looked great--blue cheese, bacon, avo, tomato...And the egg was completely cooked. Mine however, was not. I am NOT a fan of runny eggs, soggy or undercooked eggs in any way. I really only eat omelets and scrambles. I was truly disappointed to be served an omelet that fell apart on its own: it was runny and very bland. I added a lot of salt & pepper and hot sauce...but still, I ended up leaving about half the egg. On the plus side, it was stuffed with a LOT of spinach & mushrooms, and really, just small amount of feta (which I prefer to avoid overly greasy food). Surprisingly the feta couldn't add enough salt or savory flavor to save the egg. The potatoes served with it were soggy and a bit cold. And that is definitely a sad thing: home fries should be crisp and a little spicy and flavorful...these were not.

I would go back, but I would not order breakfast foods. I like the ambiance although today was a bit loud (it's football Sunday, afterall). The outdoor seating is always taken but next time I'll wait for it...and stick to the sandwiches...The service was pretty slow today, and even though it cleared out by the time we finished we had to beg for the check after twenty minutes. It's definitely a bar with a limited food menu, but I like its location and to sit and eat a bit.
author: Sarah H.

description:
pork tenderloin (cooked medium)
wasabi mashed potatoes
mango salsa on top
yummy sauce
green beans

Heaven on a dish...no joke.

Cute Atmosphere, fancy casual dinner.  No pretension going on here =)

Will come back, just for that dish.
author: Gladys D.

description: Solid brunch spot without the scene or long line. We ordered a variety of breakfast and lunch dishes- huge portions and perfect ways to sop up hangovers (especially with some yummy greyhounds and bloodies on the side). Outside seating is nice place to people watch as well. Skip the horrendous Toast with it's long lines, this is much better.
author: Rena Z.

description: Been here quite a few times purely because of convenience (I live right down the street).  The food is decent, though what kills me everytime can be summed up in two words: HORRIBLE SERVICE
author: Gohar J.

description: We actually went to The Bell Tower as an alternative to Brenda's because well, Brenda's closes early and always has a super long line. But I was really happy with the selection of dishes on the menu and my Bell Tower Omelets with peppers, onions, bacon & brie, English muffin & home fries was awesome. The servers also knew their stuff and were really friendly. Maybe I went on a day when everyone's all decked out in their summer gear, but I found the place filled with poserish people. Still, I would go back again just for the food.
author: Trish C.

description: I love bell tower!  the food is really good (salmon was yummy) and the ambiance is great too.  However this is not as "hip" as other restaurants on POlk but that is one of the reasons why I love it.  The service is always great too!
author: Tiffany G.

description: The food is still hit and miss but the bar at the Bell Tower is a decent spot to watch a football game. Love the HD TV but I wish they had the sound turned up. I'd much rather pay $5.75 for a Chimay here than $4 for a Bud Light at most other sports bars around town!
author: phil h.

description: This is a good neighborjoint joint. The food is pretty decent -- most recently I tried the pulled pork sandwich and the meatloaf. It's not a destination spot but a good place to head to with a few friends for any meal of the day. The service is very friendly and responsive.
author: m t.

description: I've always dug this place; nestled just inside the imaginary line separating chic Polk from sketch. Decent bar, good salads, and lots of dogs patiently waiting for their owners to finish already. Random sidenote: the 1920s-looking floor tiles are the exact same color and design pattern as the bathroom floor of my former Snob Hill apartment. That probably explains why I always start removing my clothes in order to shower when I come here -- or maybe that stems from the decent bar I already mentioned.
author: Gregor G.

description: This great neighborhood bar is always solid. Full dinner menu evenings, with a nice bar menu after hours, until midnight. Great atmosphere, especially compared to other options. Service is (usually) very nice , and the drinks are always strong. Menu highlights include: Caesar salad, homemade pizzas, burgers, and shredded pork sandwich (all from the late night menu, my usual consumption hours).
author: Michael C.

description: Now granted I've only been here once, but my friend and I felt that our breakfast left much to be desired.  She had the eggs benedict, which we both agreed was suffering from a serious lack in flavor.  My breakfast burrito was good, but nothing to write home about.  We are both pretty certain that our "Bloody Mary's" were composed only of vodka and tomato juice, with none of the other standard flavors or trimmings.  Our server was nice, but we didn't see much of her.  When we did ask for hot sauce and extra napkins, she forgot entirely, and we decided to just go inside and help ourselves.  One big plus: the outside seating is charming and perfect for people watching on a nice day.  I wouldn't say "try this if you dare", but I wouldn't recommend it to someone looking for a decent meal when there are so many other great spots in the area.
author: Whitney H.

description: It's always better when Barbie is behind the bar, but it is always pretty good.  A wonderful neighborhood spot.  I have never been without making a new, slightly weird, friend.  Outdoor seating available.
author: Amme P.

description: Not-so-great food, and not-so-great drinks.  My friend and I both ordered egg dishes for brunch.  They came with a hollandaise sauce that can only be described as way, way vinegary.  The drinks?  My friend playfully ordered champagne and received a white wine glass full of liquid that had to be stirred in order to get any bubbles going.  Might be good if you're going to watch the game, but don't go for brunch!
author: maisnon ..

description: Great calamari, although it took them 30 minutes to give it to us. They comped us so it's all good. Fat ass quesadilla was flavorful and delish. Spinach salad crawling with bacon. Great late night eats
author: Sophia C.

description: Great location (for me)---Went for breakfast, and it was great, but when I tried to order the omlete with egg whites only, they said "we don't do that" which was pretty aggravating. And they didn't come over to greet our table for about 10 minutes...and they weren't that slammed.
author: Rita M.

description: Site of the historic *second* date between the BF and me, the limpid fare and disaffected service failed to cast a pall on the relationship. Perhaps all second dates should be in a lousy restaurant.  3.5 years later, one barely recalls it.  I might go here again if there was a really bad hail storm and I was n crutches and my car wouldn't start, but that's about it.  Come to think of it the *first* date place, Zodiac, was worse.  It was so dark in there we weren't sure what each forkful of food would yield.  I think it must have been named after the Zodiac killer. I got that rec offa CitySearch.  Tragic. It's gone away, but they should get a bronze plaque out front marking the site, right?
author: Kevin S.

description:
It's hard for me when it comes to this place.  I've been four times now, and had a horrible first experience, a fine one the second time (just had drinks), a great time the third visit, and a horrible fourth...so that is why there are only two stars...I would go so far as three, but it may be a bit too generous.

The first time I went I had a Cesar salad, and a beer.  The beer was great, hard to go wrong.  The salad was luke warm and swimming in salad dressing...big negative for me.

The second time, just got some gin and tonics and enjoyed the sun on a Sunday afternoon outside with friends, pretty stellar.

The third time was awesome, my friend and I got bar seats, ordered and were served fairly quickly (the place was jam-packed).  The french onion soup was excellent, the baby spinach salad was great (not hot, and I asked for my dressing on the side, just to make sure), and the wine was passable (who am I to say?).

The fourth time though, eh, I was not impressed at all.  The waitresses confused the hell out of us while we waited with a few other parties before us (we were seated first, randomly, at a large table...there were only three of us and people in larger parties that came in before were not seated...it just didn't make sense).  So after that, it took forever to take our order, then the server brought us bloody marys that just didn't taste good to me at all (I love bloody marys, too), and then forgot to bring us water.  When the sun was shining right in my eye, I asked if the waitress could lower the sun shade on the window...she said that I could if I wanted to...and when I looked at her like, "Uh, I don't really know how to, and you work here, not me..." she reluctantly went over and did it.  I just feel like if a customer asks you politely to do something easy that you wouldn't tell them to do it themselves...

I would go back here, but probably only for their soup, and beer.  And even then it's questionable.  I don't like it when wait staff is rude, and unprofessional.
author: Kristin E.

description: It's not fantastic food or drinks but it's a cozy local hang out.
author: S A.

description: This place suited our late afternoon needs just fine.  Having come from wine tasting and wanting to continue with the drinking while ordering some food they were able to do both while accomodating our larger group.  Sure they were out of Anchor Steam and Hefeweizen on tap, but nothing that the Pilsner couldn't make up for.  Everyone ordered an array of things from the menu, sandwiches, burgers, pizzas, and wedge salad all got good reviews...not raves, but good for the price and for the laid back atmosphere we wanted on a sunny, lazy afternoon.
author: Jessica S.

description: My favorite neighborhood bar in SF.  Really has a great diversity of patrons, folks from down the hill, up the hill and some just passing through. Not eveyone is in their twenties, which is unsual for the area.  Always an interesting conversation - no pretenses here. Barb and crew do a great job running the place.  Drinks are great and food is better than typical bar food.
author: Glenn S.

description: Another one of my favorite brunch spots on Polk (seriously, how many spots does this street have?), I've always enjoyed my meals at The Bell Tower. Nothing jumps out in mind except for the big omelettes and the bloody marys, but then again, how can you go wrong with that combo?  I also went once for a late night dinner, and would classify the menu as pub-grub meets comfort food. Good choice if you're looking for something low-key and casual and don't feel like breaking the bank.
author: Chris B.

description: Service is iffy, but man, it's quiet on the weekends, and I can like, talk to my friends and drink at the same time without the overly scratched throat?  The burger is OK, but the French Onion soup is great.  Kitchen stays open till 12 am, but the dinner fare stops at 10, and that menu is not only pricier, but yummier.  And, I love that I can come here for a drink without being slapped in the face with heavy perfume.
author: Tangerine L.

description: I came here yesterday afternoon with my friend. I love the tables they have set up outside; perfect for enjoying a beer or cocktail in the afternoon sunshine. I didn't try the food, but it looked and smelled really good. The drinks were well-priced (I'm used to paying upwards of $5 for a beer and $7 for drink). The service was good and the clientele seemed really happy. Definitely a place to remember.
author: Veronica W.

description: My friend lives next door to this joint, and every day, at a certain time, the smell of calamari wafts in to her apartment.  Since I crash on her couch when I visit, I'm now trained to salivate at even the thought of that damned delicious calamari.  Thank GOD it tastes as good as it smells!  Yeah, I think it's time to book a flight.....
author: Skye R.

description:
One of my favorite neighbor spots.  Food is always great.  The Quesadilla is big and GOOD and you don't need to add chicken.

I get their specials a lot because otherwise I'd keep eating the quesadilla.  Meatloaf and beef stew are excellent.  The entire menu is great, but you can't go wrong sharing a bunch of apps, and mac and cheese.

Staff is friendly and attentive.  Drinks are strong and reasonably priced.
author: Sara L.

description:
My go to place at least once or twice a week.  It's crowded most nights with a good mix of people.

Friendly and efficient wait staff.  Consistently solid food.  My wife and I have our favorites (Me: Sauteed Calamari Appetizer, Wife: Quesadilla or Tuna Tacos) but we've ordered almost everything else on the menu and left happy.  Prices are really reasonable too.
author: Mike C.

description: I'll give it up for the Bell Tower.  It's the only place close to my house where I can get a burger and wings with some lager in a pub like setting.  What is it with San Francisco and bars not serving pub food?  Pub food is a staple of the east coast (NYC, Boston, Providence) diet and although I admit to being a foodie, sometimes you just get a craving for some comfort food and the Bell Tower seems to be the only place that offers it.  Yes, the service is abhorrent and slow but you have to give it up for the Bell tower because it is just what this neighbourhood needs, a place for cheap eats and cold beer reminiscent of an east coast pub.
author: George K.

description: I live near this eatery and have passed it many times. It's usually busy so I've been pretty interested in stopping by. I went there with my girlfriend the other day and I was very unimpressed with the place. The service was alright. The first lady that served us was polite, but the second woman barely said a word. She seemed uninvolved and looked like she didn't want to be there or cared. The food coming out of the kitchen looked good so we were excited to get our meal. I got the chicken sandwich and fries while the lady friend got the macaroni and cheese. My sandwich tasted like fish, so I'm assuming the grill is rarely cleaned and tasted pretty terrible. The fries we're tasty, but it's really hard to fuck up fries. They were a little undercooked and I had to pick and choose which ones were crispy. My g/f mac and cheese was tasteless and was soupy, which should never be the case with this type of food. We played a game of adding condiments to the bland dish to see if the additions made it taste any better. It didn't really add much to it. I thought that my first visit to my neighborhood bar and eatery would have been a great experience, but wasn't. It was just tasteless and lazy. The restaurant probably has a nice beer selection and a nice area outside to drink and talk with your friends. Besides that there's nothing to offer for good quality food. I should try getting drunk there and then eating, it might make a difference.
author: Ryan C.

description: YUMMY! This was our first stop to eat in San Fran and our last as well. The food is good. I love the atmosphere too. It seems like a great place to go for brunch if you're in the neighborhood. If I lived in Nob Hill, this would be a usual spot for me.
author: magda j.

description: I've eaten at the Bell Tower a few times and this last time confirmed what I've always thought.....the service is decent the ambiance is fabulous and the food is delicious, although a little pricey!  I ordered my favorite chicken sandwich with brie cheese, balsalmic onions and spinach...one of many yummy choices.  Their wedge salad is great and the french fries are perfect!  They have a full bar and a pretty good wine selection.  This is a great neighborhood restaurant
author: Gabrielle C.

description: This place is consistently consistent. Food is good, especially the starters, it serves late, and there is some outdoor seating. In the dining room, service is iffy and you may end up waiting a really long time for your meal (especially during brunch). I recommend sitting at the bar - the bartenders are all really nice and the service there is great. The Bell Tower is also perfect for dog watching -- there is always at least one or two dogs tied up outside the restaurant.
author: Rebecca H.

description: It's a pub-feeling type of place that also serves food.  I came here for dinner last night with some friends that live close by.  Definitely not a place I would venture to, but if I'm close to it I'd go again.  Our server was decent, nothing spectacular.  Same goes for the food.  Ribs with coleslaw and fries was my order.  Ribs were piping hot (too hot to hold) while the fries were barely warm, and the coleslaw was watery.  Some of my friends' plates had obviously been sitting under the warmer for a while.  One of my friends ordered a soda, which was completely flat.  He complained and they gave him another - same story, still flat.  Okay pub food, next time I'll probably stick to the beer.
author: Lindsay B.

description: I'm totally down with their chorizo breakfast/brunch plates. Their Bloody Mary is OK, but could be spicier and zestier.
author: Cheri R.

description: Casual, sunny, and some nice front patio seating for drinks during good weather.  Our friendly waiter had a stunning memory, taking drinks and food orders for my group of 10 by memory.  Our drinks were kept refreshed at all times, and the food is well priced, so despite the fact that it doesnt knock your socks off, its a trade off for being a good deal.  Definitely has a "neigborhood" vibe, and I know if I lived nearby, you'd find me there.  Not a sports bar per-se, but they've got 3 excellent and well placed TVs playing the main games of the day.  Not too shabby!
author: Cathleya G.

description: Great place to sit outside and drink and eat (if you can snag one of the three tables). The drinks are good and the food is decent (fried calamari, bbq pork sandwich, baked brie, etc). For some reason people kept buying us drinks, so I had that going for me...
author: Nicolas H.

description: The most mediocre breakfast ever. Did not talk to a single server, instead was helped by the host who failed to fulfill the server role she tried to take on. We asked for bread, and she told us she'll bring some out with butter.... it never came. She was also hesitant about giving us change, I guess she expected that we were going to give her more than what she expected for a tip. We had to ask her twice for change.
author: ZacKandMeL M.

description: The food here is always consistent and good.  Not a gourmet place, but definitely not your greasy spoon/pub food either.  The soups are always good and they do their meats really well - as in good, not how done it is.  The staff is very friendly.  This is one of the few places in the city where I will have catfish (because I know that it it is fresh and not frozen).
author: Steve Y.

description: I went Saturday night and was so delighted to find that I was treated like royalty.  The steak and potatoes were great, the drink just perfect, the price was nice, and the service had extra sparkle and very prompt.  I had a great meal in me, and I also felt uplifted by the cheerful waitress who was almost flirting with me.  Although a little outside my normal range of habitat, I may just migrate there again before long.  Certainly if you are in the Russian Hill area this place with take care of your dining/drinking needs with elegant simplicity and the right price.  Big windows make for a nice commanding view of this nicer part of Polk St from where ever you sit.
author: John L.

description:
I have read and heard a few mixed reviews about The Bell Tower but I have had a fantastic time every single time I have ever been here.  While not every staff member is the sweetest, the quality ones here make it worth my time and also encourage a smile.  I have seen more than one great bartender making all the customers feel welcome and happy.  And it doesn't hurt that they pour a good drink -- as a girl who enjoys sidecars even though I'm not yet an old lady, I appreciate a real good drink.
I crave the potato skins with bacon and sour cream, the best as an appetizer, with a beer on a lazy day, or with a good bloody mary at the bar.  I believe I have only had the steak for dinner but just because I love it so much every time - the butter and cream spinach are awesome.   
Great atmosphere too -- this is one of my favorite places to meet up for dinner with girlfriends and have a few glasses a wine, enjoy a good meal, and really get down to gossip. I will definitely return again and again.
author: Lauren P.

description: When I was first apt hunting in the city years ago, and seeing the crummiest of the crummy apts in all corners of the city, I distinctly remember turning the corner off of Polk Street and seeing people relaxing and drinking wine in the afternoon and thought  "I wanna live RIGHT HERE".....  And while I didn't move exactly to the Bell Tower, per se, I did end up within walking distance a few blocks away.   Despite the fact that the 2:00 chard doesn't fit into my Saturday nearly as often as it should, the Bell Tower does have an awesome brunch that will put any hangover to the test..
author: Heather C.

description: I walked by this place countless times during our stint in the city and wondered why we didn't go there more often, but in a neighborhood so packed with awesome dining it's tough to play favorites.  We had a great afternoon/ evening here during football season when we wanted to watch a playoff game without dealing with the crazy zoo we knew any "official sports bar" would be.  We enjoyed the cool vibe, attentive service, and awesome people watching, since we lucked out to have some motley crew of people downing shots and engaging in some sort of football rivalry.  We split a veggie burger that I recall being solidly above average, and I tried (and failed!) to convince the boy that we should also order a veggie pizza after seeing the giant and tasty looking pie that landed on a table near us.
author: Leslie R.

description: Damn, that salt 'n' pepper calamari with the thai chili sauce is scrumptious. The lady bartender is quite a gem too.
author: Susanna D.

description: The food is quite good, though on the pricey end of bar food. The lamb chops are fantastic, but I guarantee you'll want more than they give you. Great burger. Good beer selection, and well poured.
author: Don H.

description: I went there on the 25th eve, as the streets were empty. I now know where all the people were: at the Bell Tower. I found there an interesting mix of people, and the fish and chips (actually fries) was a must. Prices are quite reasonable, and last but not least the service was great. Marie, you are an angel!
author: Remi V.

description: Used to be a neighborhood spot til I moved out of the area.  Good drinks and tasty quality comfort food.  Great on a slow night or off hours...I don't wait for tables unless I'm at Gary Dankos.  I've had some amazing rib eye steaks here too but they vary pretty wildly.  One night amazing, next time barely above average.  Seems like they might be buying their meats from different vendors or something.  Brunch is nothing special but seeing how bad breakfast/brunch is in this city it starts to sound better. ..I did a solo thanksgiving here  too one year and it was great.  Forget parking...
author: Spidermonkey J.

description:
Great neighborhood spot.  

Good menu for lunch, dinner and brunch on the weekends.  Killer breakfast burrito!!!
Fun bartenders, great table service, and a chocolate soufflé to die for with a caramel sauce and ice cream :)  

If you read my reviews, I obviously have a sweet tooth.... But the "real" food is great too!

They have a couple outside tables which are nice when its sunny, I always hope to get there on saturday and snag one, 
breakfast burrito + mimosas + sunshine = happy me :)
author: Jaylene S.

description: This is a charming little neighboorhood spot.  Had an incredible duck special there one night....good food and the service can't be beat.  A fine meal in a friendly restaurant.   Definitely reccomended!
author: Pete D.

description: While I had an incredible meal of fried, pistachio-crusted brie avec side salad and little crusty toasts (OMG!), my companion's meal was severely lacking.  He'd ordered the pulled pork sandwich - in fact, he was pulled (pardon the pun) to this place because of the pulled pork sandwich!  Sadly, it was a miniscule mess of pork strings squished onto a hamburger bun with a skimpy side of fries.  If I'm in the neighborhood, I might be tempted to return, but with as much good food as there is nearby, I don't really forsee it happening.
author: Frankie D.

description: Fantastic onion soup, and an old dog sprawled out on the sidewalk.  Go in the afternoon, when the sun hits Jackson & Polk at just the right angle to bathe the outside tables in its glow.
author: Shannon V.

description:
If you keep kosher, it's time to take a good look at yourself and reconsider your priorities. You are missing out on the most amazing sandwich in this city - the pulled pork sandwich at the Bell Tower is just about the best food ever. It's smothered with cole slaw and comes with fries, but you can substitute with salad for no extra charge. I've tried the tacos and other items too which are always good, but nothing gets me going like the pulled pork sandwich.

On a sunny day, bring your dog, sit outside and enjoy the people watching. The servers are totally attentive, couldn't be nicer and they have both a regular and bar menu to give you lots of choices with various price points.
author: Cher E.

description: Bell is the closest joint to my place.  Which means by default it gets my hard earned bills every once in a while.  It's busy quite a bit but I'm guessing there must be a regular crowd.  Bartender seemed to know everybody by name.  The food is ok, beer is beer, and they have a couple of t.v.s to watch some sports.  I got no gripes about the place.  It's an average joint in an awesome area.  I've had the pizza, bbq sandwich, and a chicken sandwich; all of which have taken care of my hunger pains without any adverse effects.
author: John B.

description: I cringe when someone suggests the Bell Tower.  This cringe is due to a lack of an extra 3 hours in my day that is necessary when going to this establishment.  My roommate started eating her napkin; that happened.  After the long awaited food arrives at your table you realize that once again the food here is not really good.  Nicks anyone?
author: Molly K.

description: Hot, fresh, tasty food appropriate for when you want something other than pizza after 10pm on Polk St.!  Sandwiches, salads, and they do have nice pizza's here too, and the full bar and real white linens makes Bell Tower definitely preferable to late night fast food.
author: P H I L H.

description: This place has some pretty good food.  I go here more as a restaurant than a bar though.  I've been for both dinner and breakfast since it's right down the street from my apartment.   I love the breakfast/brunch food here.  HUGE portions.  I usually get some sort of egg with meat and potatoes kind of dish.  Great food for a reasonable price.  For dinner they have a large selection of foods.  I've had the burger which is pretty good.  I've had the pulled pork sandwich which was just ok.  Some of their appetizers are great like the quesadillas.  I highly recommend those.  Wine prices per glass and bottle aren't bad either.  Overall, a chill place to grab a bite with friends.  They could use some new menus that aren't paper, and sometimes there are flies flying around.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: As everyone else has already said, the Bell Tower is basically a casual neighborhood standby.  I think what makes it stand out is that it's consistently above average in all respects.  The owner is really nice and a great bartendress, the food is pretty good (especially the stuffed chicken, total comfort food), it's inexpensive, and the atmosphere is pleasant.  It's so great at being what it is that I actually would've given it 5 stars, except that it's always so cold in there!  I know I'm a girl and therefore prone to overreacting about the thermostat, but I'm pretty sure I've never taken my jacket off in this place.  If the heat gets turned up I will come back and amend this review.
author: Anna S.

description: I love the Caesar Salad here. It's so good, I could eat two of them. The pastas are always good and the drinks sublime. If you're looking for good ol' american comfort food, go the The Bell Tower.
author: Shirley L.

description: I had lunch at Bell Tower and the bloody mary was one of the best I've had in a long time. It was thick and spicy, almost like a bloody ceasar. Just the way I like 'em. I had the corn beef hash and poached egg. The flavors were right on, but there were too many chewy parts in the corn beef hash that ruined it for me.
author: melissa g.

description: I loved this place. I went there last night for the first time, for a quick, simply dinner and it was better than i was hoping for! The portabella wellington is great, very very tasty. Definitely recommend it.
author: Tali L.

description: This is a love-hate relationship. I love that Bell Tower is always there, close, open, and a variety of food to please many different cravings. They have a full bar, yes, all the hard stuff. Okay, the hate of this relationship is the few, not all, waitresses that barely acknowledge you are sitting in a restaurant (in their section). They ignore you for a while.. then thrown some food in front of you and run off.. the place doesn't even have many hiding places, but they still manage to be very elusive. Okay, the love again, I love those Hoisan Baby Back Ribs.. However, my last visit to BT the ribs were smaller in the portion they served and not super tender like all past visits.
author: Tracy C.

description: I was in the Bay area for a few weeks for business. I am from Minneapolis so naturally I am a serious Vikings Fan. The first game of the season was on against the Saints and I was looking for a viking friendly bar to enjoy the game. I searched online and Bell Tower was mentioned as Vikings Friendly. I arrived 2 Hours early and immediately was welcomed by one of the servers as she was also from MN and a Vikings Fan. As I enjoyed my Steam Anchor and local company I found out that the owner of the Restaurant/Bar is originally from MN and that many MN fans that have moved to SF also meet up weekly for Viking games at Bell Tower. As the game neared the place filled up with purple and it was just like being back at home. The staff and people were all very fun and outgoing and would definitely recommend this place for all. Reasonably priced and good atmosphere! Thanks for a great time Bell Tower!
author: Daniel B.

description: We randomly picked this place and dropped in on a Saturday night and really enjoyed ourselves. The staff were so darn friendly we began to wonder if they were sneaking little nips of booze behind the bar! The food was pretty good and the prices were very good. The salt and pepper calamari was yum and the thai green beans were great (ask for dijon to go with them - better than the sauce).
author: Sarcastic T.

description: Stopped in here for the first time last night after many many times of passing it on my way to the Crepe House. It was pretty good and reasonably priced. We ordered a bottle of wine and shared a Caesar salad and pesto pizza. Service was friendly, but didn't check in very often. We did ask for bread when she brought us our wine but never got any. I'd come back and try it again. I liked their menu options and it's not too expensive.
author: Lindsay A.

description: Bell Tower is my go-to place as it has a little bit of everything and it's very reasonably priced. The best part about this place is their customer service. I come here frequently for dinner on Friday nights, and even when the place is packed, the servers make you feel like you are their only customer. They couldn't be friendlier!
author: Danielle C.

description: The Bell Tower has a great location, and the vibe is pretty relaxed.  On a sunny day it's really awesome to sit outside if a spot is available, inside it can get a bit too warm.  I would rate this place a 3 1/2 stars if I could.  The food is solid but I think often could use a bit more flavor.  Thats really my biggest gripe.  But don't get me wrong, I keep coming back....it's just not a wow.
author: Kirsten F.

description:
my co-worker and I came here for lunch a few months ago and it was pretty good...i ordered a plain cheeseburger which was decent and big in size, but the soup that my friend had wasnt too great...to me at least.

only bad thing was that our server totally forgot to put our order in...so instead of having a 45 minute lunch, we ended up staying there for almost 2 hours..so much for 1 hour lunch breaks right? 

she did make it up by buying us a free beer (even though they accidentally charged us and had to correct the bill at the end) when we tried to explain it to the manager who was giving us the bill, she was being a total bitch about it. 

hopefully my next experience will be better
author: M W.

description: It's a cool neighborhood spot.  I had some time to kill.  And I wandered in not knowing what to expect.  I can't comment on the food, but the service at the bar was good.  The atmosphere at Bell Tower is highly casual and laid back.  The painting by the bar was...umm, interesting, if you like looking at bare ladies backs while you're kicking back a few.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Very disappointing.  Started out well.  Tasty Bloody Mary, and the price was right - $5.  Good coffee.  Good service.  And then it all went horribly wrong.  I ordered the "Chicken-Andouille Hash."  The hyphen had me (erroneously) thinking that it was hash with Andouille sausage made from chicken.  Nope, there was the sausage, and then there were pieces of chicken breast!  Ewww.  Wrong.  The poached eggs were passable.  The potatoes in the hash were horrid - even though I asked for it "crisp" they were the standard SF boiled 'home fries."  My English muffin was barely toasted.  I won't be making a repeat appearance there for brunch.
author: darla s.

description: This is a great casual neighborhood place with surprisingly good food. It's most fun to sit at the bar when Barb, the owner, is bartending. They also have tables outside, so on a warm day it's a fun place to have margaritas and people watch on Polk St.
author: shoba d.

description: On a night when Kelly's was packed, we slipped into the Bell Tower for a much quieter drink.  Almost the only people in the place, it was just what we were looking for.  They have a nice bar with strong drinks and a solid bar menu for 11pm.  We had the roasted pepper & portabello sandy... fresh but need some more flavor and the fries were definitely pretty decent.
author: Tara G.

description:
I went to the Bell Tower last night, for dinner. My dinner companion had recommended it, and, backed up by my yelpsearch, I felt fairly confident going in. I'm not sure if it qualifies as a neighborhood bar with a great starters/salad/dinner menu, or as a neighborhood restaurant with an extended bar section! The bar area blends into the restaurant area seamlessly. Sometimes, a little tooooo seamlessly.

I'm not fond of the drunken rowdies, and my minor encounter with three of them in the curtained alcove outside the restroom solidified my opinion. WITH THAT SAID, I really liked the place! Friendly bartender (co-owner), friendly waitress Megan (we discussed the movie "Half Nelson") and a friendly bartender from another restaurant who came to visit (Greg). Casual environment; and really easy to get a table, even though it was 9:00 on a Saturday night with great weather!! 

I misordered my drink, so I left it at the bar. Not the fault of the bartender at all. That's on me. My dinner companion enjoyed his martini thoroughly. Dinner was comfort food. I ordered the stuffed chicken breast, which came with whipped potatoes and snowpeas. I can't tell you exactly what the chicken was stuffed with, but I do remember that it involved spinach, tomatoes and onion. It was all gooood. My friend ordered a full rack of baby back ribs, which was prepared with a hoisin sauce. They were accompanied by french fries and cole slaw. He ate every single rib, neatly I must say, and declared: "You know when a black man likes your ribs they're great ribs." He said the trick is in the pre-boiling; gets the pork more tender, and it comes off the bone easier. We also split a dessert: a chocolate cake thing with two scoops of ice cream and a little bit of sauce (not caramel, not chocolate, what was it? I forget but it was overly sweet for me). I'm glad the cake wasn't swimming in it.

FACTOIDS: Parking is horrendous, so I twirled around for a while, and ended up paying $10.00 to park at the Pacific & Polk parking set-up.  And happy to do so! Basically, these guys in fluorescent serapes take over a small business lot and park your car for you. The car can stay til 9am! So if I was planning to stay until the wee hours, this would have been a good place to stow my car. What is great about this place is that because it's a bar, it's open until 2am, and the kitchen is open until midnight!

I delete one star because of the bathroom. Not only is it unmarked, but it was a complete mess. It would be advisable to institute an hourly check on this place. Because it appears to be the only bathroom, it gets really thrashed.

Bill: For 2, including a couple of rounds of drinks, and a shared dessert, tax and tip: $70.00. This is a bargain!
author: Marja M.

description: This is a great neighborhood restaurant that I will certainly be frequenting a lot in the near future.  It's not only affordable, but both my boyfriend's and my dishes were excellent.  He had the rib eye (with the best creamed spinach ever) and I the cobb salad (which actually had the most moist delicious chicken strips on top ever!)  Best part too was the service - we have multiple servers and they were all so attentive.  My wine glass was never empty and neither were our water glasses.  A must visit!
author: Jen L.

description: The food is tasty, and it's a nice place to sit outside and people-watch on a sunny day.  Inside is a bit too sports-bar for me.  Service was slow but friendly.
author: Rochelle F.

description: We used to keep going to the Bell Tower with the dog on sunny days and then realized we were depriving our taste buds in leiu of outdoor seating, wich was always surprisingly easy to find. There is a flourless chocolate cake that they serve though, and I swear it came close to giving me an orgasm.
author: Colleen B.

description: The Friend and I came here for dessert on a random week night.  The place was very empty, which was aok by me.  No wait time is always a great thing.  We ordered some sort of chocolate cake.  It wasn't memorable.  I hope their food is better than their dessert.
author: Lynda N.

description: I work directly across the street from this place so Ive grown to like the food here. A few things i usually order: the chicken cesar salad, the pulled pork sandwach, the bell burger with mushrooms, or the grilled chicken sandwich. Prices are a bit high but cant complain for above average food.
author: Gordon L.

description: i've come here a couple times, once for brunch and once for dinner.  i was quite underwhelmed with the brunch.  both dishes we got (pulled pork sandwich and shrimp omelette) lacked flavor and just very satisfying.  dinner was was decent with what you'd expect with american bar fare.
author: Helen T.

description: It is a MINNESOTA VIKINGS hang-out! Can't wait for Sunday. They have an oversized purple throne in the back with the big screen. Friendly patrons & staff. Decent burger. I always make a few friends crying over my Vikes.
author: Vivien B.

description: I honestly didn't expect much given that there are so many great restaurants on Polk, but the food was surprisingly good.  The burgers and portobello wellington were delicious and the atmosphere was cozy.  A great spot to have a leisurely dinner and a beer.
author: Denise G.

description: Not a lot to say about this place, except that it has very affordable drinks.  Food is decent but seems like more of a bar setting.
author: Jennie J.

description: Satisfactory. I got a quesadilla. I wish the glasses for water were bigger.
author: Anita C.

description: Great place for brunch.  They have a solid brunch menu including eggs benedict and breakfast burritos.  Nice outdoor atmosphere on a nice day and prompt service.
author: K V.

description: Food is pretty good but when it takes 10 minutes to even get greeted, its a little frustrating.  The brie salad is awesome though! You just have to be in a very patient mood, because the service always fails.
author: Courtney M.

description: Very laid back neighborhood spot with decent food and friendly wait staff.  The pasta with shrimp was better than you can get at the tourist traps in North Beach.  Service was a bit slow, but unpretentious.  It was my birthday and the waitress sent over a free lemon drop shot. Good place to go on a warm afternoon if you want to have a casual dinner with friends.   Floor to ceiling windows good for people watching.
author: Angelique B.

description: I only went for drinks, not for food.  Nonetheless, I really enjoyed sitting outside over a glass of wine with some friends.  The glasses were nicely priced, and while the view of lombardi sports was not, I'm a sucker for outdoor seating.
author: Lindsay T.

description:
I'm always going down to the Bell Tower to meet someone or other for a drink.  OK, not always, but I've been down there a time or two.  It doesn't have its nose in the air like many other nearby gin joints, and the atmosphere is conducive to actually catching up with a friend rather than shouting over an obnoxious din.  

Bonus: Several months ago, I came to the Bell Tower on a not-so-great date.  I really appreciated the bartenderesses effort to ease my pain.  I think she cast me a few sympathetic glances, and she definitely topped off my wine glass.
author: Hannah J.

description:
i've been here many times and it's definitely a neighborhood joint.  if you're in the mood for bar food, you'll find decent fish & chips here.  the other plus is that you'll always find a seat inside with ok service.

the few times that i really enjoyed this place is when we managed to grab a table outside on a day with fantastic weather, and just sipped on some beers with the sun out....not a lot of places on polk street besides rex cafe where you can do that...
author: Nana S.

description: This is a very cute little place.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  I love the big purple chair at the top of the stairs that somehow completely separates the two areas of the restaurant.  I would like to give it 3.5 stars.  The food was good but the portions were way too big and the prices were a little high for what is was - pasta with chicken and white sauce.  I would have rather had less food and been charged a little less.  At least pasta is generally ok as leftovers.
author: Rise G.

description:
When I was little and my mother would have to call customer service for things (sears, bank, credit cards, etc.) it was always a tell-tale sign when she asked, "And who am I speaking with?"  I am, generally, a person who talks TOO much, but the TERRIBLE TERRIBLE dining experience I had at the Bell Tower actually left me speechless.  I didn't even have ability to ask the name of the horrific waiter who verbally assaulted me and my friend.  And, no, this isn't one of those ridiculous reviews where somebody tries to be pedantic a know-it-all-ish--I'm not talking food here (it was yummy and all that stuff, very Apple bee's with an edge, but sometimes that's what I want and I would have been happy with it).
We ordered around ten, and, though the place was clearing out, there were still seven or eight tables of people eating dinner.  So we ordered our wine at the bar and sat at a table by the window and ordered our food.  Twenty minutes later our conversation was was interrupted by the bartender (who I think meant well) waving his hands and saying "who-hoo, girls."  This was followed by the unthinkable: a waiter yelling across the restaurant (THE WAITER) saying, "HEY, GIRLS, PAY ATTENTION."  To WHAT?  To the wait-staff NOT Waiting on customers but yelling at them?
Our food was waiting at the bar, and so we went and got it--all three plates--it's not like we didn't order anything worthy of proper waiting, either...if that was his thought process...
Humiliated and shocked, I put the plates down and promptly said the obvious: "I don't want to eat this, or pay for this, or be here.  I can't believe someone just spoke to a CUSTOMER like that."  At this point I decided there must be some misunderstanding, and yeah, pretty pissed off, I walked over to the waiter and said, "Hi, if you expect customers to pick up their own orders you should tell them that when they order."  Guess what he said?  "I didn't take your order, you can leave."
Enough said.
So, sadly, this might have been one waiter and the rest might be great (after reading other reviews, though, it doesn't sound like it.)  Even more sadly, it doesn't matter.  I haven't been that mad in a long, long time.  I was seeing red, I still am.  I'm nearly thirty, I'm not a GIRL and I don't care how old someone looks, you don't ever YELL at them when they've just purchased a fifty dollar meal (or call them GIRL or just generally act like a jerk).
