Screw this place, I'd rather eat dirt than set foot in this  place.  Some body needs to buy an etiquette book, tie it to a brick and throw in through the window.  While I'd happily do the throwing, I wouldn't waste my money on a book or string.
author: Jamie H.

description: Good food and decent bar. Although I tried to get Barb (owner) to carry my beer for a long time on tap but was oinly able to convince her to carry it in the bottle. The burgers are some of the best on Polk Street and the crowd is always fun. I had the pleasure of living up the street for a year so I know this place well. You will enjoy it.
author: Jack H.

description: Best Mac and Cheese in the city.  It is baked on top and creamy in the center and the bottom.  It has a hint of jalapeno and you can add other things (although i prefer it plain).  The pulled pork sandwich is really good as well.  Overall i always walk out of here stuffed because the portions are generous without the expense.  Staff is always friendly and very attentive.  My favorite server is the Southie looking dude with a goatee that looks like he just came in from chopping wood in the back...
author: Ryan A.

description: My favorite neighborhood place. Quick service, tasty food and a fun, low-key vibe. They play great music, show all the games (no volume, which is a nice change) and have helpful and friendly staff. If you can manage to snag a table, nothing is better than sitting outside with a drink on weekends!
author: Caity S.

description: Very friendly waitstaff, unusually large tables, and a plush purple chair combine to make this a perfect storm of dining goodness.  I didn't really try the food, but the people who were eating it seemed pleased.
author: Sam M.

description: The Bell is a Polk Street treasure. Great food until midnight. Pleasant bartenders until 2 AM. Try the fish and chips or the French Onion soup. The quesadilla is also delicious. A bunch of servers from Harris' and The House of Prime Rib hang out here after work.. So you know it's good. I love this place.
author: Nitram N.

description:
This place is great. Go there regularly for drinks/and or food. The Chicken entree they have for dinner is AMAZING, The french Onion Soup is great. The Burgers are Quality, The service is awesome, they have TV's always on with what ever game is on...

pretty much is a staple in my going out routine..
author: Mark B.

description: The Bell Tower is casual and tasty.  Great place to get wasted on a nice day, or grab a tasty, reasonably priced meal.  Service was good, food came out relatively fast, but it does get busy so grab a drink at the bar, it's worth the wait.  Favorite item is either the pizza or french onion soup.
author: Mark W.

description: Wow all this negativity but yet...wait....The Belltower has a great menu.  I prefer the bar/lunch menu but I can say I have had some great meals there.  There are a few non-overwhelming HDTV's for the games but you don't get a sports bar feel.  I live so close I could yell my order and I am hungry.  I'll make it short.  If you are going to get a starter the baked pistacio crusted brie with apple slices is kick-ass.  Personally, the pulled pork sandwich is my favorite.  Honestly, the only thing I don't really like about the place is the occasional night when it gets packed.  I don't much care for its night bar atmosphere but they have a good & inexpensive food and drink.   And a HUGE purple chair for you.  Yum
author: Winthrop B.

description: I'm really only reviewing The Bell Tower for it's Brunch, as that is all I've had there. That being said it is one of my favorite brunch spots for three reasons: great menu, great sunlight and Barbie! She's one of the friendliest bartenders in town and can lift your spirits right out of your hangover, through your first bloody (which are excellent...AND they carry Square One Organic Vodka) and straight through your meal, delivering you to pre-brunch coma with a smile on your face. Keep it up Barbie...I'll see you soon!
author: H. Joseph E.

description: good, larger portions, affordable.  quality regulars at the bar--a throwback joint.  Thanks Barbie.
author: Ken H.

description: The location is great - on a nice corner in the sun on Polk street. The atmosphere is nice inside - good combo of bar with TVs and plenty of tables for serving food. The wait staff is very nice but the food is only so/so. They've got something to serve for every meal so it's convenient for the locals to get breakfast, lunch or dinner...but I can't say that any dish is really that awe-inspiring. Go here if you want to grab a convenient bite with friends before going out....or to catch a morning cocktail while watching some sports on TV...but I wouldn't go out of my way to get here.
author: Carter F.

description: A good neighborhood place to grab a bite and a beer and contemplate the interesting wall artwork. Try the mussels (delicious broth with sausage and bread for dipping), pulled pork sandwich, french onion soup, and pizzas- yummy crust.     Its not expensive per se, but I still think the prices are a bit high for what it is.
author: L C.

description: Really, I don't get it.  Everyone loves this place.  The only really great thing about it is the bartender, Barbie.  If you see her Thursday - Saturday after about 12:30 a.m. you are sure to get a free shot and she will probably do it with you and laugh in your face if you wince.  If you go for lunch, make sure you have 2 hours to spare and grab your own silverware or ketchup because the service is really slow and not concerned with the little things, like filling up drinks or getting your order right.  I will go there for drinks and occassionally to eat when my friends bully me.
author: Jamie F.

description:
Meh. 
I've had better brunches.

The Bell Tower is okay, but when I'm on Polk I prefer a more funky, cheap eats kind of a place...
author: Nicole R.

description: Three stars about says it. Food always sounded great on the menu but was pretty bland once it hit my mouth. Waitresses always seem soooo stressed out and busy when it really wasn't. I bet it is better as a bar.
author: Sean W.

description: I recently spent a couple afternoons at the bar, and had a great time.  The food was good, I had the pulled pork sandwich one time and the bell burger the other.  Both well prepared and tasty.   Barbie, the owner, was behind the bar one time, and she is a lot of fun.  Makes good drinks and enjoys bantering with the customers, with an occasional off color joke or remark to spice things up.  Lots of regulars here, but friendly, not inside turf defenders.  Great neighborhood hangout
author: Martin L.

description: good food. good service. good beer. good drinks. good menu. good vibe. ill be back for more sometime.  oh!! and i thought that the paintings in the restaurant were good too!!
author: joe c.

description:
5/21/08 12:25pm

Dear Barbara, 

I can not tell you how upset I am with your restaurant. The experience was truly horrible. I came here with a friend for dinner last night and I swear, I wanted to strangle one of your servers. She was an Asian chick, roughly 5'3, long black hair who has freckles on her face ... I walk in, wait almost 10 minutes before I walk over to the bar and ask one of the servers if we were supposed to write our names down. She told me to hold -- which i did, but after 5 mins, I ask again, and she snapped at me saying to wait. STRIKE 1. My friend and I walk back to the front, and we wait... There was an empty table right next to us. Then, the girl comes over asking how many people. I kindly tell her 2, and she said it's a 20 minute wait. I ask her if we could sit at the table next to us and she said no. a FIRM no with an attitude. STRIKE 2. I understand your restaurant is located in Snob Hill, but she didn't have to come off snobby... I ask her why not, and she said something that i didn't expect. "If a party with more than 3 people come, they get the table." "Did they make a reservation?" "No, but just 20 minutes because I don't want to move your food and clean the table." STRIKE 3. I can totally understand if reservations were made but it wasn't... But then again, I thought that's part of the tipping process, is it not? We could've easily left but after waiting 15 minutes and finding another 10 minutes to find parking, we didn't feel like finding another place... i couuld not believe how she did not want to seat us because she didn't feel like wiping the table. Is that the way your restaurant is run? I highly doubt it. I love dogs, and one of the reasons my friend suggested this place is simply because he has been a frequent flyer at your place telling me that your restaurant is comforting American food. I am a foodie. I am a diner. Thankfully YELP has given me the chance to bitch about the horrendous service I've encountered. On the other hand, our server was truly pleasant -- she was this young British gal, in her late 20s with glasses, full of smiles, and very accomodating, every other word was "CHEERS!" I swear when i write this, the Asian girl has seriously got to watch her potty mouth.  Your $16.50 Baby Back Hoison BBQ Ribs were pretty tasty, but I wasn't really digging your cole slaw...My friend's $20 special of a roasted hen with a side of broccoli and spanish rice was good.. the broccoli was superb, never had i had such fresh broccoli in ages! I have to admit, I was really pleased with the variety of food Bell Tower served from sandwiches, pizza, and bar food ...  I can't help but to give you a guys a 1 star because the service totally made me speechless, perhaps you can retrain her on what customer service is...Anyhow, I don't know if I would want to give Bell Tower a 2nd chance... As an owner of the restaurant, I hope you can take my review and the many others who have rated this place with low ratings as constructive criticism, as it is nothing personal, but maybe to the server it is... All in all, I wish you the very best in the future in hiring friendlier servers ... 


Yours truly,
J
author: Jennifer S.

description: This is one of those experiences where I can say... I'm not planning on ever coming back... I went here wanting to get some old fashion American style ribs.. I walked inside and the waitresses were just talking to each other and i stood inside for awhile and then i was fed up so I asked the bar tender "Eric" if he could help me with my order. He gave me a menu and I looked at the ribs that I wanted, and he said "I'm sorry sir, but we aren't serving dinner until 5" he said "but if you want ribs just order 2 rib appetizers." Eric was very helpful so i didn't mind tipping 6 bucks for my take out order... But the food kinda sucked.. The fries were good... and the coleslaw was tasty too, But the ribs were not the tender fall of the bone ribs but more like cardboard stuck to a big stick and covered with a maple syrup barbecue sauce.. The only reason I'm giving this place 2 1/2 stars because the bartender was so cool and helpful..
author: Bradley P.

description: A place that is walking distance with a kitchen open until 12 AND enough vegetarian fare to keep an eater like me satisfied.  Done.  and Done :)
author: Anjali K.

description: great neighborhood joint: wonderful food, good service and a great place to hang w/the locals or meet your neighbors!
author: Adam P.

description: I must agree with most of the people here and say that yes, the service is slow and not all that great.  Not being a huge service guy, it didn't bother me that much but just to be upfront about it.  But hey, the food here really is great.  I've been twice, and literally every single entree brought rave reviews from everyone partaking, both occasions.  You think you're going to get just typical bar food walking in, but trust me, it's considerably better than that.  Cheers to Bell Tower, cool place, good location, great food.  San Francisco as a town, being a hellish god forsaken place to live, I'm very glad this place exists to balance that out just a tad.
author: Jeff M.

description: standard american fare (decent burgers/steak).  good for large groups.  fast service, good music.  it's definitely stand out in any way though.  i'd recommend going if you're looking for a nice dinner with a group of friends but you're much more interested in hanging out with the friends than in savoring the food.

description: Great place, awesome food, the appetizers are super enormous and at super good price. It can get a little loud, but is a really good option
author: Guadalupe T.

description: The price for food and drink is ridiculously low. Its worth the trip over the bridge.
author: Big Dog Daddy B.

description: Ok, so if you check out my other reviews, you'll notice I have a guilt complex about low ratings. Hence the three stars when it should probably be two. It takes a lot to get me to write a review when I've been living in LA for six months (i've heard enough) and I barely had time to visit SF much less write about it, but I feel like I have to say something.  So the first time I went here, we got served after roughly twenty minutes with no silverware. Hey, no prob, its late (8). "Excuse me can we have some silverware?" (Nod). 5 minutes of staring at my salad. "Excuse me (I'm asking a different person) can we get a couple forks when you have a chance? (in a very sweet tone)?" No response.  About eight full minutes staring at our food, until I get up, walk to the side station and get myself some silverware. Putting food down without utensils is pretty high on the list of waitressing f**k ups, I know because i've done it. But you can bet I sprinted/hurtled to resolve that awkward situation when i was serving. Ive been here three times. Twice we were asked what we were ordering to see if we were allowed to sit at the tables (the place was not full). Once with a party of  eight we were instructed to "take out our IDs and hand them to the bartender." Everyone except me was approaching 30. Condescending service isn't really my thing, hence the move back to SF (permanently) from lala land in two weeks.
author: Katie T.

description: Since I'm relatively new to the area - I was definitely on the look out for a nice "Local" hangout. I stumbled upon Bell Tower during an evening of shopping on Polk.  Called a friend to meet me there and within the hour was enjoying a great meal close to home.  I love the fact that they have 2 menu's to choose from (Bar and Regular) If you just feel like a lighter meal of appetizers and salad, BT is perfect.  Otherwise, you will find on their regular menus a nice array or stable, hearty meals.  Portions are good and the quality is good for the money. Try the Rib-eye steak with a Pear Cider to wash it down.
author: Caryn L.

description: had an awful dinner there once. just awful. can't even talk about it. it wasn't so much the food than it was the company. though the food was pretty bad.
author: Boyd W.

description: What a waste of space Bell Tower is.  A perfectly good space on Polk too.  I've been here twice and both times I had TERRIBLE service.  Forgetting orders, forgetting to refill beverages, forgetting to bring ketchup I asked for 30 min ago.  It's not like the two times I went it was packed and busy, because it wasn't.  Is this where all the reject waiters end up when they are fired from normal restaurants?

description: mediocre food and a rude waitress.  one time there was one too many
author: Audrey L.

description: I came here with my fiance last Sunday for brunch and it was very tasty. It was not as stuck-up as Rose's Cafe nor did it have a long line like Ella's. We were able to sit at a table as we walked in and the order came out pretty fast. Not a super warm place, but still nice. The food was yummy- I had the special (fritata) and my fiance had one of the omlettes. Very yummy and large portions. But the fresh-squeezed OJ is soooooo good (get your Vit C on!!). And it really is fresh-squeezed- not like other places that have the Odwalla jugs under the counter. The large is about four bucks- but totally worth it. Plus- it has a full bar (for mimosa and bloody mary) and large screen TV's so you don't miss any Sunday sports.
author: Ofelia S.

description: This just seems like a cool place to hang, grab a drink, maybe some food and catch up with friends - either indoors or outside.  We went mid-week around 6 pm and it definitely had a low-key vibe.  Didn't eat but menu looks quite tasty.

author: morgan t.

description:
3.5 stars.  
This place is a good, solid, neighborhood standby.  Nothing about it is amazing.  The appetizers are one of the best things about this place.  It is definitely relaxed, comfortable and spacious, plus it has a decent number of beers on tap.  It's great for a chill night or a place to start out post-work, especially if you're with a group of friends.  It's got an interesting, eclectic crowd, three tvs, and a ridiculously huge chair that looks like it was made from a crown royal bag.  
I recommend the tuna tacos, which are made with ahi tuna and a semi-spicy remoulade (they're delicious, even for a girl who's not crazy about seafood).  The chicken sandwich is a pretty solid lunch option too.  I hear their burgers are delicious and a friend of mine is slightly obsessed with their potato boats.  Stick to the apps & sandwiches though - they are more solid than the entrees.
If you're sitting down, the service is a little hit or miss.  You'll usually have more than one waitress, which is great.  Some of the waitresses are awesome.  I've had one or two that were a little inattentive and one who was downright unfriendly.   One unfriendly waitress certainly won't ruin any night at this place though.  Go have a good time.  And sit by the windows - makes for great Polk Street people watching.
